DISCORD POLICY HUB Topics Safety Library Violent Extremism Policy Explainer Violent Extremism At Discord, we take a firm stance against violent extremism. We do not tolerate presence activities of violent extremist organizations other violent groups. Users are not allowed to use Discord to organize, promote, support violent extremist activities beliefs. term violent extremist organization describes groups that promote a political, ideological, religious agenda tolerate, advocate for, use violence to achieve their goals. This policy covers a wide range of actors, such as terrorist groups, violent extremist organizations, violent hate groups. We also include informal groups networks, as well as paramilitary non-state armed groups, that are organized around extremist beliefs under this policy. Even if not associated with a violent extremist group, users may not share promote content associated with these groups content that advocates for violent extremist beliefs on Discord. As one of highest-harm areas of abuse, violent extremist organizing is also subject to our Off-Platform Behaviors Policy. How to Avoid Violating This Policy Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #5. Resources If you another user is in immediate danger, please contact law enforcement right away let them know what's going on, regardless of information you're able to provide. Violence Graphic Content Policy Explainer Violent Graphic Media At Discord, we are committed to creating a safe positive online environment. We do not allow uploading sharing of any material depicting real violence, gore, animal cruelty. Violent graphic media can include various forms of content, such as portraying death injury, showing detailed physical harm happening to individuals, depicting infliction of pain, fear, distress to animals. Glorification Incitement of Violence glorification incitement of acts of violence pose a serious threat to well-being mental health of individuals, as well as safety of our communities on off Discord. We have a strict policy against any form of threats harm towards others. We may escalate threats to law enforcement if we believe it is required to prevent immediate harm. aGlorification of violencea refers to act of admiring celebrating acts of physical harm towards humans that cause death, injury, harm. aIncitementa of violence includes organizing, coordinating, promoting, encouraging acts of violence to be carried out. How to Avoid Violating These Policies Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #5 #12. Resources If you another user is in immediate danger, please contact law enforcement right away let them know what's going on, regardless of information you're able to provide. Unauthorized Copyright Access Policy Explainer Unauthorized Copyright Access At Discord, we take a firm stance against violating intellectual property rights. We respond to facially-valid reports of copyright infringement in compliance with Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) other applicable intellectual property laws. Our Copyright & IP Policy explains this process in detail. This policy prohibits activity that provides others with direct, unauthorized access to copyrighted material (such as via live-streams) as well as efforts to coordinate such access. Coordination includes services offers for services that facilitate unauthorized sale, purchase, trade of copyrighted material. This policy also covers types of activity that infringe on rights of copyright owners, including distribution of tools that get around copyright protections. Exploits for online games (also called acheatsa ahacksa) fall under this policy if they circumvent anti-cheating software impermissibly modify a gameas code files. How to Avoid Violating This Policy Respect intellectual property rights of others - donat stream provide access to copyrighted works if you are not authorized to do so How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users affected individuals can report policy violations by emailing a report to copyright@discordapp.com. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #24. Teen Child Safety Policy Explainer Child Sexualization Content that sexualizes children has no place on Discord in society. We don't tolerate any kind of text media a real generated a on our platform that portrays children in a sexual manner. This type of content causes serious harm to victims. We consider Off-Platform Behaviors when reviewing content under this policy due to high-harm nature of offense. We report illegal child sexual abuse material (CSAM) grooming to National Center for Missing & Exploited Children. Users who post this content are permanently banned from Discord. Inappropriate Sexual Conduct with Teens Grooming Discord has a zero-tolerance policy towards individuals who engage in sexual grooming, extortion (sometimes referred to as asextortiona), sexual exploitation of minors. Users who engage in this behavior will be permanently removed from Discord on a first offense. We consider anyone under age of 18 to be a minor anyone 18 over to be an adult. Given high-harm nature of this content, we will also consider off-platform evidence as explained in our Off-Platform Behaviors Policy when reviewing content under this policy. Teen Self-Endangerment We take safety of our younger users seriously don't allow children under age of 13 to have a Discord account. We want our teen users to be able to express themselves freely on Discord while also taking steps to ensure these users donat engage in risky behaviors that might endanger their safety wellbeing. We also donat allow servers that encourage facilitate dating between teens, even if run by teens themselves. These types of spaces can make our teen communities targets for others who may want to exploit them can inadvertently facilitate other violations of this policy. While we understand that teens may want to help each other stay safe online, we cannot allow users communities to put themselves in potential harmas way. This means that we will take action against users servers that we reasonably believe are trying to abaita entrap others into inappropriate interactions with teenage users. We want teens to be safe on Discord, but we also donat want to penalize them for expressing themselves exploring their identities. We expect that some users might violate this policy without realizing it, so we provide warnings to teen users where possible. However, for their own safety, we permanently remove a useras account from platform if we see consistent violations of this policy if user appears to be in immediate risk of harm. How to Avoid Violating These Policies Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #6, #7, #8. Resources If your sensitive photos have been shared published online, following resources can help: If you someone else is in danger we encourage you to consider contacting law enforcement right away letting them know what's going on, regardless of information you're able to provide. If you a friend needs mental health support, we encourage you to use following resources: If youare outside of United States: If youare in United States: Although we're not affiliated with staff at any of these hotlines, they're trained to help guide callers with ways to address things that are bothering them. Suicide Self-Harm Policy Explainer Suicide Self-Harm Risk At Discord, we are committed to creating a safe online environment preventing harm. We understand importance of a strong community positive surroundings when it comes to mental well-being. We do not allow coordinating acts of self-harm showing harmful actions towards oneself. Self-harm is when someone deliberately hurts themselves physically. Examples of self-harm behaviors include intentionally ending one's life, engaging in disordered eating patterns, etc. Self-Harm Encouragement Promotion Using Discord to glorify promote suicide self-harm is not allowed under any circumstance. We believe in fostering a positive healthy environment where users can come together to support one another. However, it is important that these discussions do not promote normalize self-harm behaviors. Our goal is to ensure that everyone feels safe supported. How to Avoid Violating These Policies How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #11. Resources If you another user is in immediate danger, please contact law enforcement right away let them know what's going on, regardless of information you're able to provide. Other resources, such as lifeline numbers, can be found here. Sexual Solicitation Policy Explainer Sexual Solicitation At Discord, we prohibit sexual solicitation on our service. Sexual solicitation involves requests from people looking for offering sexual services in exchange for compensation. This includes activities that would facilitate encourage in-person sexual meetups, such as advertising promoting sexual services, as well as coordinating logistics payments for in-person sexual services. This policy covers adult-to-adult conduct. Any instances of adult-to-child sexual solicitation will be reviewed under our Teen Child Safety Policies. How to Avoid Violating This Policy If you see this content being shared in a direct message in a server, report it to us immediately, block user, leave DM server How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #27 Sexual Content Policy Explainer Sexual Content At Discord, we believe users should feel comfortable expressing themselves. Thatas why we allow our adult users (18+) to post share sexual content, so long as it aligns with our policies. We also understand that not everyone wants to see this type of content, that this content isnat appropriate for our younger users. In order to maintain a safe environment for all, we have limitations on where sexually explicit content can be posted on Discord how it can be accessed. [Sensitive language content warning] Discord defines sexually explicit content as any content that presents genitalia, female nipples, anus, sexual activity without censoring obscuring it. Sexually suggestive content is any content that may evoke sexual arousal without being overt in description depiction of genitalia, female nipples, anus, sexual activity. While we may make exceptions for educational newsworthy content, in general, all sexually explicit content on Discord is considered age-restricted should only be posted accessed by users who are 18 years of age older. Sexually explicit content should not be posted in general open access areas within Discord: Servers can host sexually explicit content within their server as long as it does not violate our policies, server owner moderators are all over age of 18 any channel where sexually explicit content is hosted is marked with an age-restricted label. You can learn how to apply an age-restricted label to your server channels here. Please note that we may also place an age-gate on an entire server if it appears that that server is primarily being used to host sexual content. Finally, although we want to provide adult users with freedom to express their sexuality engage with sexual content at their own choice risk, sexual content that is likely to lead to serious bodily harm death is disallowed even if consensually shared consumed. In addition, Discord has a zero-tolerance policy towards those who engage in sexual grooming, extortion (sometimes referred to as asextortiona), sexual exploitation of children teens under age of 18. Learn more about our Teen Child Safety Policies. How to Avoid Violating This Policy How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #9. Platform Manipulation Policy Explainer Platform Abuse Discord is a place where friends come to hang out. As part of our goal to provide users with a good on-platform experience, we prohibit platform abuse. term platform abuse refers to activities that disrupt alter experience of Discord users. Sending unsolicited bulk messages interactions (or spam) is one of most common ways user experience is disrupted. Spam can be sent by automated accounts designed for this purpose (spambots), normal user accounts that manually execute spammy actions, as well as by user accounts modified to perform automated actions (self-bots). Making modifications to Discord client for purpose of spam any other reason is not allowed under this policy. We will also take action on accounts registered for purpose of carrying out platform abuse. This includes automated registration of accounts as a group for spamming a regardless of their message-send rate. We will also remove servers facilitating platform abuse. This includes but is not limited to spaces distributing: spambots, server araida tools, account-creation tools, token generators, CAPTCHA-solving services, other spam tools. Inauthentic Engagement Inauthentic engagement is closely tied to, but distinct from issue of spam. Both result in an overall lower-quality experience for users. Engagement in context of this policy is defined as any user interaction with Discordas service product features. We will consider engagement to be inauthentic if it is purchased, induced (like promises of financial reward), fraudulent (for example, it involves fake accounts). Individuals are prohibited from attempting to manipulate engagement metrics, artificially inflating server membership (for example, via ajoin-for-join,a ainvite rewards,a purchasing fake members), selling artificial engagement services for online platforms. Individuals also may not attempt to buy sell Discord assets, such as accounts, usernames, servers, server permissions, custom server invite links (also called avanity URLsa). How to Avoid Violating These Policies How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #13, #14, #15, #16. Off-Platform Behaviors Policy Explainer Off-Platform Behaviors We want people to enjoy Discord, but never at expense of others. Our Community Guidelines contain a list of content behavioral rules users must follow while on our service. Our Off-Platform Behaviors Policy functions as a layer on top of these rules. It is different from our other policies in that it is solely concerned with activity occurring off of Discord. term off-platform behavior refers to any activity not occurring directly on Discord. This includes activity in other online spaces in physical world. This policy covers activity involving physical harm of others that presents a risk of causing physical harm to others. We will only take action under this policy: (1) If we can confirm that harmful behavior has taken place; and, (2) are able to confidently link individual(s) responsible to a Discord account and/or server. A Note on Enforcement of This Policy We may decline to take action against an account server tied to egregious harmful behavior when we are confident there is minimal risk of physical harm coming to others as a result of allowing individual group to remain on our service. following four considerations are taken into account: How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference introduction of our Community Guidelines. Non-Consensual Adult Intimate Media Policy Explainer Non-Consensual Adult Intimate Media At Discord, we take a firm stance against sharing, distribution, taking, creation of sexually explicit sexually suggestive content of other people without their knowledge consent. term non-consensual sharing distribution of adult intimate media means sharing intimate sexually explicit content without person's knowledge consent, whether it's with a group one person. This includes media taken created without an individualas knowledge consent (for example, hidden cameras, "creepshots", videos of sexual assault, AI-generated sexual images such as "deepfakes"), as well as media that was originally obtained created with consent (for example, within context of a private intimate relationship, sometimes known as arevenge porna aimage-based sexual abusea). In order to protect victims stop proliferation of non-consensual adult intimate media (NCAIM), we will remove confirmed instances of this content. We take threat to share distribute NCAIM seriously will take appropriate action covered under our Threats Policy. This includes threat to share non-consensual intimate media unless a demand is met, otherwise known as sextortion. This policy covers content of adults only, for content involving minors, please see our Teen Child Safety Policies. How to Avoid Violating This Policy Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #10. Misinformation Policy Explainer Health Misinformation At Discord, we are committed to creating a safe online environment preventing harm. We do not allow promotion organization of communities that share false misleading health information that is likely to result in harm. This includes anti-vaccination claims, dangerous unsupported treatments for health issues, distortion of disease information, any content that may negatively impact resolving public health emergencies. We rely on credible sources for accurate health information a including World Health Organization (WHO) Centers for Disease Control Prevention (CDC). While users can share their own personal health experiences on Discord, we prohibit false misleading health information that is likely to result in harm. Civic Disruption We are committed to upholding integrity of civic processes doing our part to ensure a fair democratic environment around world. We donat allow posting, promotion, organization of communities that share false misleading claims that could disrupt undermine civic processes. In addition, we do not tolerate promotion organization of attempts to intimidate voters activities that suppress civic participation. A civic process is any procedure run by governments international political institutions that relies on public participation to make a decision reach outcomes that impact our society. Examples of civic processes include elections, referendums, censuses. We will remove harmful misinformation about civic processes when we become aware of it. We will determine truthfulness of claims by looking at independent, third-party sites like PolitiFact, FactCheck.org, Snopes. How to Avoid Violating These Policies Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #17. Identity Authenticity Policy Explainer Identity Misrepresentation Discord is a place where people come to hang out with friends build communities. An important condition for building healthy communities is trust in authenticity of interactions. Discord prohibits users from misrepresenting their identity on our platform in a deceptive harmful way. This includes creating fake profiles as well as attempts to impersonate an individual, group, organization. Although pseudonymous accounts are allowed on Discord, our rules prohibit fake profiles impersonation. We define a fake profile as an online identity for an individual entity that does not exist. Some fake user profiles can be identified by their use of stolen generated images as avatars. Impersonation means pretending to be a real individual, group, organization. This typically involves use of identity details (such as name likeness) to deceive others about ownership affiliation of a digital profile. Impersonation on Discord can occur at account server level. Platform Ban Evasion We may take enforcement actions when we discover a violation of our Community Guidelines a up to including permanent removal from Discord. We typically reserve permanent actions like user server bans for severe violations that could negatively impact user safety, integrity of our service, rights of others. Permanently removing a violative account community can lessen harms from these groups help prevent abuse from occurring in future. You may not circumvent platform-level bans that we take against your account server. We use term ban to refer to permanent removal of an account community for a violation of our rules. Platform ban evasion refers to efforts to return to Discord after having an account community permanently removed from our service. Platform ban evasion includes creation of new accounts communities to bypass permanent removal; it also includes use reuse of an existing account community to avoid a platform-level ban. How to Avoid Violating These Policies Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #18 #19. Human Trafficking Policy Explainer Human Trafficking Human trafficking is an abhorrent crime that Discord takes very seriously. We will remove accounts servers engaged in this activity may report suspected illegal activity to law enforcement. These activities include, but are not limited to, recruitment, transportation, transfer, harboring sale of victims, as well as any forced, deceptive, fraudulent attempts used to invite transfer victims for purpose of exploitation. Any suspicions of such activities will be reported to law enforcement, accounts servers involved may be removed from our service. How to Avoid Violating This Policy We will take statements of desire intent to engage in illegal activities at face-value. If you see this content being shared in a direct message in a server, report it to us immediately, block user, leave DM server How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #27. Hateful Conduct Policy Explainer Hate Speech Discord is a place where people come to hang out with friends. As part of our goal to promote acceptance inclusivity, we prohibit hate speech, discrimination, prejudice. We donat allow hateful conduct use of hate speech while on Discord. This includes use of hate symbols denial of historical mass atrocities. We define hate speech to include any expression that degrades, vilifies, dehumanizes individuals, incites intense feelings of hostility towards defined groups, promotes harm based on protected characteristics. Protected characteristics at Discord encompass various aspects, such as age; caste; color; disability; ethnicity; family responsibilities; gender; gender identity; housing status; national origin; race; refugee immigration status; religious affiliation; serious illness; sex; sexual orientation; socioeconomic class status; source of income; status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual violence, stalking; as well as weight size. However, we understand that there are nuances will give exceptions in instances of reclaimed language, satire, educational documentary purposes. use of satire must be obvious we will not allow users to deflect blame retroactively by claiming their statements were made ironically as a joke. Hate Symbols Imagery use sharing of hate symbols imagery is strictly prohibited on Discord. This policy extends to all images uploaded shared on Discord, including profiles, channels, servers. Hate symbols include acronyms, numbers, phrases, logos, flags, gestures other miscellaneous symbols used to promote incite hatred, threats, discrimination, violence against other people on basis of protected characteristics. Symbols that represent supremacy of one group over another are also prohibited under this policy. However, exceptions may be made in instances where hate symbols are shared for educational, historical, newsworthy, culturally appropriate non-hateful purposes. How to Avoid Violating These Policies If you find yourself in a server that is sharing this type of content, report it consider removing yourself from space How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #4. Gambling Policy Explainer Gambling Users may not use Discord to coordinate participate in illegal gambling. Users are responsible for complying with relevant gambling laws regulation.A We define illegal gambling as any gambling activities that break applicable laws regulations. We define gambling as act of placing a bet wager involving money something of value on an event activity with an uncertain outcome. Our gambling policy is violated if following criteria are met: A 1. There is a payment wager of real-world value to participate (this includes betting entry fees) 2. Prizes of real-world value are awarded 3. outcome of game is predominantly determined by chance 4. activity is prohibited by applicable gaming laws regulations How to Avoid Violating This Policy How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #26. Doxxing Policy Explainer Doxxing At Discord, we take a firm stance against doxxing. We do not tolerate anyone putting somebody in danger by leaving them vulnerable to data breaches, targeted harassment, real-world threats such as physical harm. Doxxing is when someone shares Personally Identifiable Information, PII, of another person without their permission with intention to cause harm. A dox is collection of Personally Identifiable Information of another person. Personally Identifiable Information (PII) includes any information that could be used to identify an individual, such as a name, home address, social security number, banking information, driver's license number, any other sensitive data. How to Avoid Violating This Policy Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #3. Resources If you another user is in immediate danger, please contact law enforcement right away let them know what's going on, regardless of information you're able to provide. Discord Support Abuse Policy Explainer Discord Support Abuse Misleading abusive reports requests impact ability of Discord staff to respond to issues raised by our users. Individuals may not submit false, misleading, abusive reports requests to Discordas support teams. We consider support teams to be any team at Discord that directly supports interacts with users, partners, developers that respond to legal notices about Discord users from individuals entities authorized to make such requests. We will consider reports requests false misleading if they contain demonstrably untrue information submitted with intent to manipulate staff into taking a desired action. We will consider reports requests abusive if they harass make violent threats towards agents, support teams, Discord any of its other employees. How to Avoid Violating This Policy Do not mislead Discordas support staff when you are submitting a report request. False misleading reports impact our ability to respond quickly effectively. How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #23. Deceptive Practices Policy Explainer Financial Scams Online scams can cause financial harm to people in real world. We work hard to keep Discord a safe place for users to connect with their communities a that way, they wonat have to worry about people trying to trick them for illegal dishonest reasons. Individuals may not use our service to promote, coordinate, perform any type of financial scam. Financial scams generally attempt to take advantage of individuals by making false promises of goods, services, other financial benefits. These schemes try to turn a profit by defrauding victims tricking them into revealing sensitive information. A non-exhaustive list of financial scams includes: Ponzi schemes, pyramid schemes, advance-fee fraud, market manipulation (including apump-and-dumpa schemes), romance scams, employment scams, phishing scams. Malicious Conduct We want users to enjoy a safe, secure experience on our service. Accordingly, we do not allow activity that could damage compromise security of an account, computer network, system. We use term amalicious conducta to refer to phishing, use of malware, denial-of-service (DoS) attacks, among other conduct. Phishing is a deceptive technique used to trick others into revealing sensitive information (such as logins payment details). Individuals may phish for information with manipulated links fake websites that appear genuine to convince targets they are trustworthy. Malware is any type of software used for malicious purposes a including theft of account credentials other sensitive information. Denial-of-service (DoS) attacks flood a target with traffic to make resource temporarily permanently unavailable. Fraud Services We will permanently remove fraudulent services all efforts to facilitate illegal behavior when we become aware of it. We use term fraud services to refer to coordinated activity that directly attempts is part of a larger attempt to fraudulently generate profit at expense of others. Profit can mean monetary property gain secured from a third party. One activity disallowed under this policy is offering access to illicitly-obtained goods a including, but not limited to: account credentials, credit card information, personally identifiable information, cracked commodity goods. Coordinated efforts to defraud businesses, price gouging, forgery, money laundering are also not allowed. How to Avoid Violating These Policies We take violations of these policies seriously will take statements of desire intent to engage in illegal activities at face value. Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #20, #21, #22. Dangerous Regulated Goods Policy Explainer Dangerous Regulated Goods Discord prioritizes safety preventing harm on our platform. Therefore, we do not allow anyone to buy, sell, trade any potentially dangerous regulated goods. Dangerous regulated goods include but are not limited to: firearms; explosives; tactical gear; imitation firearms; illicit drugs; marijuana; alcohol; tobacco. We consider a good to be adangerousa if it has reasonable potential to cause assist in causing real-world, physical harm to individuals, aregulateda if there are laws in place that restrict purchase, sale, trade, ownership of good. How to Avoid Violating This Policy Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of This Policy Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. For more information on this policy, please reference our Community Guidelines #25. Bullying, Harassment, Threats Policy Explainer Bullying Harassment At Discord, we take a firm stance against harassment bullying. Bullying harassment is defined as intentional actions that are meant to cause distress intimidate individuals. This type of behavior can have serious consequences cause lasting harm to victims, as well as those who witness it. We are committed to fostering a positive inclusive environment on Discord, we expect all users to treat each other with respect. Threats We have a strict policy against any form of threats towards others. This includes threats of physical attacks, emotional suffering, reputational damage, any hostile actions intended to cause pain, loss, injury. We may escalate threats to law enforcement if we believe it is required to prevent immediate harm. How to Avoid Violating These Policies Please leave servers dedicated to any of violative content described above. Discord may also take action against accounts that are present in violative servers. How to Report Violations of These Policies Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations by following instructions here. For more information on these policies, please reference our Community Guidelines #1 #2. Resources If you another user is in danger we encourage you to consider contacting law enforcement right away letting them know what's going on, regardless of information you're able to provide. FEATURED STORY Blizzard aimed to generate awareness for its new World of Warcraft expansion, "The War Within," saw a prime opportunity to engage both active lapsed players in promoting this latest expansion to game. SEE MORE TO INSPIRE YOUR NEXT MARKETING PLAY Embark partnered with Discord to launch Skill Issue Quest to build excitement gameplay for Season 2 of FINALS. FRVR launched first ever ain-gamea Quest which required players to complete in-game objectives to unlock an in-game reward. To drive awareness of their new v4.6 patch, HoYoverse wanted to try something a bit different to activate their massive player base on Discord. Blizzard aimed to generate awareness for its new World of Warcraft expansion, "The War Within," saw a prime opportunity to engage both active lapsed players in promoting this latest expansion to game. Blizzard leveraged Play Quests to promote first expansion of their popular role-playing game Diablo IV. Nexon leveraged Discordas Video Quests to promote launch of First Descendant Season 2. Capcom used Play Quests to drive excitement engagement for debut of Terry Bogard, a newly introduced fighter, reaching players across Desktop Console. discord social sdk Power player connections enhance multiplayer experiences by integrating Discord directly in your game - No Discord account required. YOUR GAME'S SOCIAL, SUPERCHARGED Discord Social SDK streamlines way players connect so they can sign in, share, play your game with friends a even without a Discord account. unleash discordA in your game Seamlessly integrate Discord social features directly in your game to give players easy access to people they play with most. keep players coming back for more Boost your gameas visibility within massive gaming communities already on Discord, bring players back for more with one click game invites between friends. Give Players Best-In-Class Comms Keep players connected across desktop, mobile, console with Discord Voice Chat. POWER OF DISCORD Players arenat here to just game, theyare here to game with friends. Players linked through Discord Social SDK: Discord SDK makes social features like direct messaging, lobbies, session invites easy. Provisional accounts help us deliver this value to all of our players. Staff Software Engineer, Theorycraft Games Discord Social SDK has added a dimension to communication in Rust. Players often rely on communication weare seeing a growing number of friends teaming up getting together to play as squads. Marketing Manager, Facepunch Studios Pax Dei is at heart a social sandbox. Our collaboration to put Discord at heart of our MMO makes that deep social vision a reality, offering a world where you can find your friends deepen those connections both in outside our game. @Co-founder & CEO, Mainframe Industries SDK: TRUSTED BY TOP PARTNERS SDK: see it in action Theorycraft Games Deepens SUPERVIVE's Discord-Driven Development Strategy Theorycraft Games Discord teamed up to supercharge SUPERVIVE's social experience. Discover how their partnership, powered by Social SDK, Quests, Community Servers, built a thriving player-base fueled data-driven development. Questions? Discord Social SDK is available to download from our Developer Portal at no cost. Discord Social SDK is compatible with both Unreal Engine Unity. It supports following platforms, including native C++: Win 11+ MacOS. Console mobile support is coming soon. To learn more about fully unlocking Linked Channels, Discord Voice Chat, Cross-Platform Messaging into your game, contact us here! request use cases will need to be reviewed by Discord team. No. Discord Voice Chat is not available as a standalone service. Players will not be required to connect a Discord account to play your game. However, for players to take full advantage of Discord Social SDK features, players will need to connect a Discord account. Non-Discord users will have more limited access. Discord Social SDK is written in performant C++ to be as fast as possible. It offloads all work to a separate thread as game, while loading processing data that is relevant to minimize cost. Additionally, voice engine is already in use within Discord client, known for stability quality. No, social features that enable players to send/receive Discord messages view their Discord friends from within a game are optional. They will choose whether not to connect their Discord account to enable them. When a player has sent a message from within a game, a controller icon will appear next to their name on Discord as a visual indicator. No. You can only see messages that are sent between actively-linked players in your game only when game is actively running. To allow players to access their Discord DMs while in-game, your game will receive messages to display them. If players choose to link their Discord account, you may use messages to power communications experience between Discord your game, as well as to support your safety content moderation efforts. We encourage all developers users to review our privacy policies. Messages sent from game that appear on Discord are treated like any other message on Discord consistent with Discord's Terms of Service Privacy Policy. You can also find more information here. If you have further questions, please reach out to Discord directly. Direct Messages with a Discord user in-game friends will be shown in Discord. Lobby text messages will not be in Discord, unless that lobby is linked to a Discord channel. Messages in linked channels will be displayed in Discord, regardless of whether an account is linked. Yes, you will be able to create provisional accounts programmatically for every player, without need for user credentials manual input. These accounts are not visible to players are replaced by linked accounts once player connects their Discord account. This functionality is a core requirement of SDK, as provisional accounts enable full SDK capabilities for both linked unlinked players. It operates under normal OAuth2 principles. Provisional accounts are not full Discord accounts they cannot be used to login to Discord client. They allow a user to have access to functionality in SDK such as game invites, friends list, DMs, lobby chat, even if they don't have a Discord account haven't linked their Discord account. Because user can't log into a provisional account using Discord app, they also cannot do following: GET IN TOUCH Interested in reaching out to Discord directly about Discord Social SDK to discuss your game? QUESTS NOOB GUIDE ins outs to Quests everything in between. Quests are our new ad format designed to engage players on Discord. Players can earn rewards like in-game items Discord avatar decorations by completing Quest requirements, which may include watching a video, playing streaming a game on Discord for a specific amount of time. With Quests, players can discover exciting new games content, get rewarded for engaging. Quests appear natively across Discord on multiple surfaces. Most users will find Quests through Quest Bar, which appears at top of user activity console at bottom of mobile app. Quests also appear in social activity panels if a friend is participating in a Quest. Finally, all ongoing Quests can be found in Quests Home, located in Discover section. Quests can be launched in all regions where Discord is available around world. You can tailor your audience to specific countries based on your campaign goals. We currently have 2 Quests formats: Video Quests: Users must watch a video in order to unlock a reward. Video Quests are 100% viewable, are ideal for trailers, a new season launch, product video, anything in-between. Play Quests: Designed to get players back into your game, playing for first time. We'll show your ad to former prospective players, they'll be rewarded for playing. Quest rewards are incentives given to Discord players upon completing a Quest. These rewards can include valuable in-game items items from Discord Shop, such as Avatar Decorations. Our Sales team will advise advertisers on most effective type of reward for their campaign goals. All active Quests can be found on Quest Home (Discover > Quests). Our Sales team can discuss Quest campaign costs with you, price will depend on variables like campaign reach, geographies, more. You can get in touch with our team by completing this form. At moment, weare focusing on customers in Gaming Media & Entertainment industries. Sign up for updates to stay informed as we evolve expand our offerings to more industries companies. QUESTS SUCCESS STORIES LAUNCH YOUR QUEST

Discord parent hub Learn more about what weare doing to help your teen stay safer on our platform, explore our Family Center tool, download our Parent's Guide to Discord. A Guardianas Guide to Discord If youare a parent guardian seeking a Discord overview, youare in luck! Guardianas Guide is a centralized asset that helps adults who are raising teens understand latest highlights of how Discord works, information on how their teen might spend time on Discord, shares tips resources to talk to teens about keeping their online experiences comfortable. How Your Teen Uses Discord Discord is about hanging out with friends in real time. It's a place where people can be themselves spend time with others who share their interests hobbies. Keep reading to learn how your teen can use Discord to talk hang out with their communities friends. Chatting with Friends Teens use Discord to talk about all sorts of things, ranging from their favorite artists sports teams to homework more. It's a home for communities of any size, but it's most widely used by small active groups of people. These small groups include group chats other groups, called servers, made by interest-based communities friend groups. Discord servers are organized into topic-based channels where you can collaborate, share, just talk about your day without clogging up a group chat. vast majority of servers are small invitation-only, so your teen can choose to be a part of servers they want to be in, if your teen is a server owner, they control who gets to be part of their community. Hopping into Channels Communication on Discord isn't just about text! Discord servers are organized into text voice channels, which are usually dedicated to specific topics. In text channels, users can post messages, upload files, share images for others to see at any time. Teens hop into a voice channel connect through a voice video call in real time, can share their screen with their friends. Exploring Interest-based Communities From gaming, to music, to learning, Discord is home for people wanting to create a community around a special interest a hobby. Your teen may also join public communities that are built around shared interests from language learning, to origami, to their favorite TV shows, to houseplants. More Resources for Parents Educators Safer Internet Day 2023 Discord's commitment to a safe trusted experience Helping your teen stay safe on Discord Answering parents' educators' top questions Talking about online safety with your teen If your teen encounters an issue What is Discord? Talking about online safety with your teen Discord's commitment to a safe trusted experience Safer Internet Day 2023 Discord's commitment to a safe trusted experience Helping your teen stay safe on Discord Answering parents' educators' top questions Talking about online safety with your teen If your teen encounters an issue What is Discord? Our Approach to Content Moderation We currently employ three levers to moderate user content on Discord, while mindful of user privacy. User Controls Our product architecture provides each user with fundamental control over their experience on Discord including who they communicate with, what content they see, what communities they join create. Platform Moderation Our universal Community Guidelines apply to all content every interaction on platform. These fundamental rules are enforced by Discord on an ongoing basis through a mix of proactive reactive work. In Community Servers larger than 200 members, we take a more proactive automated approach to safety as described in our Terms of Service Privacy Policy. We may use automated means to detect violations of our policies. Community Moderation Server owners volunteer community moderators define enforce norms of behavior for their communities that can go beyond Discord Community Guidelines. We enable our community moderators with technology (tools like AutoMod) as well as training peer support (Discord Admin Community). Reporting on Discord Learn how to report content other users on Discord help support your teen in feeling confident comfortable when reporting issues themselves. It's important to have a conversation about what is isn't considered proper online behavior.. For example, only accept friend requests from people you know. If something doesnat seem right, tell a trusted adult. Behavior thatas not okay at school is also not okay online. However, if something does come up, please know that you your teen can easily report it to Discord for our Safety team to investigate take appropriate action. Submitting a Report If your teen encounters an issue on Discord, here's how they can report it to us. First, select message they wish to report. If they're on mobile, hold down on Message, on desktop, "right click." Then, select "Report Message."For parents, you too can submit a report by following instructions in this article. Describe Issue Once they've hit "Report Message" button, they can choose which category of violation they're seeing. More details can be provided in next screen, to further allow them to specify what it is they're encountering.Our Safety team takes action when we become aware of content that violates our Community Guidelines policies, including disabling accounts, removing servers, engaging with authorities as appropriate. Get Help from a Moderator Discord communities, especially large public ones, often have moderators there to help address issues. If violation happened in a server with a moderator, your teen can also reach out to serveras moderators, who may be able to respond immediately help resolve their concerns. In addition, remind your teen that they have ability to block any users they donat want to interact with. Family Center Parentas Guide to Discord Our friends at NationalPTA, ConnectSafely, Thorn have leveraged their expertise working with families to create their own parent guides to Discord. Consider checking them out for another view on how your teen uses Discord, our safety tools, ways to start conversations about online safety.

Safety Library Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Privacy Safety Moderation Policy Topics Safety Library Four steps to a super safe account 1. Secure your account First, we need to ensure that your account credentials login information are as secure as possible. 2. Set your privacy & safety settings Your settings are very important. They give you control over who can contact you what they can send you. You can access your privacy safety settings in Privacy & Safety section of your User Settings. We know itas important for users to understand what controls they have over their experience on Discord how to be safer. Part of delivering a better, safer experience is making sure people donat see content they donat want to a whether thatas intrusive spam unwanted sensitive media. This article covers settings that can help reduce amount of unwanted content you see on Discord promote a safer environment for everyone. At any time, you can further configure personal settings to blur block content in DMs that may be sensitive. ablura option in our sensitive content filters applies to all historic new media. For teen users, by default, Discord will blur media that may be sensitive in direct messages (DMs) group direct messages (GDMs) from friends, as well as in servers. Adults can opt into these filters by changing their sensitive media preferences in Privacy & Safety Settings. Learn more about how to do this here. For all users, default configuration is ablocka for direct messages (DMs) group direct messages (GDMs) from non-friends. At any time, you can also block user responsible report content that violates our Community Guidelines Terms of Service. Automatically send direct messages that may contain spam into a separate spam inbox. These filters are customizable you can choose to turn them off. By default, these filters are set to aFilter direct messages from non-friends.a Choose aFilter all direct messagesa if you want all direct messages that you receive to be filtered, select aDo not filter direct messagesa to turn these filters off. last thing to do in your security settings is determine who can send you a friend request. You can find these settings in Friend Requests section of your User Settings. If you donat want to receive ANY friend requests, you can deselect all three options. However, you can still send out friend requests to other people. You should only accept friend requests from users that you know trust a if you arenat sure, thereas no harm in rejecting friend request. You can always add them later if itas a mistake. 3. Follow safe account practices As with any online interaction, we recommend following some simple rules while youare on Discord: Again, Discord will never ask you for your password either by email by Discord direct message. If you believe your account has been compromised, submit a report to Trust & Safety here. 4. Block other users when needed We understand that there are times when you might not want to interact with someone. We want everyone to have a positive experience on Discord have you covered in this case. On desktop: On mobile: If you have blocked a user but they create a new account to try contact you, please report user to Trust & Safety team. You can learn more about how to do this at this link. aaa Tips against spam hacking General Tips to Protect Against Spam Hacking If you believe your account has been compromised, submit a report to Trust & Safety here. If youare getting unsolicited messages friend requests, this article explains how to change your settings. Spam Discord uses a proactive spam filter to protect experience of our users health of platform. Sending spam is against our Terms of Service Community Guidelines. We may take action against any account, bot, server using tactics described below similar behavior. Receiving unsolicited messages ads is a bad experience for users. These are some examples of DM spam for both users bots: Join 4 Join is process of advertising for others to join your server with promise to join their server in return. This might seem like a quick fun way to introduce people to your server to join new communities, but thereas a thin line between Join 4 Join spam. Even if these invitations are not unsolicited, they might be flagged by our spam filter. Sending a large number of messages in a short period of time creates a strain on our service. That may result in action being taken on your account. While we do want you to find new communities friends on Discord, we will enforce rate limits against spammers who might take advantage of this through bulk joins bulk requests. Joining a lot of servers simultaneously sending a large number of friend requests might be considered spam. In order to shut down spambots, we take action against accounts that join servers too frequently, send out too many friend requests at one time. majority of Discord users will never encounter our proactive spam filter, but if, for example, you send a friend request in just a few minutes to everyone you see in a thousand-person server, we may take action on your account. Instead of joining too many servers at once, we recommend using Server Discovery to find active public communities on topics youare passionate about. Servers dedicated to mass copy-paste messaging, encouraging DM advertising, are considered dedicated spam servers. Many servers have popular bots which reward active messaging. We donat consider these to be spambots, but spam messages to generate these bot prompts is considered abuse of our API, may result in our taking action on server and/or users who participate in mass messaging. Besides cheating those systems, sending a large number of messages in a short period of time harms platform. Invite reward servers are servers that promise some form of perk, often financial, for inviting getting other users to join said server. A We strongly discourage this activity, as it often results in spamming users with unsolicited messages. If it leads to spam another form of abuse, we may take action including removing users server. If a bot contacts you to be added to your server, asks you to click on a suspicious link, please report it to our Trust & Safety team for investigation. We donat create bots to offer you free products. This is a scam. If you receive a DM from a bot offering you something, asking you to click on a link, report it. We understand allure of free stuff. But weare sorry to say these bots are not real. Do not add them to your server in hopes of receiving something in return as they likely will compromise your server. If anything gets deleted, we have no way of restoring what was lost. Using a user token in any application (known as a Selfbot), any automation of your account, may result in account suspension termination. Our automated system will flag bots it suspects are being used for spam any other suspicious activity. bot, as well as bot owneras account, may be disabled as a result of our investigation. If your botas code is publicly available, please remove your botas token from text to prevent it from being compromised. a Hacking incidents, DDoS attacks If you believe your account has been compromised through hacking, here are some steps you can take to regain access protect yourself in future. Two-factor authentication (2FA) strengthens your account to protect against intruders by requiring you to provide a second form of confirmation that you are rightful account owner. Hereas how to set up 2FA on your Discord account. If for some reason youare having trouble logging in with 2FA, hereas our help article. A distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack floods an IP address with useless requests, resulting in attacked modem router no longer being able to successfully connect to internet. If you believe your IP address has been targeted in a DDoS attack, here are some steps you can take: a a Age-Restricted Content on Discord Labeling age-restricted content properly on Discord To help keep age-restricted content in a clearly labeled, dedicated spot, weave added a channel setting that allows you to designate one more text channels in your server as age-restricted. Anyone that opens channel will be greeted with a notification letting them know that it might contain age-restricted material asking them to confirm that they are over 18. Any content that cannot be placed in an age-gated channel, such as avatars, server banners, invite splashes, cannot contain age-restricted content. Age-restricted content that is not placed in an age-gated channel will be deleted by moderators, user posting that content may be banned from server. Partnered servers on Discord should not have age-restricted content in those servers. It's worth mentioning that while having a dedicated place for your age-restricted content is permitted, there is still some material that isn't appropriate anywhere on Discord. Content that sexualizes minors is never allowed anywhere on Discord. If you're unsure of what is allowed on Discord, check out our Community Guidelines. You can control these settings by going into User Settings selecting Privacy & Safety section.a a a a Discord's commitment to a safe trusted experience Our Approach to Delivering a Positive User ExperienceA core of our mission is to give everyone power to find create belonging in their lives. Creating a safe environment on Discord is essential to achieve this, is one of ways we prevent misuse of our platform. Safety is at core of everything we do a primary area of investment as a business:A fight against bad actors on communications platforms is unlikely to end soon, our approach to safety is guided by following principles: Underpinning all of this are two important considerations: our overall approach towards content moderation our investments in technology solutions to keep our users safe.A Our Technology SolutionsA We believe that in long term, machine learning will be an essential component of safety solutions. In 2021, we acquired Sentropy, a leader in AI-powered moderation systems, to advance our work in this domain. We will continue to balance technology with judgment contextual assessment of highly trained employees, as well as continuing to maintain our strong stance on user privacy. Here is an overview of some of our key investments in technology: Our Partnerships In field of online safety, we are inspired by spirit of cooperation across companies civil society groups. We are proud to engage learn from a wide range of companies organizations including: This cooperation extends to our work with law enforcement agencies. When appropriate, Discord complies with information requests from law enforcement agencies while respecting privacy rights of our users. Discord also may disclose information to authorities in emergency situations when we possess a good faith belief that there is imminent risk of serious physical injury death. You can read more about how Discord works with law enforcement here. Automatically send direct messages that may contain spam into a separate spam inbox. These filters are customizable you can choose to turn them off. By default, these filters are set to aFilter direct messages from non-friends.a Choose aFilter all direct messagesa if you want all direct messages that you receive to be filtered, select aDo not filter direct messagesa to turn these filters off. Direct message (DM) settings You can also control these settings on a server-by-server basis. Friend request settings You can choose from following options when deciding who can send your teen a friend request. If you donat want your teen to receive ANY friend requests, you can deselect all three options. However, your teen can still send out friend requests to other people. Blocking If someone is bothering your teen, you always have option to block user. Blocking on Discord removes user from your teen's Friends List, prevents them from messaging your teen directly, hides their messages in any shared servers. To block someone, they can simply right-click on their @username select Block. If your teen has blocked a user but that user creates a new account to try contact them, please report user to Trust & Safety team. You can learn more about how to do this at this link. Deleting an account If you your teen would like to delete your teenas Discord account, please follow steps described in this article. Please note that we are unable to delete an account by request from someone other than account owner. Understanding Avoiding Common Scams Social Engineering Social engineering is a manipulation tactic used by bad actors to trick individuals into divulging sensitive personal information. bad actor often poses as a trustworthy entity, offering a seemingly beneficial exchange of information. In its most basic form on our platform, social engineering is manipulating people to give their login credentials to an attacker. Discord Staff Impersonation Sometimes attackers try to impersonate Discord staff to gather information. To use this tactic, they hack into Discord accounts, then convince an accountas friends list that they've aaccidentally reported them.a They encourage them to reach out to "Discord Employees" to resolve issue. These impersonators often copy social media profiles onto Discord accounts, produce fake resumes, may even claim their staff badges are hidden for safety reasons. end goal is to trick you into surrendering your account information, paying for their fraudulent services to aundo report,a acquiring your financial assets. Discord Staff will never directly message users on app for support account-related inquiries. If someone claiming to be staff asks for personal information, payment, changes to your login credentials, we recommend that you do not engage further. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. Discord Staff are one of many groups that may be impersonated. Similar actions may occur for other companies as well, so be wary of accounts that may impersonate Support Safety related questions in other companies too. In general, if you need support at any company, it is wise to go official source instead. You can always verify your account standing directly from Discord by going into User Settings > Privacy & Safety > Standing. Learn more about account standing here. Impersonated Discord DMs Attackers may also resort to impersonating official Discord responses through user accounts bots. Typically, these messages include threats to your account standing if you do not comply with their demands. An official Discord DM will never ask for your password account token, will always display a staff badge on profile, as well a system badge which says aOfficial.a a Malware Tricks Malware often finds its way onto a device through downloads of malicious files. These files may appear harmless even enticingalike a game from a friend. But once downloaded run, they can give bad actors access to your login credentials, email addresses, even your entire device. Malicious Links Fake Nitro Giveaways Always exercise caution when clicking on links that will take you off of Discord, even when they appear to come from friends promise rewards like free Nitro. When you click on a link given to you, a pop up will show that you are leaving Discord it will display website you are being redirected to. It is advised to check link to make sure you are going to place that is intended. a Reporting Scams Reporting safety violations is critically important to keeping you broader Discord community safe. All Discord users can report policy violations in app by following instructions here. Stay vigilant informed to protect yourself your digital assets. Scams go against Discordas Community Guidelines, when we see this kind of activity, we take action, which can include banning users, shutting down servers engaging with authorities. We are committed to reducing scams through technical interventions continuously invest in safety enhancements partner with third parties to accelerate our work. For more information you can read our Deceptive Practices Policy Explainer as well as our Identity Authenticity Policy Explainer. How teens find explore community on Discord Young people find community identity online Online connections are a fixture of modern life. One in three US adults report they are online aalmost constantly,a a similar share of teens say they use social media just as much, according to Surgeon Generalas advisory. Itas probably true that everyone spends too much time on their phones a but that doesnat mean there arenat important things happening there. For young people in particular, online spaces can be great for hanging out with friends, building social circles, forming identity at a key juncture in life. Technology also removes geographical limits placed on friendships allows people to find like-minded peers much more freely. Itas important to have opportunities to connect with people who are into same things, whether those are passions, causes, an identity. Coming together online can help people find community, help buildA genuine connections. On Discord, that may happen in servers focused on a favorite sports team, video game, TV show. Servers can be small intimate, with just your core friend group who might use it for hanging out chatting. They can also be larger spaces for more people to share ideas, organized around identities, including neurodivergence, disabilities, LGBTQ communities; as well as special interests like music, art, tech. For some people, spaces like these offer support social connection that might be hard to come by where they live. aEspecially as an LGBTQ young person, being able to find a space, be it online in person, can literally be life-saving if they come from an unsupportive community,a said Patricia Noel, Discordas mental health policy manager a licensed social worker. aJust being able to find people who accept you, who use your pronouns a all I can say is that it can be a life-saving experience for young people to be able to come on Discord to find community.a More people are talking about mental health Many young people use Discord servers to support each other as they navigate a difficult stage in life. In servers focused on peer support with mental health, members gather to discuss what theyare struggling with build community around helping one another. These spaces created managed by users arenat replacements for mental health professionals, but they offer an accessible reliable space to be heard, Noel said. Young people look to communities of friends for validation support, theyare at an age in life when that has a significant impact on their sense of self. aYoung people are really invested in their mental health. They want to be having these conversations,a Noel said. aThey're so open about what they're experiencing feeling, even way that they support each other is amazing. They're asking right questions, theyare so in tune with one another, theyare such an empathetic group.a In spaces dedicated to discussing mental health, people may feel more free to share things they arenat yet comfortable sharing elsewhere. They can show up in a space thatas designed to offer words of validation affirmation, offer that same kind of support back to others. aThereas a lot of research coming out around benefits of peer support just being able to talk to somebody who's gone through what youare going through, who's just within your same age bracket,a Noel said. aIt ends up being beneficial for person seeking support as well as person who is supporter.a Building positive spaces for online communities experience of hanging out with friends is central to Discord. Servers are all about conversation a text, voice, video a because thatas how people build genuine connections, in real world online. Conversations happen at both server level also one-on-one with smaller groups in Direct Messages, DMs. We think of this in contrast to social media apps that are built for broadcasting likes, driven by algorithms that monopolize usersa attention. When all your time is spent on shallow interactions endless feeds of other people seemingly living their best lives, itas hard to feel better more connected. Often, opposite is true: research published in Journal of Medical Internet Research found that social comparison on digital platforms, where people judge themselves against others they see online, is aa significant risk factor for depression anxiety.a Experiences of quality interactions social support online, on other hand, are related to lower levels of depression anxiety. good news is we know how online communities can bring people together. internet can still provide new solutions to peopleas need for social connection, Discord is committed to fostering safe, healthy, supportive spaces on our platform. aThe internet isnat going anywhere. It's a tool that young people use, it's going to continue to be a part of their lives,a Noel said. aThey want to be part of solutions. They want to be included when it comes to deciding what happens next.a Words Matter 1. Keep it simple. When designing safety alerts, Discord uses plain language, avoids idioms metaphors, keeps sentences words short when possible. This makes alerts easier to understand in moment, without overloading users with information. This can be particularly useful for users who may be in a heightened emotional state, for example, if they just got a notification that they violated Discordas anti-harassment policy they want to report someone else for harassing them. Our design team tries to put themselves in teensa shoes in those moments. To imagine what their emotional state might be at time. simpler we can make options for them, better. We try to make it easier for them to move through flow so they are clear about what's supposed to happen. Simple language is timeless. It isnat trendy metaphorical. it translates better across different languages cultures. Take for example when a teen receives a DM from a user for first time Discord may provide some helpful education about online safety. a 2. Guide, donat reprimand. With features like Discordas Teen Safety Alerts, Discord partnered with a leading child safety non-profit Thorn to design features with teensa online behavior in mind. goal is to empower teens to build their own online safety muscleanot make them feel like they've done something wrong. So Discord builds teachable moments guidance into our products, using language that aims to restore useras sense of control, without shaming them. aWith teens, because they can't opt out of some of these alerts, we want it to feel more like a guideaa guardrail versus a speed bump,a said Passmore, lead product designer for Safety team. aA speed bump is saying, aHey, you're doing something wrong, you need to check yourself.a But we built Teen Safety Alerts to feel more like guidance.a This alert will encourage them to double check if they want to reply, will provide links to block user view more tips for staying safe. goal is to empower teens by providing information that helps them make important decisions to protect themselves. a 3. Show that youare listening can help them regain control. When a teen encounters potentially harmful sensitive content has a run-in with another user who is acting hostile, they, too, may be in an activated emotional state. They may be angry at other person, even at themselves. This is common with cyber-bullying, which researchers say can lead to depression feelings of low self-esteem isolation. Our approach is to meet them in that mindset. This means offering them options reminding them that they have options like blocking a person reporting a message. We create a space to acknowledge what theyare experiencing. Itas also important not to dwell on upsetting incident. Instead, Discord uses language that aims to move teen out of that emotional state into a place of self-awareness. This can help them to calm down feel more in control. A usersa mindset matters to Discord. That is why we try choose our words so carefully to support in best possible way. How do you define troll-y? Defining terms One of main challenges for Platform Policy team is writing rules for content that isnat so clearly defined. Riggio notes that for most severe violations, such as posting illegal material making an imminent threat of physical harm, line between whatas allowed whatas prohibited is bright red. Discord has a strict policy for those types of violations clear processes in place for removing content banning user. But for content where there arenat legal definitions even clear societal ones, like for bullying harassment, line is more gray. Landing on a definition starts with posing a fundamental question, said Riggio: aWhat is problem that weare trying to solve here on Discord?a How team goes about answering that challenge becomes guiding force behind each policy. For bullying harassment, team looks at user experience. We donat want people to experience psychological emotional harm from other users.A aThe spirit of policy is focused on individual community experience building healthy interactions,a Riggio said. Because ultimately, Discord is a place where everyone can find belonging, experiencing these feelings hinder people from doing that. team did a rigorous amount of research including reviewing other platforms reviewing guidance from industry groups, including Global Internet Forum to Counter Terrorism Tech Coalition, which was formed so companies could share best intelligence resources when it comes to child safety online. They also read academic literature on what it looks like in society. They also brought in subject matter experts from different countries, such as academics who study harassment legal scholars who can offer additional context for how platforms should be thinking about policies enforcement. These experts provided feedback on early drafts of policies. They defined bullying as unwanted behavior purposefully conducted by an individual group of people to cause distress intimidate particular individuals, harassment as abusive behavior towards individuals groups of people that contributes to psychological reputational harm that continues over time. Policies like this one are only as useful if they are enforceable. So team identified two dimensions that must be taken into account when assessing content. First, intent of instigator. These are signals that user server is posting content deliberately is intending to cause harm. Intent isnat always easy to spot, but Riggio said just as in real life, there are signs. For example, a user is directly harassed by someone, there have been multiple instances of harassment in past. aWhat happens in society happens online. What happens in your high school can sometimes happen on Discord,a she said. second, is content targeted? Is it targeting a specific individual by name? Is it targeting a specific individual by group? Here, there could also be dimensions of targeting users groups because of certain protected characteristics, such as race gender, which would then be considered a violation of Discordas Hate Speech policy. How this policy covers trolling term trolling has many dimensions. Itas been used to normalize aedgy behavior,a Riggio said. aTrolling in of itself is a complicated term, because some communities that intend to cause harm downplay their behavior with, aWe're just trolling,aa Riggio said. Trolling on Discord takes on different dimensions.
