User IDs usernames are acceptable as long as there is a justifiable need to disclose it, but make sure to always consider if there may be repercussions to that user if disclosed in any instance. PII is very sensitive as it removes a useras privacy can result in them being targeted online even in real life. Thus, this information should always be protected with utmost discretion. Moderators may come in contact with this in ways such as a message they have to delete, someone maliciously doxxing another person, a user accidentally sharing it without realizing harm they are putting themselves in even from information included in a report. This information typically should not be disclosed to anyone community leaders should consider removing it from bot logging channels to protect a useras identity. Also consider encouraging members of your community to learn how to safeguard their own information. You can include rules within your communities that discourage sharing of even oneas own personal information. As important as it is to protect other users, it is just as important to help them protect themselves. Users may sometimes share their information out of good will as a way of attempting to bond with others, but bad actors can use that information maliciously. Personal matters can refer to a huge range of information, but some common examples can include relationships, interpersonal conflicts, previous history, things as simple as a DM private conversation. As a moderator you may very likely come across information involving this as part of reports, concerns, even someone breaching trust by screenshotting sharing private messages. This information is extremely important to protect as people may trust you to keep it private use it only to take care of issue at hand. Exposures of this information can be very harmful to people can result in targeted harassment, bullying, even further negative consequences. Stories of this can cause people to be concerned even worried about reporting something for fear of it happening to them. In end, this makes things very difficult for moderators to not only reassure, but to rectify. Most public communities have ways of protecting their server with moderation tools, actions, procedures. This includes moderator actions such as warnings, kicks, mutes, bans, etc. Moderation actions may be especially important when it involves a specific user. A Moderation info can even include internal details such as protocol, procedure, censor lists, even bot details. Moderation information is something that can vary from server to server, thus it is relatively up to discretion of each moderation team to instill their own server rules to enforce. Some may have full transparency with an open log channel, some may take a more confidential approach only speak with those involved. Both have their pros cons, but be sure to weigh what could happen if people know who receives what penalties. For protocol, always remember to carefully decide what to share publicly, as disclosing a procedure can lead to someone using that information to evade moderators even exploit server. This also stands true with bots, as disclosing bot details such as configuration censor list can result in users evading protections put in place by your team. a There are many different forms of information that must be considered heavily before disclosing to different people, whether they be users other mods. Information can range from sensitive personal information such as emails, names, phone numbers, location, IP address, etc. to community-related information such as mod actions, previous incidents, user history. Regarding users, very little should be shared to people who are not involved. When it comes to fellow mods, it is always best to share as much information as is reasonable aside from personal information to ensure everyone has a well-informed mindset. Some questions to consider when speaking with users include: Now for mods members of more internal team on servers, mods should of course be ain loopa to know story of a situation, itas never recommended to keep mod teams in dark. That being said, even with other moderators, be careful about sharing unnecessary information, especially personally-identifying information, not only because there is often little benefit to it, but primarily because it compromises a useras privacy even if behind closed doors. A While there are fewer factors to consider, they are still just as important as ones you would ask for another user. Some things to consider when disclosing to moderators include: Remember that if you arenat sure if you should disclose something related to moderation, always ask an administrator/leader on your server for guidance, always dispose of private information if it is not needed. Benefits of Confidentiality It may be easier to be fully transparent not have to check every sentence before it is said sent. That being said, there are many benefits to upholding a consistent, confidential environment where staff act with discretion when assisting with a variety of matters. There are many consequences if confidentiality is not upheld properly. Below are some examples of benefits of protecting information as well as consequences that can come with being overly transparent. Keeping Pseudonymous. As stated by Discordas Safety Principles, Discord is pseudonymous, which means that your account on Discord doesnat need to be tied back to your identity. A Protecting users who may provide information as evidence otherwise may sometimes expose who they are, protecting this information reassures that their personal life wonat be compromised by socializing confiding in a serveras staff. Trust. Users will know of hold high trust within a staff team if they are confident that high expectations of privacy will be respected by team they confide in. If not upheld, users will find it difficult to trust team, may heavily contemplate even refrain contacting a moderation team again in future. User Safety. Diligent protection of user data information helps protect users as it prevents unwanted data from getting into wrong hands. If information is not guarded, information that gets into wrong hands can result in targeted harassment bullying, as many private details can reveal information to malicious individuals. Moderator Safety. Keeping moderation actions confidential only disclosing information to people who need to know helps to keep moderator anonymity reinforces idea of a team decision. Disclosing moderation actions who performed them can put a target on mod, as people may treat them personally responsible for an action may result in harassment disrespect from users who may not understand decision. Personally identifiable information being shared outside of need to know groups can result in compromising users making them feel as if they may need to sacrifice their Discord to retain personal privacy. This leads to a loss of trust from member, perhaps even loss of them as a member of your community. Designing Server for Privacy There are multiple things to be mindful of when considering privacy confidentiality, it extends well beyond standard moderation. Often, privacy will fall down to way that server is configured. Some things to consider include: Server Discoverability. If an LGBTQ+ server is in Server Discovery, a user may use an emote from that server in another one, if someone clicks on emote, it may accidentally expose user as they may identify as LGBTQ+ privately but not publicly. Public Join Messages. Some servers may have awelcome botsa even Discordas welcome feature that greets new users publicly upon joining. Server staff should take into account type of community that they stand for, consider if users may perhaps feel uncomfortable exposed by being mentioned immediately upon joining. Security. Automated security agatekeeper botsa may be used to prevent malicious users from joining a server on alt accounts as part of malicious groups. While this seems perfectly normal, part that has to be considered is what data you are requesting. Some of these bots may collect IP addresses, browser data, various other forms of information. Users may not be comfortable in supplying information that could compromise who they are. Always make sure to read through privacy statement of any bot that you add to ensure that you are not asking for too much information from regular members. Bot Logging. Many servers have private log channels maintained by one more bots. This tracks joins, leaves, deleted edited messages, even more. There are two main points to be wary of with these: if personal information is posted for any reason, be it accidentally by misclick maliciously to dox a user, it will usually appear in a moderator logging channel when deleted. After situation has been dealt with, owners admins should consider deleting log message to prevent personal information from persisting within that channel. Keeping Balance There are pros cons to any level of disclosure that is offered by a server to its community its staff. It is not black white there are gray areas in both transparency revealing select information with moderator discretion. There must always be a balance of both that may shift depending on situation at hand type of community that is present. Just as complete confidentiality will lead to distrust, total transparency will lead to users feeling unprotected due to a lack of privacy. Ban Evasion Advanced Harassment Understanding High Conflict Persons (HCPs) vast majority of community members are interested willing to participate according to platform rules, even if they might not agree with every one of them. Sometimes people break rules disagree, but their behavior can be quickly corrected they can learn from their mistakes. If users continue to break rules, they may be given longer-term even permanent bans from community platform. Most users will accept their ban, but a small fraction will not. A 2018 study by Stanford University estimated that 1% of subreddit communities on Reddit initiate 74% of all conflict on platform. This incredibly small percentage of users rank extremely low in agreeableness personality trait, have no interest in getting along with others. Only a trained clinical psychologist can diagnose a patient with a disorder, but a term commonly used prior to diagnosis is HCP (high-conflict people). There are four primary characteristics of high conflict personalities, which is not a diagnosis but their description of specific conflict behavior: If you fail to use tact in your moderation technique communication approaches, you may find that you your community become target of a high-conflict person. They may spam your community you may delete their posts ban their accounts, but more accounts can be created. Discord uses IP bans to prevent users from creating new accounts, but VPNs can be used to circumvent these bans. If truly motivated, armies of bot accounts can be created used for mass-spamming, members of your community can be doxed, ISPs platforms can be DDoSad to create fear in your community. If a high-conflict person gains access to money, they can pay somebody else to do work for them. Most moderators choose to simply wait out harassment. Advanced harassment like this may go on for several days, even weeks, but then stop abruptly as individual turns their attention to something new in their life. In some cases harassment can go on for months, continuing to escalate in new ways that may put lives of your team community members in danger. What can you do to protect your community from High Conflict Persons? What motivates a person to behave like this? This article will help to explain motivations behind this persistent, destructive behavior, provide actionable steps to reduce resolve their harassment. Virtue of Battling a Nemesis A anemesisa is an enemy rival that pursues you relentlessly in search for vengeance. A nemesis typically holds some degree of fascination for a protagonist, vice versa. Theyare an antagonist whoas bent on revenge, who doesnat go away, who seems to haunt mind of protagonist. Theyave moved past being an enemy to become something much more personal. You might assume that a high-conflict person harassing your community is your nemesis, but this would be incorrect. Youare not going out of your way to obstruct their behavior, your primary focus is to engage moderate your community. If harassment stopped, you would move on forget about their behavior. You resist their behavior only as long as it falls under your realm of influence. In their mind, you have become their nemesis, you must be punished for your insolence. To them, you are Architect of an oppressive Matrix, President Snow of an authoritarian Hunger Games, tyrannical Norsefire government in V for Vendetta. You your community represent opposite of what they believe. In one way another, either by your direct actions through your association with your community, you have wronged them deserve to suffer for your behavior. Itas clear that you will never learn understand what they see. You not only participate in creating corrupt unjust system that they are oppressed by fight against, but as a moderator, you are very lynchpin that maintains corrupt system. You may believe this sounds outlandish, you would be correct. Most people donat believe that world is out to get them, that theyall be hunted down persecuted for what they believe. These individuals have an overactive threat detection system that makes them believe that you your community are actively plotting their downfall. They take your opposing stance as a direct challenge to their competence, authority autonomy. They harass you your community because they believe that youare out to get them, want to replace them their way of life. truth is, all you really want them to do is follow rules maintain a civil conversation. Understanding Tactical Empathy Now that you have a better understanding of how somebody like this thinks, weall discuss strategies that you can employ to solve this problem. goal is NOT to get them to seek help change their mind- we arenat attempting to solve people. Instead, our goal is to prevent stop certain negative behaviors that keep happening so that you can protect your community focus your energy elsewhere. key to getting an individual like this to change their behavior is through utilizing atactical empathya. Tactical empathy is use of emotional intelligence empathy to influence anotheras behavior establish a deal relationship. It is not agreeing with them, but just grasping recognizing their emotions positions. This recognition allows us to act appropriately in order to respond to our counterpartas position in a proactive deliberate manner. premise behind tactical empathy is that no meaningful dialogue takes place when we are not trusted we are perceived as a threat. In order to get someone to stop harassing your community, you need to shift yourself from being villain of their story to being just another random person in their lives. You must work to shatter persona that they have projected onto you show that you are not enemy working to destroy them. Youare just a mod trying to keep your community safe. By demonstrating that you understand respect them as an individual, this will disarm them allow them to focus their energy elsewhere. It will not change their opinion, but at least their behavior will change. A Modas Guide to Situation Diffusal When somebody continues to harass disrupt your community, theyare essentially holding your community hostage. If someone truly is holding your community ahostagea, theyare often doing so because theyare looking to open a dialogue for negotiation. Frequently, people take hostages because they need somebody to listen. They arenat getting attention that they believe they deserve, attempt to cause as much disruption as possible in order to make their case. You are a community moderator negotiating peace of your community, not their lives, but these tactics can still apply. Situation diffusal can generally be defined by three primary processes, each designed to collect information use it to disarm high-conflict person from believing that youare an enemy threat. These processes are called Accusations Audit, Mirroring to Understand Getting to aThatas Righta. An accusations audit is where you focus not on just things that they believe, but things that they believe you did wrong. An accusation Audit is not based on logic - itas based on unfiltered emotions of other person. Itas important that you go through their early comments messages to understand what prompted this behavior in first place. This might have been banning them for breaking a rule not properly punishing another community member that they got into an argument with. They might believe aI feel like you didnat give me a chance to explain myselfa aI feel like youare discriminating against mea. Your understanding of their beliefs will be flawed inaccurate, but you must do your best to piece it together into a coherent argument on their behalf. If possible, learn more about other communities theyare a part of. Identify if theyare harassing any other communities, reasons for doing so. Are there any commonalities of note? Once you believe youave figured out why theyare upset with you your community, mirror their language to verify it. At this point, opening a dialogue might be incredibly difficult if theyare using throwaway accounts regularly. Chances are they do have a primary account they continue to use in other communities, which can help greatly with starting your dialogue. At this stage, youare still working to collect information about what they believe, directly from source. Examples of questions you can use to verify their opinions include, aIt seems like you believe that Iam being unfair because I didnat give you a chance to explain yourself.a aIf I understand correctly, you believe Iave been discriminating against you instead of taking your opinion seriously, is that right?a Chances are, responses you receive will be filled with aggression, profanity insults. You must ignore all of this, continue working to understand their position events that resulted in them targeting your community. Negotiations like this are difficult in voice-to-voice communication, nearly impossible via instant private messaging. They will be incredibly resistant at first, perhaps thinking that youare attempting to trick them into a perjury trap for them to admit their guilt ignorance. When you get them talking to you, mirror that language to get them to elaborate further on their beliefs. An example of dialogue might go something like following: Spammer: aItas bullshit that mods ban strawberry jam lovers because blueberry jam lovers are afraid of being exposed for who they really are.a Mod: aAfraid of being exposed?a Spammer: aYeah, blueberry jam lovers are secretly running world plotting against anyone who doesnat believe in same jam flavor preferences as they do.a Realistically, blueberry jam lovers are not actually running world plotting anything nefarious, but in mind of spammer this is undeniably true. while this example was intentionally mild, you can infer more severe types of conversations that would follow a similar format. Regardless, as you dig further into what they believe, youall notice that rabbit hole will go very deep be filled with logical fallacies obviously disprovable biases that make no sense. Remember that truth reality behind what they believe is completely irrelevant, attempts to correct them will undermine your goals. Your job is to help them explain their beliefs to you to best of their ability, for you to understand their position to best of your ability. Once you believe youave collected enough information, you can move to final step, getting to aThatas Right.a Once you believe youave completely understood their position what they believe, you can repeat their entire position back to them. Demonstrate your understanding by effectively summarizing it concisely accurately, regardless of how much you disagree with position. Donat focus on their behavior actions that resulted in them getting banned. Instead, focus exclusively on ideology that drove their behavior. Do this until youare able to get them to say aYes, thatas righta at least 3 times, by asking if thereas anything else that you forgot in your summary. If you did miss anything, repeat entire position again while including extra information. When reiterating their points, be very careful about restating things that are not true. Do your best to remove personal bias from statements to focus them back to aabsolute truths.a Their actions are about trying to make a point- but what youare doing is getting them to make their point without taking action, because you have heard what they are trying to say. If you do this well enough, if you put enough effort into doing this correctly (and it doesnat need to be perfect), they will know that you finally understand where theyare coming from that theyave been heard by you, their opinion has been validated. By demonstrating you understand their position, you go from being part of problem to being a real person. They might not like you, but they will at least (if begrudgingly so) respect you. When you successfully reach this state of your discussion, itas essential that you be careful with your choice of words. Thereas a good chance that spammer will leave your community alone now that they know that their opinion has been recognized. At very least, you should see an immediate reduction in number of times they attempt to cause harm. If they do continue to harass you your community, itas possible that you failed to address primary reason that theyare upset. At end of day, youare a human a moderator. Facilitating Positive Environments Introduction core foundation of a server on Discord is community that populates it. Your community is what you engage with, protect, grow over time. Engagement is important to focus on, but itas just as important to make sure you are facilitating positive welcoming engagement. Why Positive Environments are Important Positive engagement can mean a lot of things, but in this article, we will be referring to way in which moderation can affect culture of server you are moderating. As moderators your policies, knowledge of your community, deductive skills influence way in which your community engages with each other with your team. When you establish nurture your community, you are growing a collective group of people who all enjoy at least some of same things. Regardless of your server topic, you are undoubtedly going to have members across different a variety of ethnicities, sexual orientations, identities from across world. Ensuring that your space on Discord is a space for them to belong necessitates making it safe for them to feel like they can be themselves, wholly, without reservation. Your members are all humans, all community members, all people that deserve respect deserve to be welcomed. Establishing Community Boundaries in Moderation When you are establishing your community, itas important to have a basic understanding of what kind of environment you would like your server to be. Itas good to break down general moderation philosophy on what content discussion youad like your community to engage in what content would be inappropriate given space. Depending on topic of your server these goals may be different, but some common questions you can ask to establish general boundaries are: Moderating Hateful Content When it comes to content you allow moderate in your server, itas important to, again, reflect on what type of community you are. Itas also important that you act quickly precisely on this type of harmful behavior. Some users will slowly push boundaries on what type of language they can aget away witha before being moderated. When discussing moderation, a popular theory that circulates is called broken windows theory. This theory expresses that if there are signs of antisocial behavior, civil unrest disorder, as well as visible signs of crimes in area, that it encourages further anti-social behavior crime. Similarly, if you create an environment in which toxic hateful behavior is common, cycle will perpetuate into further toxicity hatefulness. What is Bad-Faith Content vs. Good-Faith Content? aBad-faitha content is a term that describes behavior done intentionally to cause mischief, drama, A toxicity to a community. They are also commonly referred to as bad actors, are type of people that should be swiftly dealt with addressed directly. aGood-faitha content is a term that describes user behavior with good intentions. When users are a positive foundation in your community, members that join interact with established community will grow to adapt speak in a way that continues positive environment that has been fostered established. Itas important to note that while agood-faitha users are generally positive people, it is possible for them to state wrong sometimes even harmful words. importance of this distinction is that these users can be educated from their mistakes adapt to behavior you expect of them. When users toe line, they are not acting within good faith. As moderators, you should be directly involved enough to determine what is bad-faith content remove it. On other hand, education is important in community sphere for long term growth. While you can focus on removing bad behavior from bad-faith users, reform in good-faith community members who are uneducated in harmful rhetoric should also be a primary goal when crafting your community. When interacting in your community, if you see harmful rhetoric a harmful stereotype, step back meaningfully think about implications of leaving content up in channels that use this kind of language. Does it: Ideas to Help Prioritize Inclusivity A core way to handle all de-escalation stands in your approach. Users, when heated up during a frustrating toxic discussion, are easy to set off to accidentally escalate to more toxicity. key is to type calmly, to make sure with whatever manner you approach someone to de-escalate, you do it in a way that is understood to be for benefit of everyone involved. Closing Creating a healthy community that leaves a lasting, positive impact in its members is difficult. Moderators have to be aware, educated, always on lookout for things they can improve on. By taking initiative on this front, your community can grow into a positive, welcoming place for all people, regardless of their race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation. Fundamentals of Family-Friendly Servers How Family-Friendly Servers Differ From Other Servers Because you are dealing with young people, family-friendly servers may become what many refer to as Home Servers. These are online communities that are perceived to be safe spaces that people come back to time again, like a home. Thus, such servers may attract users for different purposes than a community meant for college students might, for example. moderators of family-friendly servers can be viewed as both authoritative figures but also older siblings friends that may be looked up to by their community in unique parasocial relationships. They will also have unique experience of seeing many of their young users mature grow along with server. When forming this kind of environment, itas important to make sure your moderators are naturally empathetic to unique situations that will arise within member reports as a result of interpersonal relationships amongst younger users. During foundational stages of server building make sure to keep ideas such as privacy concerns, text filters, appropriate topics of discussions, rule continuity at forefront of your mind. Consider how you will handle users who are above traditional age range of family-friendly servers who may not wish to abide by these rules. While privacy concerns exist on any platform, they are something to be especially aware of when moderating family-friendly spaces. Rules that cover privacy internet safety may be more strictly enforced to protect younger server members from any harmful actors looking to take advantage of less experienced internet users. Oftentimes, these concerns can culminate in a blanket rule stating that sharing any personally identifying information in server is not allowed. This goes beyond exact locations can include full names, ages, even face reveals. Revealing exact locations full names are generally frowned upon in most online communities because they can be used to find more information about a potential doxxing target. Forbidding users to share their age is an added level of privacy to protect younger members seeking community on Internet from being taken advantage of by those with malicious intentions. Younger users may not understand how risky age differences can be to navigate. Face reveals can be reverse-image searched to further learn information about users who arenat protecting their online privacy, even be stolen used in various forms of bullying. As a result, many family-friendly servers find it best to limit all personally identifying information outside of first name country if users arenat choosing to utilize an online persona to protect themselves. As moderators itas important to help educate young users about how to maintain confidentiality use discretion when revealing personal information. This starts with recognizing not clicking malicious links steers into conversations about reporting things that make them uncomfortable in any way protecting their private information. Keep an eye out on how others interact with younger users act accordingly, as a victim may not realize they are a victim in some situations. Text filter implementation determining which topics of discussion are appropriate for server may be more strict than average community as a result of building a safe space for younger users. There is generally no room for crudeness in any form. A This goes beyond using text filters to monitor hate speech, which is against Discordas Community Guidelines, going further to include curse words, innuendo, illegal substances activities, gore, dark humor making light of serious situations, any negative harmful rhetoric from within fandom your community supports, more. Be sure to adapt your text filters as new situations filter evasions arise within your community. It is often recommended to keep your blacklist private to avoid exposing harmful terminology to users. Additionally, make sure your text filters mirror topics of discussion you arenat allowing in your server clearly outline those preferences in your server rules by noting that your environment is strictly SFW any NSFW content is not allowed. Automoderation can be utilized to mute ban users who are engaging in problematic discussion around hate speech, moderators can use their judgment on other blacklisted words as long as your moderation bot is set to log filtered words in moderation channels. As mentioned in previous section, rule continuity is a big deal in spaces meant for young people to ensure equal enforcement across everything. If youare looking to filter certain content, it should also not be allowed to discuss that topic in your server. This goes for both general chatting for various other forms of server usage, any place where there can be user generated content. One such example is meme art channels. While itas a great idea to foster encourage a healthy positive artistic environment, content that is NSFW, hate speech politically motivated, creations that may lean into age-restricted content like alcohol consumption gore should be monitored discouraged. If you have an active music channel setup, it might be worth keeping an eye on playlists to make sure content being monitored elsewhere doesnat slip by here. With release of server avatars, it is less likely that rule-breaking content can find its way into your server via this route, but consider moderating statuses of active users, user profiles, profile pictures if it does. It also helps to have your moderators lead by example follow same rules in their profiles that you are looking to enforce elsewhere. Continuity is key for equal unbiased rule enforcement. Considerations for Users Above Your Target Age Range While family-friendly environments exist to be safe spaces for young people you may find yourself also having users who are above your target age range. Their presence should not be discouraged, but itas important to ensure that your rules welcome messaging clearly defines your space as family-friendly so that they are aware of expectations for ANY user who joins server. Most will likely be accepting of rules youave put in place space you are trying to cultivate. However, others may naturally challenge certain restrictions that they find childish assume donat apply to them. Establishing language around why your community is meant to be family-friendly importance of keeping it safe for everyone as a result, will be helpful if these conversations arise. Users who may rebel against rules that they do not agree with should be actioned accordingly. If you notice a large portion of your userbase seeking out your community but growing frustrated with its family-friendly restrictions, you can consider opening locked channels for mature users that can either opt-in to their existence show proof of their age. If you decide to do this, make sure you have a separate set of rules in place for these channels, as well as an identification vetting process to make sure that younger users do not get exposed to content you donat want them to be exposed to. This would require moderation that is different from rest of your server, so itas important to consider whether not your moderation team can handle this locked channel if you feel it aligns with your serversa purpose. To Recap Family-friendly communities exist to welcome Discordas youngest users into safe spaces with protection of moderation teams. Home Servers are SFW communities that limit topics of discussion more than a generalized server would in order to cultivate that safe environment. As a result, thereas special consideration to be taken around user privacy educating users about their privacy, expanded text filters, appropriate topics of discussion, rule continuity when building out rules structure of such an environment. Make sure your team is prepared to handle older users who may find these rules constricting by explaining their importance to your communityas purpose. Understanding Avoiding Moderator Burnout Moderator Burnout: What is it? Starting a new job position activity will always be exciting. Most moderators are eager to help a community that they love that they are an active part of to grow prosper. You spend a lot of time there already, so why would you not want to do your part in helping that community be successful? However as time passes, interests can change initial enthusiasm can wane. As a moderator, you might find yourself spending time in other communities you realize your real world schooling work is a priority over moderating, so there is potential for anxiety to build as you try to juggle all of your responsibilities. Maybe your mental health is being affected by spending many hours a day on internet, dealing with trolls people who simply just want to cause trouble. This can mentally drain you, having to deal with negativity conflict day in day out. When moderating begins to feel like a chore, as opposed to a hobby, thatas when you might feel like moderator burnout has set in. Burnout is emotional, mental, physical exhaustion you feel after a prolonged period of stress brought on by certain activities. Spending too much time in a stressful environment can easily lead to feelings of exhaustion, feeling distant from activity task at hand, simply just having negative feelings when thinking about doing activity task. These negative effects on your body mind eat away at you until you feel like you are at your limit just do not have enough energy motivation in you anymore to continue moderating. Sometimes burnout makes it feel like only thing that can make you happy is to stop being a moderator completely. Signs of Moderator Burnout One of most common signs of moderator burnout is when you have been noticing yourself being less less active when it comes to moderating, as well as being less active in server itself. As a moderator, you have begun to feel like it is a chore for you to be moderating server; something you feel forced to do, knowing it needs to be done with no joy attached to task at hand. Time seems to move so slowly when you are moderating as you are constantly checking clock, just hoping that an hour of your time is enough on server. Your time spent on your server becomes less less as days go by until you have either stepped down completely withdrawn from any activity in server, moderation otherwise. A burgeoning lack of participation is another sign. If you know yourself well enough, you can probably tell when something is bothering you. Perhaps on any normal given day, you are social engage with your other team members as well as with regular server members, but recently youare only chatting in public channels, giving out occasional public warning. You notice that you only really check staff channels when there is a ping. Your account may be in server your name on member list, but youare no longer an active community member. At this point burnout has set in. There may be urge to come in every day give 100% but then you run risk of giving too much, too quickly. You start to dread amount of work necessary to do your part eventually start to taper off. You might notice yourself making more mistakes than normal. Frustration is another part of burnout that can affect mental aspects of moderating. Feeling like you are making too many mistakes are not doing as much as another moderator is a hard thing to put a reason to. Feelings of inadequacy may lead to reprimanding yourself internally, being your own worst critic, finding yourself in a rut, thinking everyone in server is being difficult. You know you are making mistakes, others on your team see it, thinking they are helping by giving you constructive criticism. There is a lack of accomplishment that makes you frustrated, especially in moderating. Nothing you do feels like it is being done right, adding that to difficulties of members of server, frustration kicks in. When telling members of server to do something they continue to post against rules, you begin to wonder if you matter are even making a difference. A Burnout can easily affect your attitude. Moderating tests your patience as some members of server will purposefully push line, seeing what they can get away with. As a new moderator, you might not be as strict, as you are wanting community to not only respect you but to like you. As time passes, your patience may begin to run thin you put up with a lot less while you get more irritated. You have a shift in your attitude can become bitter at what you have to deal with when moderating a server. Avoiding Moderator Burnout After taking time to look at signs of moderator burnout, it is important to know how to avoid it so you your team can find your groove again remember what it feels like to enjoy being not only a moderator but a community member. Everything is healthy with moderation, including, well, moderation. Knowing when you need breaks encouraging yourself, as well as other moderators, to take these breaks can really help with mounting stress levels. Moderating takes a toll on your mental health, so being able to step away catch your breath can really help reset your focus. Reach out to other members on your team that can help with moderator duties shoulder workload so those that are experiencing burnout can feel that it is okay to step away. A big part of working on a team is being honest with each other when things are good when things are not so good. You may be surprised at how eager your team members are to help prop you up when youare feeling low. Remember- you're not alone in this, so feel free to take those breaks be assured that server is not on fire that there are eyes other than yours that are there to share workload. Offline life your overall health should always come before any aspect of online life. Make sure you are not taking on too much, but also have enough to do. This can be a tricky balance. Depending on your moderation experience skills, it can be hard to determine what your work load capabilities are, especially as offline life changes. Be upfront honest with what your team expects from you, but also let them know that if you are feeling overwhelmed, that they can talk to you. Always have an open line of communication so you can find ways to help yourself, as well as others you moderate with. Something that has worked on larger servers that you might be able to incorporate to your server is having a summary of channels. With summary, you can have moderators on your team sign up for which channels they enjoy moderating, as well as others, not feel like you have to be in too many channels at one time. Delegating work makes it seem more manageable less daunting. Encourage yourself your fellow moderators to try new channels after a couple weeks to change everyoneas scenery, as well allowing various team members chance to interact with certain server members that might only hang out in channels that they donat normally moderate. As a moderator, you might feel yourself wanting to do more seek to add to your responsibilities. Suggesting community events helping out organizing running these events makes for a great change of pace to contrast normal moderating duties of watching chat. Events are great for bringing regular members together with moderators. It is a fun task that can bring activity levels up spread some excitement. Create an environment that is fun to moderate in. Having suggesting a staff channel where you your fellow moderators can be yourselves vent is a great way to relieve some stress have your team get to know one another. Ask them questions every day to encourage discussion communication between your entire team. Building a team that works well with one another helps with communication between fellow moderators, so they can express how everyone is feeling, seek advice on stresses in community. A You can get to know each otheras personal lives what other things in life might be causing outside stress. Getting to know each otheras personalities can help determine if someone might easily burn out if they are just more introverted than other moderators on your team. Holding events, such as game nights, where you all play a game online together can really help you other moderators feel at ease, bring enjoyment to everyone, help everyone reset for next day of moderating. One of biggest, perhaps simplest, things you can do to help with moderator burnout is just being thankful. Typing two little words of athank youa can go a long way. As a moderator, you spend your free time helping server, so let your fellow moderators know you appreciate that they chose this as their hobby. To that end, positive specific feedback is one of best ways to let someone know that they did a good job what exactly it was that they did well. By being specific about what youare thanking your moderator for, youare letting them know that their hard work is recognized valued seen. Recognize when they put in a lot of hours on server are here on a day-to-day basis. Finding ways to reward them, whether through gifting Nitro a special recognition in server, can be really fulfilling to them. It reassures them that they are an important part of server are making a difference when helping. Be gracious with your words remind them that they are here with you. It starts a chain reaction you will see moderators thanking other moderators for their hard work. Summary Moderator burnout can happen to anyone at any time. It is important to understand what it is how you can help. Whether you are an owner, administrator, another moderator, it is important to support your team look for signs of burnout so you can suggest ways that might help them in how they are feeling. Always have an open line of communication with your team that fosters honesty. Encourage them yourself to step away when feeling stressed overwhelmed, thank each other for helping in server. Servers are a lot harder to run when doing it alone; moderators that are excited to be there are an important part of making sure things operate smoothly. Patreon X Discord What, Exactly, is Patreon? Letas start with obvious question: what is Patreon? In case you are unfamiliar with Patreon, it is a subscription service for content creators similar to YouTube Memberships Twitch Subscriptions. Supporters ( hereby referred to as apatronsa) can pay a monthly fee to access content from creators they are supporting. This private content can cover a wide range of content including text posts, polls, videos, images, merchandise, more. possibilities are truly endless you, as a content creator, have control over how much value you place on content you produce distribute over Patreon. Patreon also uses tiered platforms based upon monetary commitment. For example, letas say you are a comic book creator that can generate an entire comic in a monthas time. You could charge patrons $5 to access works in progress, maybe snippets of story youare writing, behind scenes streams of you working on an anticipated page panel. At next $10 tier, patrons can gain access to whole comic as a reward, maybe even access polls to help you decide what to do next. Further, a $25 reward could be that patrons have complete access to your entire library, get a physical edition of your comic book sent to them! ideas are endless when it comes to what kind of rewards you can offer your patrons. In fact, one of new ways to explore rewards systems for patrons is via Discord. Why Create Discord Rewards? For content creators that use platforms like Patreon, providing rewards to patrons is an absolute necessity because it directly benefits those who choose to support you. One of simpler rewards creators can provide patrons is a Discord reward system automatically managed by Patreon Bot. An example of such an award allows you to assign one more roles to patrons in your Discord server based upon their subscription tier on Patreon. Once they have their designated roles, you can utilize channel permissions to provide your supporters with exclusive access to aspects of your server like hidden channels perhaps even hoist them in sidebar of your Discord server as an added bonus. This gives them closer access to you as a creator as well as your content your community. This, in turn, can make them feel appreciated as support perhaps allow them to see a direct impact of their support on your content. Installing a Discord Rewards System on Patreon first step to setting up Discord Rewards on Patreon is to have a Patreon account. Once youave started building your Patreon page (or have one completed), youall need to head into your aTiersa section of your page. Once in aTiersa section, pick tier youad like to grant access to your rewards in your Discord server. We recommend that this should be lowest tier youad allow patrons to subscribe at in order to receive a special role in a Discord server that we are presuming is public. Once youave selected your chosen tier, youall need to connect your Patreon to Discord. Now, letas make this reward a reality with following steps: Please note, if you created your server that you plan on adding to your Patreon, youall have no trouble finding it in server list mentioned in Step 4. If youave had a friend, moderator, maybe even a community manager create your server, you might not see it in this list. Make sure you have Manage Server permission in order to see it. If you donat, double check with server owner have them add it to one of your roles in order to successfully connect to Patreon. Customizing Your Discord Rewards With your Patreon page successfully linked with your Discord server, you may notice this message in Patreon: To finalize reward set-up, you need to create actual roles. We recommend creating a different role for each of Patreon tiers you have distinguishing roles by naming them after tiersa name amount of money pledged by patrons of each tier. For example, if you have a $50 per month Patreon tier named Top Contributor, you could name corresponding reward role either a$50a aTop Contributor.a This usually works out most suitably for future rewards, because you can easily distinguish your followers who send $5 a month, versus those sending $50 a month, change role permissions accordingly if you are offering them different levels of Discord access. Remember that it is important to keep Patreon Botas role above all other roles we make for this purpose so it can help manage them. Now that your tier roles are in server, there should be no more red warning text on Patreon Tier Creation page. If there is, give it a quick refresh. disappearance of this text means that you can now check box aGives patrons access to selected Discord roles.a If you are using multiple roles for each tier of your Patreon for organization in your server, make sure theyare all added. After setting your channels permissions spoken about in next step, double check that correct role in your Discord server is associated with proper tier on your Patreon page. Success! Youave completed Patreon Discord integration! Now lets establish accessibility levels. At this point, youall want to build a structure to your server for these new tier roles. Head back to channel list decide how youad like to reward your different tiers. Do you want each tier to have their own channel category, do you want one channel category with different channels designated to different tiers? Make sure to give each category and/or channel permissions associated with each role that you want to have access to that area. We have an based upon channel list image below to see some of our recommendations in action. This example utilizes one channel category for all patrons, but gives certain patron tiers different levels of access. A Youall notice Patreon allows you to assign users multiple roles when they subscribe to a tier. This makes it handy to ensure your private channels categories are easier to manage across different role tiers. In our provided example youall see that all patrons have access to an exclusive general text voice channel to talk to each other regardless of tiers. However, different tier levels are given access to different additional perks such as sharing social media links for creator to follow back, polls for future content, a VIP text voice chat to better talk to creator theyare supporting. Conclusion Congratulations on launching your new and/or updated Patreon page! beauty of this system is that you can continue to create new roles channel permissions to best serve your community as you continue to grow. Now that youare done with basic steps outlined in this guide, all you have to do is edit/add/drop/shift roles around as needed to ensure you are making most of your Discord Rewards patron program. Patreon rewards give your fans supporters exclusives in exchange for supporting your work. Having this automated system to handle manage your supporters means you can spend more time making new content, less time worrying about a bot, a function in Discord whenever new patrons sign up. It also makes managing permissions much more simpler because you have a lot more control over which roles a patron is assigned to based on their subscription tier. Best Practices for Moderating Content Creation Creating an Area for Content Creators Content creation is one of coolest aspects of a community! Even those that do not create themselves can celebrate passion excitement that comes with sharing art. Artists shouldnat be regulated to just a generalized #media channel where all users are posting photos, you should consider instead giving them their own designated area in server. This shows these users that moderators see their contributions to community appreciate what they are doing. This area can be a channel dedicated to sharing art content, even an entire channel category depending on how your moderation team wishes to interact with your communityas creators how active this part of your community may be. Listen to their needs expand modify this category as necessary. Unique Rules of Road When building out a content creation realm in a server, it is important to keep in mind that your moderation team may encounter some new situations that don't apply to rest of server. Of course, content creators are subject to same laws of land in place for entire community, but there may need to be some of these unique rules of road to consider including: Plagiarism. This is practice of taking someone elseas work claiming that it is your own. Plagiarizing another content creator should not be tolerated within any creative space. It should be highly discouraged acted upon with moderator intervention if your community brings an accusation of plagiarism to your moderation team. As moderators, it is important to understand difference between plagiarism finding inspiration in someone elseas work. Tracing another creatorsa artwork is most common form of plagiarism, whereas being inspired by an original character to try out a new pose, color scheme, scene featuring them is inspiration. While creators are often looking out for each other willing to bring concerns about plagiarism to moderation teams, it is important to be able to look for it yourself by familiarizing yourself with your artistsa styles reverse image searching images of concern to your team. Be sure to be able to explain to your community why plagiarizing is harmful when these situations arise. Managing Constructive Criticism vs. Hate. Your content creation channels are going to be accessible to your entire server. This is so that entire fandom can celebrate together, but also to drive interest from users to support your content creators. This means that average user can come in comment on content. There is a line between constructive criticism hate. Watch out for it as moderators be prepared to intervene should anything cross line into attacks hate-filled commentary that would give content creation an unwelcoming atmosphere. Oftentimes in creative communities it is an unspoken rule that you should not give constructive criticism unless it is specifically asked for. average user may not realize this could accidentally offend an artist if theyare not aware of this. As a moderator, itas important to help artists understand constructive criticism when they ask for it while shielding them from trolls baseless hate. Sharing content can be intimidating, so it is especially important to ensure that content creation channels remain positive respectful environments. One way you can mitigate this issue is by making it clear in your rules that unless artist specifically asks for constructive criticism, that feedback of that nature is not allowed. Bumping. Art bumping may occur in an art channel where artists feel their content isnat easily viewed by enough people. This is essentially act of media getting bumped up in chat from other people sharing their media at same time from chatter about other works. An accusation of bumping usually comes up when a creator feels their art isnat being noticed, if they believe someone they do not have a good relationship with is intentionally bumping their work. In this case, itas important to defuse situation not allow any forms of bullying by de-escalating conflict. Maintaining an environment where users respect everyone's work is necessary for peace of mind of creators consumers alike. You can also consider building out a channel category instead of a single channel which would allow for a channel dedicated to posting art a separate one for discussion. You may contemplate a rule of not posting art within a certain time frame of another creator posting, but be cautioned that this can lead to over-moderation by your community. NSFW content. If your server allows Not Safe for Work content, it is important that you create a specific channel for it that can be marked as an NSFW channel separate from your regular content creation channels. In line with Discordas policies, this will not allow users under age of 18 to see this channel without agreeing to a prompt that says they are not a minor. It is also important to consider that implementation of an NSFW channel disqualifies you from being a A Partnered Verified Discord server. Make sure to keep expectations around SFW NSFW content creation in line with that of your entire server, offer to answer any questions in DMs if a creator thinks a piece may toe boundaries you enforce. Advertising Commissions. If you have a blanket ban on advertisement in your community, you may not want to make an exception to rule here. However, if you decide to allow advertising commissions in your server, you are allowing more commissions to flow to your creators. Do not allow other users to beg for free art try to guilt creators with open commissions into providing free content to them. It may be case that your moderation team will have to enforce boundaries if someone who commissions a creator within your community doesnat pay them revokes payment. Conversely, if a creator requires payment up front then does not deliver work doesnat refund commissioner, moderator intervention should occur to no longer allow them to accept commissions from other members. To be clear, you are not responsible for their financial disputes business transactions. Ultimately, creators should look into their specific payment provider website for policy information on fraud filing disputes, both of which are out of your control. Your job as a moderation team is protecting creators from scammers who make themselves known within your community. Youave created this space to cater to creators need them to know that users who take advantage of them creators who take advantage of users are not welcome here. Low Quality/Low Effort Art. Something your moderation team should consider is whether not you will be moderating low quality low effort art. Lower quality art has ability to potentially create a divide with more experienced artists diminish overall quality of your artistic channels. Expectedly, this is a very subjective divisive topic. Moderating alow qualitya alow efforta art can run risk of upsetting younger users creators that are at very beginning of learning how to create. When considering moderating low quality art, be sure to display empathy compassion to avoid coming off as inconsiderate rude. Be honest realistic in your descriptions requirements for these art spaces so that users may have a better idea as to what is isnat acceptable both content quality wise. Other ways to healthily promote higher quality artists is via potential role systems, automatic pins, weekly artist highlights, which will be discussed in further detail below. Off Topic Art. As a team, think about whether you want your artist channels to be dedicated to purpose of your server if you want to also allow off topic content. Once this rule is decided, check that your moderation team is on same page for enforcement nudging should you decide not to allow off topic art. Engaging Content Creators There are several ways to keep your communityas content creators engaged, which helps to showcase how much your moderation team values their contributions to server. Discord has several native features that can showcase your communityas talent in emojis, stickers, banners, server icons. While a banner a server icon are important to be branded thus rarely changed, generating emojis stickers (especially from within your community) is a good way to bond, celebrate inside jokes with your community, show some love for your creators. Oftentimes communities will employ certain yearly opportunities like emoji elections where creators can submit emojis for consideration allow your community to vote as a whole. Continued engagement with your content creators is also important. If you are engaging your community with generalized game server events, examine whether you can engage your content creators in same way with art events monthly prompts as this promotes community bonding. If your community has a system to reward winners for their work participation in events, work to instill same kind of system for art adjacent events prompts. Finally, some communities may want to install a special role for content creators, especially those that are active constantly contributing quality work. This will showcase artists in server to rest of server. Do keep in mind however, that unique role colors can lead to inadvertent exclusivity a social hierarchy within server. This can also have effect of alienating artists that do not yet have role, which is why you should be careful when thinking about if you want to introduce this role to your community. If you decide to bring a specialized role into your server, take step to have clear criteria for users to qualify for it as well as easy rules for moderators to grant it to users. This ensures that your moderation team can avoid accidentally leaving someone out hurting someoneas feelings. Avoid bringing a role into your server if your server has had problems with role related hierarchies in past. Listen to your communityas needs anticipate potential problems! Conclusion Content creators are an exciting subset of fandom that should be welcomed to your community! Ensure that they have their own area to share all forms of content in, whether it be a channel an entire channel category. Be aware that content creation arenas often come with unique rule considerations that you may not have encountered previously in daily moderation of your server. Talk to your moderation team about everything before launching this channel category so that you are all on same wavelength with enforcement before jumping in. Continuously engage your creators involve them in artistic aspects of server, such as emoji sticker creation. Art can bring people together, having a healthy artistic space within your community will provide a new way for your community to bond celebrate your fandom! Managing Interpersonal Relationships Degrees of Interpersonal Relationships Any relationship between two members of a community can be described as an interpersonal relationship. These relationships exist on a wide spectrum. As you participate in a community, you are most likely going to develop connections to varying degrees with other members of community. As a moderator, this may even be expected as part of your duties to promote community engagement healthy conversations. Thatas perfectly normal, as itas very natural for people who spend a lot of time communicating to develop closer ties to one another. Every kind of relationship, from mere acquaintances to romantic partners, can occur in a Discord community, every relationship you form as a moderator will carry its own unique challenges responsibilities in order to ensure you are performing your duties to best of your ability. Any kind of interpersonal relationship can create difficulty in moderation, but as nature of relationship changes, so too does unconscious bias you may experience. A friendship between a moderator a member of community is least problematic type of intersocial relationship, but as these friendships form it is still important to take notice be aware of them. As a moderator it is your duty to be available to everyone in community, even people who you may not ever see as a friend, so you must resist temptation to devote more time attention to people you more easily connect with. If your biases toward your friends begin to show up in your moderation efforts, many more serious harder to diagnose problems can arise. Feelings of "elitism" afavoritisma can start to take hold disgruntled members may take advantage of your friendships to excuse justify their own behavior, so take care to make sure that you are remaining impartial. A friendship between a moderator a member of community that persists for a long period can evolve into a closer more open relationship. These relationships are built on trust shared experience, can be more difficult to impartially manage than regular friendships acquaintances. This kind of relationship could come from fact that this person is someone you know from another server, in real life, possibly even a family member. No matter what scenario, closeness of this kind of relationship makes it very difficult, sometimes impossible, to remove your own partiality from equation. Special care must be taken to ensure you engage listen to other moderators on your team when someone you are closely involved with is in question. When in doubt, it may be best to remove yourself from situation entirely, which we will discuss in more detail later in article. A romantic relationship between a moderator a member of community can (and does!) happen. As is natural, if you meet someone who shares common interests has an attractive personality, over time your relationship may progress into something more profound. Romantic relationships are certainly most difficult to manage as a moderator. saying holds true, especially in new romantic relationships, that you will see your significant other through arose-tinted glassesa which tend to blind you from their potential flaws wrongdoings. Additionally, other members can very quickly see a budding relationship as an opportunity for a fellow member to grab power through moderator they are romantically involved with. As a best practice, you should remove yourself from any moderation decisions involving a user that you are in a romantic relationship with. Failing to do so can has directly caused death of some communities, especially when romantic partners are both on same moderator team. This type of one-sided interpersonal relationship is rare among moderators because of connection a moderation team usually has to content creator personality that they moderate for. More commonly, a user witnessing a friendly moderator carrying out their daily duties to interact with their server can develop such a relationship. However, this type of relationship requires an extra level of care awareness, as they can quickly become toxic if not managed appropriately. Always be aware of them, consider their existence when making certain moderation decisions. DMA has an article exclusively dedicated to parasocial relationships for further reading. On Visibility One thing to keep in mind when evaluating your relationships in your communities- regardless of nature of thema is that your relationships connections if played out in server are most likely visible to other members of community. When interacting with your friends, close friends, even your partner in a space with other people such as your server, members of community may pick up on fact that you do have these relationships. As with any kind of community, there may be feelings of exclusion perception of ain-groupsa that can arise in, especially when it comes to relationships between a aregulara server member a highly public visible one like a moderator. A responsibility you have as a moderator is to take this dynamic into account effects it can have on your members how they view you your friendships. Making sure that your friendships relationships are not creating an exclusionary atmosphere for other community members, where they feel like itas unwanted difficult for them to contribute. On subject of avisibilitya, a moderator a whether they are consistently conscious of it not - is someone in server who has power over other users in that space. It is not always easiest task balancing dynamic between being part of a community cultivating relationships friendships with being conscious of your role within that community as a moderator what that imbalance may influence. This difference in responsibility position can make relationships connections with other users in server more complicated. You may not be directly aware of it when youare chatting with fellow server members, but there will be users in your community who are keenly aware of your status as a moderator. This scrutiny can affect how they approach becoming friends with you as well as affect how they view your own relationships with other server members. Always keep this dynamic in mind be aware of how your position may affect not just how users interact with you but also how they interpret your relationships conversations with other members. A Higher Standard Just as it is natural for these relationships to form, it is also human nature to unconsciously develop act on a bias toward people closest to you. As a moderator, that natural bias is something you must actively resist, take conscious steps to avoid. What happens when friend of a moderator has a bad day doesnat act in spirit of rules of community? In an ideal scenario, moderatoras response would be same reasonable response that would be expected if offending member were anyone else. Your response to these situations will have a profound impact on your communityas attitude toward you as a moderator, as showing favoritism will quickly evaporate communityas trust in your ability to be impartial. Moderators are human, for inexperienced seasoned moderators alike, this kind of scenario can prove to be one of most significant tests of their ability to manage conflict. In preparing for this scenario, most important tool in a moderatoras arsenal is self-awareness. It is burden of a moderator that this commitment comes above any interpersonal relationships that may form during time spent engaging with a community. Being ever-mindful of your responsibility role in a community can help temper depth of relationships that you build. As a recommended best practice, moderators should be careful about building interpersonal relationships of depth (close romantic relationships) in communities they moderate, including with other moderators. only guaranteed way for a moderator to remain impartial in upholding rules for all members is to exclusively maintain friendships within their community, but this isnat always reasonable for communities that you are closely involved in. Should you find yourself in a difficult scenario involving a member with whom you have a close interpersonal relationship, here are some best practices for managing situation: first step in successfully managing a scenario that involves someone you have an interpersonal relationship with is to take stock of your own investment. How are you feeling? Are you calm capable of making rational judgment? Is your gut reaction to jump to defense of member? is opposite true - do you feel need to be overly harsh in order to compensate for potential bias? Carefully self-evaluate before proceeding with any action. wrong type of moderator response in a scenario like this can often exacerbate distract from actual issue at hand, potentially weaken your communityas trust in your capabilities as a moderator. If in course of your self-evaluation you realize that you cannot positively answer any all of these questions, it may be necessary for you to more seriously evaluate whether not you need to make difficult decisions regarding your position as a moderator. If your interpersonal relationship is preventing you from fulfilling your duties as a moderator, you may need to consider either abdicating your role as a moderator ending relationship until circumstances improve. Neither option is easy ideal, but making tough decisions for health of community is your primary responsibility as a moderator. Once youave determined that youare capable of proceeding with moderation, evaluate scenario to identify what problem is whether it immediately needs to be addressed. If there is no immediate need to step in, as a best practice it is usually better to defer to another moderator whenever your personal relationships are involved. Contact another member of your moderation team to get a second opinion some backup if necessary. If immediate action is required, a concise direct reference to rules is usually sufficient to defuse situation. Use your best judgment, but be aware that likelihood of arules lawyeringa is higher with someone who trusts you sees you as a friend in these scenarios because moderation action can be seen as a violation of that trust relationship. Clearly fairly indicating grounds for you speaking up is crucial to prevent further issues from arising. Additionally, be careful about what is discussed in private with person involved in this scenario following any action. There is a higher likelihood of them contacting you via DM to talk about your decisions because of level of trust that exists between you. As a best practice, it is usually best to avoid litigating rules of server with any member, especially a member with which you have an interpersonal relationship. Politely excuse yourself, if prudent, redirect conversation by giving member a place to productively resolve their own issue. As with any moderation action, once taken it is best practice to leave a note for your team about what action was taken why. Another period of self-evaluation is a good idea after any action is taken. Ask yourself, was action taken in alignment with rules of your community? Was it fair to both offending member, as well as other members of your community? Was your decision affected by your bias towards offending member? If necessary unclear, ask your teammates for their outside perspective. Summary Taking moderation action when offending member is one with whom a moderator has an interpersonal relationship can be one of most difficult scenarios that a moderator can find themselves in. Set yourself up for success as a moderator by tempering type of relationships you build within your community cultivating ability to self-evaluate. best tool available to a moderator in these scenarios is self-awareness ability to recognize when their own biases prevent them from acting fairly. Remember that moderation is a team sport, that team is your most valuable resource in impartially upholding rules values of your community. Considering Mental Health in Your Community Importance of Mental Health Awareness Before we discuss what to consider when introducing mental health channels to a community, it is important to understand difference between mental health a mental illness, to be aware of realities of what these terms entail. Mental health mental illness are strongly intertwined, but very different. People with good mental health can develop a mental illness, while those with no mental illness can have poor mental health. Mental health reflects our emotional, physiological, social well-being. Though topic of mental health is still quite taboo to talk about in certain circles, there is help available for those who wish to seek it. Mental health is a crucial aspect of a personas existence as it affects our actions, emotions, thoughts. A healthy mental state enhances effectiveness productivity in work, education, interpersonal relationships. A mental illness is a disorder of mind that affects not just our thinking but also our energy, mood, occasionally our conduct behavior. Such a diagnosis may make it difficult to cope with many obligations of life. Common mental illness diagnoses are anxiety disorders, such as panic attacks, post-traumatic stress disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, specific types of fears. There are also mood disorders like depression, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia. An excellent guide for identifying mental health challenges pathways to care can be found here. Being informed aware about mental health issues is a great start when youare considering how it may affect apply to your community team. As an illness can manifest in a variety of different ways, it is vital to be ready have clear guidelines on these complex topics when dealing with online communities both for your staff internally for your community externally. An often overlooked result of community moderation is how it can affect mental health of your team. Moderator burnout stems from situations that harm your teamas mental health, understanding signs how to deal with it are essential in building a strong online community led by a moderation team that can act as a strong support system not only to your community, but to each other. Adding a Mental Health Channel in Your Server There is a lot to consider when discussing if you want to add a channel that addresses is dedicated to talking about topics that deal with mental health within your Discord server. Firstly, you have to determine whether not your community needs a mental health discussion channel thread. Consider whether not your team has seen much talk about mental health-related content in your community whether such conversations have remained respectful even without your teamas active intervention. If these conversations have devolved into arguments negativity in your community, maybe re-evaluate if you feel this type of channel will benefit those in your server really think about if you can find a way have enough resources to guarantee that it remains a safe space for all users. easy way to contemplate whether not a mental health channel would fit into your server is by looking at general topic of your server. If your Discord server is more focused on gaming, it may not make sense to allow something that drastically differs from your serveras purpose. Contrarily, a server focusing on community building might be a safer space for a mental health channel. Ultimately, itas very subjective all about listening to not just needs of your community but tone of your server. A lot goes into developing an excellent community introducing a mental health channel is not easy as you have to consider how to best moderate it. This includes how youall be utilizing auto moderation text filters in channel as accidental flags in highly emotional situations can be more harmful than helpful. If you do decide to create a mental health channel thread, it is important to be aware of all possible situations to be flexible prepared for unexpected scenarios. Understanding that some moderators arenat comfortable in these situations is important if you decide to allow such a channel on your server, you need to be able to vet your moderators future helpers. As moderators arenat mental health professionals, they shouldnat be treated as such should also be presented with option to opt out of spaces such as this. Therefore, it is vitally important that you establish clear internal guidelines procedures to set expectations for channel at a manageable level. Facilitating Healthy Discussions about Mental Health Discussing mental health in a positive way can be challenging as it is a sensitive topic with a variety of experiences attached to it. However, there are some ways to make this an easier experience from a moderation standpoint, most important of which is having clear server rules moderator guidelines for how to act when these discussions are taking place having clear escalation protocols for if things go south. Talking with your moderators about mental health challenging times in life as well as facilitating breaks for them demonstrates that you care about their well-being.
