Still, sometimes there are situations where problems canat be solved things get more more heated, in end separating is unavoidable. Moderators leave on their own have to be removed. Your team members should always be given option to take a break from moderation- especially to avoid burnout. You can learn more about how to deal with moderator burnout here. Reviewing Taking a moment to look back at history progression of your community your mod team can be a useful way to evaluate where your team is at where it needs to be. time frame can be of your choosing, but some common intervals can be monthly, quarterly, half year. You donat always get to talk with your moderators every day - most of us volunteer, moderating as a hobby, having our own lives while living scattered all over world. With all of that going on it can be hard to find time space to discuss things that you might feel are lacking could be changed regarding server, thatas why reviewing is important. A Community Review can be done in many ways. For most, a channel asking a few basic questions, like how community has developed since last review, how activity growth has changed, is a good way to start. Most importantly, you want to hear how moderation team is doing. Talk about mistakes that have happened recently, how they can be prevented, review some of moderator actions that have been taken. A review allows everyone to share their thoughts, see what everyone is up to, deal with more long term issues. It also allows giving your moderators feedback on their performance. Summary essence of managing a moderation team is to be open-minded, communicate to listen to each other. Endeavor to manage decisions confront problems in an understanding, calm, professional way. Give moderators opportunity to grow, designated tasks, but also time to review, break rest. Remember, youare in this together! Protecting Against Scams on Discord Internet Safety Checklist Internet Safety doesnat have to be exhausting. Below are some simple but effective ways to make sure youare on guard against any potential neaer-do-wells in your DMs, even outside of Discord. Only Open Trusted Links from Those You Know This may feel like a given, but a surprising amount of security issues stem from people clicking on links before checking if theyare real deal. Always double-check a link youare clicking a link shortening services can easily mask unsafe websites programs. We recommend getting it checked against a resource like VirusTotal to see if someone has already flagged it as potentially dangerous. In addition, Discord has its own systems in place to remove malicious links weare constantly evolving those systems. Donat Download Programs Run Code You Donat Recognize Itas not advised to download run software that doesnat come from a reputable source. Downloading running programs that someone sends you unprompted is almost always a bad idea.If a person claiming to have aspecial access to featuresa new software says they need you to run on your own computer, theyare misleading you in order to get your personal info with their shady programs. If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. Never Give Your Password to Anyone Thereas no reason to give it up, ever. Sharing your password not only gives away access to your account but also exposes any personal information you have tied to that account a potentially any website where you use that password a making you vulnerable to more than just a single account takeover. Discord Safety Checklist above tips can be applied anywhere on internet! Next, we'll share some Discord-specific tips to ensure you can be vigilant against baddies targeting your account community: Decide Who Can Canat Send You DMs Disabling DMs for a particular server is one of best ways to prevent bad apples hiding inside larger communities from contacting you. To adjust who can canat DM you, head into User Settings > Privacy & Safety, then scroll down to aServer Privacy Defaults.a From there, youall find option to aAllow direct messages from server members.a Feel free to adjust it as you wish, but do note that this new state only applies to servers joined after changing toggle; it wonat retroactively affect your existing servers. If you turn this option off, members of newly-joined servers canat contact you via DM unless youare friends with them beforehand. Receiving mail might be nice, but receiving suspicious messages from people you donat know is less nice. If you're in a server you trust donat mind being messaged by those in it, you can toggle privacy setting on an individual basis. Head to that server on desktop mobile select its name to open server's settings, choose aPrivacy Settings.a Once there, youall find aAllow direct messages from server members" option. Turn that on, youare free to receive all sorts of DMs from everyone in that server, regardless of if youare friends not! If youave joined a lot of communities, consider auditing list see if youare comfortable with letting non-friends message you from that server, if opening up is inviting unnecessary risk into your inbox. Audit your Serveras Permissions Understanding which permissions your mods members have access to is key to keeping everyone within it safe. If you're a server owner, have you checked your permissions list lately? Who has what perms? Did you know they had that access for how long? If answer to any of these questions was a resounding :shrug_emoji:, itas time to do a review of your server setup to ensure that only those who really need powerful permissions have them. Specifically, make sure that only moderators you trust have access to permissions that can change powerful server tools, including any bots webhooks you might add to server. Be vigilant for bots that are impersonating larger well-known bots. In almost every case, any large reputable moderation bot will never need admin permissions to work properly. Only give a bot permissions required for tasks you need no more a look for a Verified checkmark on a well-known bot before adding it. If you need a refresher on how permissions on Discord work, you can check out Help Center article here. If you have a basic understanding of permissions system want a more comprehensive look at what they mean in a moderation sense, we also have this article from Discord Moderation Academy. Keep Invite Links Updated If you update your serveras links, make sure that your community potential newcomers are aware of changes update any social media pages where you shared them. If possible, delete references to old invite links make it known that those links have been updated. This is doubly-so for servers Partnered, Verified Level 3-boosted servers that utilize a vanity URL: if your server loses changes its custom invite link, nefarious communities may swoop in claim your old one. If this happens before you update your public-facing invites, people trying to join your community may instead join a server thatas looking to cause trouble. A In addition to updating existing links, consider implementing easy-to-follow community rules around invite sharing encouraging members to always verify where a server invite leads who it is coming from before clicking it. Pro Tip: Try pasting one of those invites to a Discord message to preview where it leads to before opening it! (But of course, donat make your invite testing look like a spam message by pasting a random invite in #general.) Why Would Someone Want Access to My Account? If someone gains control of your Discord account, they will have as much reign over your account as you do: Theyall have ability to change your username, password, email tied to account, any other information associated with your account. Theyall also be able to see any personal info associated with your account once theyare in it. While most consider apersonal infoa to be payment info email, it can also contain your private conversations messages in DMs servers alike. If you can see it, theyall be able to see it. As if they were new owner of any servers you own, theyall be able to make any changes they want: from server layout to server permissions, to bots webhooks to kicking everyone out of server, you name it. If your account is moderator of a server that a hacker is targeting, they might even use you as a stepping stone to cause further damage within community, even impersonate you to trick unsuspecting members. Some users may also target Discord accounts that have unique profile badges that are no longer available, such as Early Supporter Early Verified Bot Developer badges. If you have one of these unique badges, you should be extra-vigilant with your account. If your account is taken over hacker changes password, there isnat much you can immediately do to stop them. However, if you have 2-Factor Authentication enabled on your account, hacker will also be required to provide a 2FA code to change your password. We strongly recommend enabling 2FA, you can learn how in our 2FA blog post. Reporting what happened to Discord can help you regain ownership of your account, which can be done here a let us help you! Additional Reading: Common Scams Weave created an additional blog post describing types of scams floating around on Discord, which you can check out to familiarize yourself with signs that you may be dealing with a hacker who needs to be blocked: Common Scams What to Look Out For We recommend sharing it with larger communities that may benefit from this knowledge. With these recommendations in your pocket, youall be better able to foil any potential digital threats. Just like with keeping your IRL-self healthy whole, taking preventative measures can keep your virtual self safe secure. Stay safe out there! Scams What to Look out for Fake Games, Programs, Videos Downloads In this situation, a user pretending to be your friend, using a friendas compromised account, reaches out asking you to check out their video, test a game they made, practice running code they wrote. No matter backstory, theyall always ask you to download a program click a link they provide, resulting in a malicious program entering your computer and/or compromising your account. Another variation of this scheme involves a user asking you to atesta something for them, directing you to open developer tools on your internet browser while logged into web app. Theyall then ask you to show them your token a do not do this. With your token, malicious users can sign in take over your account. Discord will never ask you for your token, you should never have any reason to open Discordas Developer Console in first place. Note that this is only applicable to Discord on your internet browser, not desktop mobile application. a Fake Giveaways/NFT Drops This is similar to previous scheme in that usually it is, again, a trusted individual that DMs you. Sometimes it's in form of a well-known bot under facade that they are an administrator for a server that you're active in. It may involve very genuine-looking links to websites as well. Like we said, if it's too good to be true, it likely is. Discord Impersonation for Partner/Verified/HypeSquad Discord impersonation involves a hacker pretends to be messaging you from an aofficial Discord accounta offer entry to one of our community initiatives, such as HypeSquad Partner programs. This is nearly always fake. Below are two screenshots, both of which present themselves as official Discord-sent messages. However, of these two conversations, only right screenshot is actually from Discord. On right, you can note blurple aSystema tag next to senderas name, as well as Reply space being replaced with a unique banner that only official system messages come with. DM on left does its best to be convincing though. It even sends an invite link to a real Discord-run server called Discord Testers a somewhat-real-looking link to supposed Discord Hypesquad form. Scammers will use a technique of mixing real Discord invite links (to public Discord servers usually) with their malicious links in order to portray legitimacy lull you into a false sense of security. If you suss out that a DM is a fake, report it as Spam using red aReport Spama button at top of DM. This feature is one of many improvements that weare working on to help identify remove bad actors as soon as weare aware of them. a Free Nitro Scams One of oldest scams is temptation of afree Nitro.a While we canat discount people who may be truly full of generosity believe in gifting Nitro, getting a random DM from a stranger claiming to have chosen *you* for a Nitro giveaway is incredibly sus, most likely a scam. Discord will never ask you to scan a QR code in order to redeem a Nitro code. Do NOT scan any QR codes from people you donat know those you canat verify as legitimate. If you ever use QR Code Login to sign in to Discord, make sure youare using desktop app, if youare on web app, that your URL bar says ahttps://discord.com/logina exactly as it's written. above tactics are some of ways that scammers may attempt to socially-engineer you into giving up your information. Even if you donat click any of their links, it's best to simply block report them to us, rather than engage further. We encourage you to share this article with friends who may not be as informed as you a when everyoneas aware, our communities are safer than ever. Hereas a quick link back to Protecting Against Scams on Discord too. Stay safe out there! How Trust-Safety Addresses Violent Extremism on Discord Our History with Violent Extremism Weave been paying close attention to violent extremist groups movements ever since we learned how organizers of 2017 Unite Right Rally in Charlottesville, Virginia utilized Discord to plan their hateful activities. Back then, Discord Trust & Safety was a team of one, just beginning to make difficult decisions about how to properly moderate platform. Almost four years later, our Trust & Safety Team makes up 15% of Discordas near-400 employees splits its time between responding to user reports now proactively finding removing servers users engaging in high-harm activity like violent extremist organizing. Trust & Safety has spent a lot of time since 2017 trying to ensure that another event like Charlottesville isnat planned on our platform. Our team developed frameworks based on academic research on violent extremist radicalization behavior to better identify extremist users who try to use Discord to recruit organize. We keep up-to-date on research that can lend insight into how to evaluate understand extremist behavior online, our recent partnerships with organizations like Global Internet Forum for Countering Terrorism (GIFCT) Tech Against Terrorism (TAT) are intended to support this effort. How We Identify Violent Extremism Categorizing violent extremism itself is difficult because not all extremists have same motives believe in same ideas. Some individuals who adopt violent ideologies act on their beliefs by joining organized hate, terrorist, violent extremist groups. Others donat want to officially identify themselves as belonging to a particular movement, may instead form looser connections with others who have adopted same worldview. Different cultural contexts also influence belief systems behaviors, so violent extremist ideologies in one country will naturally be different from those on other side of world. Violent extremism is nuanced ideologies tactics behind them evolve fast. We donat try to apply our own labels identify a certain atypea of extremism. Instead, we evaluate user accounts, servers, content that is flagged to us based on common characteristics patterns of behavior, such as: Itas important to note that presence of one two of these signals doesnat automatically mean that we would classify a server as aviolent extremist.a While we might use these signs to help us determine a user spaceas intent purpose, we always want to understand context in which user content is posted before taking any action. How Did We Do on January 6? On day of Insurrection, our Trust & Safety agents were reviewing reports of hate speech, glorification of violence, misinformation about what was transpiring. We feel very fortunate that our team was able to locate remove many of most harmful servers dedicated to coordinating violence on January 6. Our ability to move proactively on servers advocating for violence was thanks to two main factors: first, we were able to surface reports from users on these spaces quickly; second, our Trust & Safety agents dedicated to countering violent extremism had been tracking these spaces ever since allegations of election fraud regarding 2020 U.S. presidential election had begun to spread. We believe itas important to talk about line we walk with Discord users who discuss politics to organize political activities like protests. Many people are frustrated with how society works how some governmental societal systems are structured. Naturally, people have strong opinions on how things should shouldnat change. Now more than ever, itas important for meaningful conversations, debates, exchanges of ideas to take place. Weare glad that users across world have turned to Discord to discuss their opinions beliefs, to organize, to advocate for change they want to see. Discord Trust & Safetyas objective is to ensure that no harm comes to our users, to society at large, because of actions taken on Discord, which is why we donat tolerate activities that promote advocate for violence. When weare reviewing reports for violent extremism, while itas sometimes clear when users servers have crossed that line, in many cases thereas a lot more context to consider. One of most difficult responsibilities of our work is balancing mitigation of potential harm without appearing as if we are overstepping any boundaries censoring meaningful conversation. Looking to Future Because of these values, we plan to continue standing firm against ideologies of hate that violent extremist communities espouse, we are excited to work with other platforms organizations that seek to do same. Stay tuned for more updates. We know that we canat solve violent extremism alone, but weall continue to do our best to make sure that communities on Discord reflect our company values. We want Discord a internet as a whole a to be a space for positive interactions creating belonging. If you would like to report dangerous harmful activity to Trust & Safety team, please do so using our report form. If youare unsure how to report a user server, take a look at dis.gd/HowToReport. How we investigate When we receive a report from a Discord user, Trust & Safety team looks through available evidence gathers as much information as possible. This investigation is centered around reported messages, but can expand if evidence shows that thereas a bigger violation. For example, we may investigate whether entire server is dedicated to bad behavior, if behavior appears to be part of a wider pattern. We spend a lot of time on this process because we believe context in which something is posted is important can change meaning entirely. We might ask reporting user for more information to help our investigation. Responding to user reports is an important part of our Trust & Safety teamas work, but we know there is also violating content on Discord that might go unreported. This is where we get proactive. Our goal is to stop bad actors their activity before anyone else encounters it. We prioritize getting rid of worst-of-the-worst content because it has absolutely no place on Discord, because risk of harm is high. We focus our efforts on exploitative content, in particular non-consensual pornography sexual content related to minors, as well as violent extremism. Please note: We do not monitor every server every conversation. Privacy is incredibly important to us we try to balance it thoughtfully with our duty to prevent harm. However, we scan images uploaded to our platform to detect child sexual abuse material. When we have data suggesting that a user is engaging in illegal activity violating our policies, we investigate their networks, activity on Discord, their messages to proactively detect accomplices determine whether violations have occurred. a a Four steps to a super safe server 1. Set up roles permissions Roles are one of building blocks of managing a Discord server. They give your members a fancy color, but more importantly, each role comes with a set of permissions that control what your members can cannot do in server. With roles, you can give members bots administrative permissions like kicking banning members, adding removing channels, pinging @everyone. You can find these options in Roles section of your Server Settings. Assign permissions with care! Certain permissions allow members to make changes to your server channels. These permissions are a great moderation tool, but be wary of who you grant this power to. Changes made to your server canat be undone. You can learn more about implementing roles permissions in Role Management 101 our Setting Up Permissions FAQ article. 2. Set a verification level Server verification levels allow you to control who can send messages in your server. Setting a high verification level is a great way to protect your server from spammers raids. You can find this option in Safety Setup section of your Server Settings. 3. Enable server-wide 2FA When enabled, server-wide two-factor authentication (2FA) requires all of your moderators administrators to have 2FA enabled on their accounts in order to take administrative actions, like deleting messages. You can read more about 2FA here. By requiring all admin accounts to have 2FA turned on, you protect your server from malicious users who might try to compromise one of your moderators' administrators' accounts then make unwanted changes to your server. If you are server owner, you can enable 2FA requirement for moderation in Safety Setup section of your Server Settings. You must have 2FA enabled on your own account before you can enable this option! 4. Explicit image filter explicit image filter automatically blocks messages in a server that may contain explicit images in channels not marked as Age-restricted. You can control this feature so that it applies to all server members, just to members without roles a you can turn this feature off altogether. Age-restricted channels are exempt from explicit image filter. Turning this filter on allows your server members to share content while reducing risk of explicit images being posted in channels that are not age-restricted. You can access this setting by navigating to Server Settings, under Moderation, select SafetySetup, then find Explicit image filter heading. What is Discord? Discord Glossary Discord has its own vocabulary. You might hear your teen students using these words when talking about Discord. Server: Servers are spaces on Discord. They are made by specific communities friend groups. vast majority of servers are small invitation-only. Some larger servers are public. Any user can start a new server for free invite their friends to it. Channel: Discord servers are organized into text voice channels, which are usually dedicated to specific topics can have different rules. DMs GDMs: Users can send private messages to other users as a direct message (DM), as well as start a voice video call. Most DMs are one-on-one conversations, but users have option to invite up to nine others to conversation to create a private group DM (GDM), with a maximum size of ten people. Group DMs are not public require an invite from someone in group to join. Go Live: users can share their screen with other people who are in a server a DM with them. Nitro: Nitro is Discordas premium subscription service. Nitro offers special perks for subscribers, such as option to customize your Discord Tag, ability to use custom emotes in every server, a higher file upload cap, discounted Server Boosts. Server Boosts: If your teen is a big fan of a community, they might want to boost communityas server (or their own). Like Nitro, Server Boosts give servers special perks like more custom emotes, better video voice quality, ability to set a custom invite link. Server Boosts can be bought with Nitro purchased separately. Student Hubs: Discord Hubs for Students allow students to verify their Discord account with their official student email, unlock access to an exclusive hub for students at their school. Within hub, they can connect with other verified students, discover servers for study groups classes, share their own servers for fellow students to join. Hubs are not affiliated with managed by a school school staff. Servers in a Hub are student-run but may include non-students. For more information on Student Hubs, please check out our Student Hubs FAQs. Why people love Discord Below, you can see just a few of our favorite stories about what people are doing on Discord why they love it. You can find even more stories about how people use Discord right here. Cyndie, a parent of two from North Carolina, reflects on how her family uses Discord: aThere are four of us we all have Discord installed on both our computers phones. My oldest son is in an apartment, younger one is on campus, so we use Discord to make family plans. Everything gets dropped into that server. From dinneras ready to internships job offers. Usually itas silly, stupid stuff we just drop in that makes us all laugh, like when thereas a Weird Al question on Jeopardy. I canat imagine life without it.a Genavieve, a high-school student from California, talks about how her classes use Discord: "I've been using Discord for last two years as my main communication with my friends. We had too many people in our group chat wanted a platform where we could all communicate with each other. Discord is a great way for a friend group of thirty people to stay in touch! Also, with distance learning in place, Iave started using it with my AP Physics class too. It's been so important to feel connected to our teachers each other when we are so isolated in such a difficult class. Using Discord brought us closer together as a class a we are already a small class of 22 students, so being able to joke around send memes helps us not feel so alone during distance learning. different channels @mentions make it much easier to keep information straight. Screenshare makes it even easier, so we can show each other documents problems we are working on to get feedback troubleshooting advice.a David, a physics math tutor from New Jersey, talks about how he teaches students connects with other teachers over Discord: "I use Discord to tutor one of my students to stay up to date with conversations announcements in a group of physics teachers interested in physics education research. It's nice to see a side-by-side camera view of my desk with student's work. I also really like that audio through OPUS codec which sounds very clean." a a Reporting Abusive Behavior to Discord Reporting a Message If violation happened in a server, you can also reach out to serveras moderators, who may be able to respond immediately help resolve your concerns. In addition, please remember that you always have ability to block any users that you donat want to interact with anymore. Do not mislead Discordas support teams. Do not make false malicious reports to our Trust & Safety other customer support teams, send multiple reports about same issue, ask a group of users to report same content issue. Repeated violations of this guideline may result in loss of access to our reporting functions. What to do if you receive a violent threat, someone is at risk of Self-harm If a credible threat of violence has been made you someone else are in immediate danger, if someone is considering self-harm is in immediate danger, please contact your local law enforcement agency. Additionally, if you are in United States, you can contact Crisis Text Line to speak with a volunteer crisis counselor to help you a friend through any mental health crisis by texting DISCORD to 741741. Select type of abuse you're seeinga Reports Under EU Digital Services Act EU users can report illegal content under EU Digital Services Act by clicking here. EU government entities reporting illegal content should follow process outlined here. EU users will be required to go through a verification process follow prompts to provide details descriptions for their report. When reporting a message under EU Digital Services Act, a message URL is required. Hereas how to find message URL for desktop mobile apps. Desktop App Mobile App What Happens After I Submit a Report? When you submit a report, weall send a system DM email to let you know that we have received it. Reports are processed based on priority as described below, we use a combination of automated human-powered review methods to process reports. We may also let you know if there are safety features available that could help you address potential harm more quickly. time it takes for us to review a report depends on type of content severity of violation: Report review times may fluctuate due to process changes, volume surges, technical issues, backlogs. While not every report identifies a violation of Discordas policies, your reports help us improve enhance Discord's safety practices. We will let you know if we identified a violation of our policies based on your report. When you submit a report, your identity is not shared with account you reported. This is true even if report is appealed. We never intentionally disclose identity of a reporter unless we are legally required to do so. Examples of when this may be case are if Discord receives valid legal process requiring us to provide identity of reporter requests to remove content under Digital Millennium Copyright Act (aDMCAa). DMCA allows reported user to request further details about complaint, including name email address of claimant, a description of allegedly infringed work, reported content. In such cases, Discord provides this information in accordance with copyright law requirements. You can read more about reports we receive actions we take on violations of our Community Guidelines Terms of Service in our Transparency Report. Mental health on Discord Contact your server admins If someone has posted comments about harming themselves in a server, you may consider reaching out to your server administrators owner to let them know about situation, so they can moderate their server as needed provide support to server member. Provide some support resources If you are still in touch with user, you may wish to provide them with one of help hotlines listed below. Talk to a parent trusted adult You may not feel qualified to help a friend who expresses their desire to hurt themselves, it may be helpful to ask a parent another trusted adult for help in handling situation. Report to Trust & Safety All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. When we receive reports of self-harm threats, we investigate situation may contact authorities, but in event of an emergency, we encourage you to contact law enforcement in addition to contacting us. Please note that for privacy security reasons we are unable to provide personal information such as contact information location to someone who is not account holder. If you are concerned that someone is in immediate danger, please contact law enforcement. Contact law enforcement If you another user you know is in urgent trouble, please contact authorities right away, regardless of limited information you might be able to provide. Law enforcement has investigative resources can contact Discord Trust & Safety for information that we aren't allowed to disclose otherwise can identify those users to get them help. Discord is a voice, video, text chat app that's used by tens of millions of people ages 13+ to talk hang out with their communities friends. vast majority of servers are private, invite-only spaces for groups of friends communities to stay in touch spend time together. There are also larger, more open communities, generally centered around specific topics. Users have control over whom they interact with what their experience on Discord is. Contact Information Service of Process Please submit your inquiry in our Government Request Portal at: https://app.kodex.us/discord/signin. Our online portal will guide you through how to submit a request. You will need to: 1. Verify your email address via link sent to your email address (only valid law enforcement government domains will be accepted);2. Fill in required fields in webform;3. Upload a copy of any relevant documents in PDF format (for example, a copy of subpoena search warrant, as well as any non-disclosure order you may have). Our online portal also allows you to add information, ask us questions, download information when it is available. Emergency Requests Preservation Request International Legal Requests Child Safety Policy Data Retention Policy User Notification It is our policy to notify Discord users provide them with a copy of legal process seeking their account information. We do not provide notice if we are prohibited by law under exceptional circumstances such as child sexual exploitation investigations threat to life emergencies. We ask that your non-disclosure order (18 U.S.C. A 2705(b)) similar legal authority include a time limitation, as we provide delayed notice upon expiration of this limitation when we believe exceptional circumstance no longer exists. If no non-disclosure provision exception is included with your legal request, Discord will confirm with law enforcement before providing user notice. In order to expedite your legal request for account information, we ask that you include inform us initially of one of following: Note: Discord reserves right to not notify users if doing so would pose a risk to Discord its users general welfare. If your data request places Discord on notice of an ongoing prior violation of our Terms of Service, Community Guidelines other policies, we may take action to prevent further abuse, including account termination other actions that may notify user that we are aware of their misconduct. Cost Reimbursement a aEU Contact Points Still have questions? If needed for mail service, our physical address is as follows: For requests relating to all users other than those in EEA UK: Discord, Inc. 444 De Haro St, Suite 200 San Francisco, CA, 94107United States of AmericaFor requests relating to users in EEA UK: Discord Netherlands BVSchiphol Boulevard 195, 1118 BG Schiphol, Netherlands If serving process by mail, please direct mail to attention of Legal Department. a Our Policies Weare all about helping millions of communities, small big, find a home online to talk, hang out, have meaningful conversations. That means we need to find right balance between giving people a place to express themselves promoting a welcoming safe environment for everyone. Our Approach to Content ModerationA We currently employ three levers to moderate user content on Discord, while being mindful of user privacy:A Our Community Guidelines define what is isn't okay to do on Discord. Every person on Discord should feel like their voice can be heard, but not at expense of someone else. If you come across a message that appears to break these rules, please report it to your server moderator to us. If content behavior violates our Guidelines we may take a number of enforcement actions including but not limited to issuing warnings; removing content; disabling removing accounts and/or servers responsible; reporting them to law enforcement. Learn more about our Community Guidelines here Terms of Service here. a a What actions we take When our Trust & Safety team confirms that there has been a violation of our Community Guidelines, team takes immediate steps to mitigate harm and, wherever possible, help users avoid breaking rules in future. following are actions that we might take on either users and/or servers: Discord also works with law enforcement agencies in cases of immediate danger and/or self-harm. We swiftly report child abuse material content users responsible to National Center for Missing Exploited Children. a a How You Can Appeal Our Actions Every user can appeal actions taken against their account.A While we do our best to ensure that weare only taking action when itas warranted, weare not perfect mistakes might happen. We recognize appeals are an important part of process. Just as you deserve a chance to be heard when some action is taken against you offline, you should have such a chance to be heard when action is taken against your Discord account by us. process reflects Discord's commitment to internationally recognized human rights set out in United Nations Guiding Principles on Business Human Rights (UNGPs), privacy, free expression. If you think we took unwarranted action against your account, you can reach out to us so we can review your case.A You may appeal decision directly in Discord app by going to User Settings > Privacy & Safety > selecting violation you want to appeal > pressing on Let us know to begin submitting a review of your violation account. For users in EU, you may also choose an alternative resolution option when applicable. What happens when we grant an appeal? If our reviewers find that violation was issued in error, we will remove it from your account restore your account standing. Any actions that were result of that violation will be removed. If there are other active violations on your account, you may still not regain full access to Discord. You can read more about violations in Discord Warning System. What if my appeal was denied? If our reviewers find that action taken was correct, we will send a message to let you know. violation will remain on your account until it expires, if applicable. You can view any active expired violations in Privacy & Safety Settings > Account Standing. What if my appeal was deemed ineligible for review? In some cases, we are unable to review certain appeals due to nature of violation incomplete information provided. Even if we canat review appeal, your feedback helps us improve these systems over time. If your teen encounters an issue Even though majority of Discord usage is in small, private, invite-only groups, we understand that there may be times when people in these groups behave in ways that make others uncomfortable post content that isnat allowed. Our Community Guidelines outline how all users should act on Discord what we allow do not allow. We recommend reviewing these with your teen so that you both know what behavior is isnat okay on platform. Among other things, we do not allow: If your teen encounters a violation of our Community Guidelines, such as harassment inappropriate content, please file a report with details that you can gather. Our Trust & Safety team strives to ensure bad users don't disrupt your teenas experience on Discord. We also provide a number of tools to ensure that teens (and everyone else) have control over their Discord experience. a a Answering parents' educators' top questions 1. Is Discord safe for my teens to use? There are a few things that make Discord a great safe place for teens: To help your teen use Discord safely, itas important to understand how Discord works how you can best control your teenas experience on it. We have listed a number of tips to do so here. Just like with every other online service, best way to ensure your teen stays safe online is to have clear guidelines on what they should shouldnat be looking at posting online, make sure that you keep clear lines of communication with them. 2. What is minimum age to be on Discord? How do you ensure teens under 13 canat create an account? Discord's Terms of Service require people to be over a minimum age to access our app website. minimum age to access Discord is 13, unless local legislation mandates an older age. To ensure that users satisfy that minimum age requirement, users are asked to confirm their date of birth upon creating an account. Learn more about how we use this age information here. If a user is reported as being under 13, we delete their account unless they can verify that they are at least 13 years old using an official ID document. 3. What personal information does Discord collect about my teen? Do you sell it? Discord does not ask for a real name when a user signs up, we do not sell user data. To learn more about what information we collect how we use this information, please see our Privacy Policy. 4. Can my teen be exposed to inappropriate content on Discord? Like on every internet platform, there is age-restricted content on Discord. Each user chooses which servers they want to join who they want to interact with. In servers, age-restricted content must be posted in a channel marked as age-restricted, which cannot be accessed by users under 18. For Direct Messages, we recommend that every user under 18 activates explicit media content filter by selecting "Keep Me Safe" under "Safe Direct Messaging" heading in Privacy & Safety section of their User Settings. When a user chooses "Keep Me Safe" setting, images videos in all direct messages are scanned by Discord explicit media content is blocked. We believe that best way to make sure that your teenagers are only accessing content that they should is to set clear guidelines on what they should shouldnat be looking at posting online, make sure that you keep clear lines of communication with them. 5. Can my teen interact with people they donat know on Discord? Unlike other platforms where someone might be able to message you as soon as you sign up for an account (before you have added any friends joined any servers), this isnat case on Discord. In order for another user to send a direct message (DM)A to your teen, your teen must either (1)A accept other user as a friend (2) decide to join a server that other user is a member of. Each user has control over following: Users should only accept friend requests from users that they know trust. If your teen isnat sure, thereas no harm in rejecting friend request. They can always add that user later if itas a mistake. If your teen is ever uncomfortable interacting with someone on Discord, they can always block that specific user. Blocking a user removes them from your teen's Friends List, prevents them from messaging your teen directly, hides their messages in any shared servers. 6. Are there parental controls on Discord I can use to control my teen's account? We have detailed all controls you have to help make your teenas account safer here. We recommend going through these settings together with your teen having an open conversation about why you are choosing certain settings. iOS Android operating systems offer parental controls that can help you manage your teen's phone usage, including Discord, if needed. Apple Microsoft offer similar controls for computers. 7. How can I monitor what my teen is doing on Discord? Privacy is incredibly important to us, including your teenas privacy. We canat share their login information with you, but we encourage you to discuss how to use Discord safely directly with your teen. 8. What are Student Hubs? Discord Hubs for Students allow students to verify their Discord account with their official student email, unlock access to an exclusive hub for students at their school. Within hub, they can connect with other verified students, discover servers for study groups classes, share their own servers for fellow students to join. Hubs are not affiliated with managed by a school school staff. Servers in a Hub are student-run but may include non-students. For more information on Student Hubs, please check out our Student Hubs FAQs. 9. What safety measures are in place for students participating in Student Hubs? Only those with a school-assigned email address can access a schoolas specific hub. Click here to dive into our Student Hubs guidelines. All servers users in hub must also comply with our Community Guidelines, Terms of Service, Privacy Policy. We also have all of our existing moderator controls for servers, such as setting specific roles access to #channels in a server, blocking, banning, mod bots, more. Students can also submit a report from within their hub to bring attention to any inappropriate behavior. Role of administrators moderators on Discord Administrators are people who create Discord servers around specific interests. They establish rules for participating, can invite people to join, oversee health well-being of their community. They have broad administrative control, can bring in moderators to manage community members. They can also ban remove members and, if necessary, remove replace moderators. Administrators also choose moderators to play a vital role in Discord communities. responsibilities of a moderator might vary, but their overall role is to ensure that their Discord server is a safe, healthy environment for everyone. They can do things like moderate delete messages, as well as invite, ban, suspend people who violate serveras rules. best moderators typically are seasoned enthusiastic participants in one more communities. Admins moderators are your first go-to when you encounter an issue in a server. They may be able to respond immediately help resolve your concerns. Each Discord server should have written rules for behavior to alleviate confusion misunderstanding about guidelines for that particular community. These rules, which supplement our Community Guidelines, are your tools to moderate efficiently transparently. As communities grow, moderators can add more mods to keep their server a fun welcoming place to be. a a

Discord @ GDC 2025 Discord is back ready for yet another incredible Game Developers Conference 2025. Find us at Discord booth on Expo Floor in South Hall (#S1627). GDC 2025 Programming Schedule Whether itas your first time at Moscone Center your 10th, weave got lots of events to help inspire kickstart your game-building experience on Discord. A Game Developer's Guide: Building Running Your Discord Community Presented by: Colin Loretz, Senior Developer Advocate, Discord a Learn how to leverage Discord as a powerful tool for early-stage game development community building. This talk provides practical insights into creating managing private playtest servers that foster meaningful relationships with your earliest supporters while gathering crucial gameplay feedback. This talk explores how team optimized game for Discord's inherently social environment, driving daily player engagement fostering a vibrant community. Insights for Devs: Engage Grow Your Audience on Discord Presented by: Tim Liu, Staff Data Scientist, Discord; Robinson Eaton, Staff User Experience Researcher, Discord a Join Discord's data UXR teams as we dive into platform insights developer success stories that reveal what Discord's gaming audience truly cares about. Transparency Reports Discord Transparency Report: January - June 2024 We built Discord to be best communication tool for people to hang out talk together around playing their favorite games. To achieve this mission, we know that Discord must be a safe space for our users. Thatas why safety is integrated into every aspect of our product policies, why about 15% of all Discord employees are dedicated to this work. Community Guidelines Enforcement Discord publishes maintains a comprehensive set of Community Guidelines that explains what content behavior is is not allowed on platform. Our Policy Hub expands on these Guidelines, providing more information about our policies. Combating harmful behavior requires industry-wide collaboration. Discord is deeply committed to making internet Discord safer, both through our own proactive interventions with our various partners. We invest in proactive measures to detect remove content that violates our policies by leveraging advanced tooling, machine learning, specialized teams, we partner with external industry experts. We also make it easy for people to report violative content behavior, we encourage users, moderators, our Safety Reporting Network to submit reports directly to our team. We investigate these reports may take a number of enforcement actions including, but not limited to: issuing warnings; temporarily suspending an account; temporarily limiting certain features of an account; removing content; disabling removing accounts and/or servers responsible; reporting them to law enforcement when applicable. This report details actions Discord has taken on accounts servers that have violated our Community Guidelines Terms of Service. Transparency Reporting at Discord This Transparency Report is our fifteenth since 2019. During this time, weave evolved structure of our reports in order to provide most accurate holistic report of work we do. Weare making a number of changes in this report to reflect just that. First, weare shifting cadence of publication from quarterly to semiannual to provide a more cohesive narrative of all of work we do to keep people safe. This report covers first half of 2024, from January through June. This report also includes new data from our Warning System, a tool that provides more transparency about interventions we take to help users who violate our rules learn how to do better in future. As a result of introduction of Warning System, we've also made changes to better reflect our updated, holistic approach to moderation. For example, this report no longer counts how many servers were proactively removed because that number is not effective at assessing full impact of our safety operations. As we learn more about ways in which Warning System changes landscape of actions we take, our approach will evolve, weall continue providing level of transparency that we strive to maintain. These updates demonstrate our commitment to expanding actions we take to enforce our Community Guidelines in an updated fairer way. Some violations are more serious than others, weall take appropriate action depending on severity of violation. When appropriate, we focus less on disabling accounts servers at outset, instead add more opportunities to learn our rules. We also let users know how their violations may impact their overall account standing provide information on how to avoid further violations more significant actions being taken on their accounts. Users can find this information in Accounts Server Interventions section, which provides information for warnings, temporary suspensions, other forms of intervention that limit account features. Accounts Servers: Warnings & Temporary Interventions* *Updated 11/22/24 Discord employs a variety of interventions against accounts servers including warnings, temporary suspensions, interventions that limit various features for an account. We took action on 371,229 individual accounts, 831 servers, 4,618,564 server members. You can find more information about these interventions our Warning System here. Accounts Disabled* *Updated 11/22/24 We disabled 398,714 accounts for policy violations not including spam during this period. We disabled an additional 35,456,553 accounts for spam spam-related offenses. Servers Removed* *Updated 11/22/24 We removed 42,018 servers during this period. Appeals Discord allows users to appeal actions taken on their accounts if they believe that enforcement was incorrect. We review appeals to determine if a mistake was made if we believe, based on appeal, that user has recognized low-harm violation they committed will abide by our Community Guidelines in future. We received appeals from 1.85% of unique accounts that had any enforcement action taken against them. From these appeals, we restored 1,705 accounts to their pre-intervention status, which was 2.59% of accounts that submitted an appeal. Reports Received By Category We received 29,495,313 reports during this period. largest category of reports related to Platform Manipulation, which includes all reports for spam. You can learn more about reporting abusive behavior to Discord here. Discord has a zero-tolerance policy for anyone who endangers sexualizes children. Child-harm content is appalling, unacceptable, has no place on Discord in society. We have a long-established team focused solely on child safety a dedicated safety engineering team. Discord is committed to continually exploring new improved safeguards that help keep younger users safe on our platform online. We collaborate with members of industry, policymakers, law enforcement, others to extend our efforts beyond Discord. We invest in resources education to help parents guardians understand how our platform works how to create a safe positive experience for their teens. Discord actively supports National Center for Missing Exploited Children (NCMEC) reports users who upload child abuse material engage in other activity that seeks to exploit minors to NCMEC. As a member of Technology Coalition, we collaborate with industry partners to drive critical advances in technology adoption of best practices for keeping teen users safe online. Within Technology Coalition, Discord helped pilot Lantern initiative, a first-of-its-kind signal-sharing program for companies to enhance strengthen how we detect attempts to sexually exploit abuse children teens online. We also partner with Thorn Digital Wellness Lab to integrate their expertise research on teen health social media into our products policies, including development of our Teen Charter. Discord is also a proud sponsor of National Parent Teacher Association ConnectSafely is an active member of Family Online Safety Institute. We partner with INHOPE, global network combatting online child sexual abuse material, are a member of Internet Watch Foundation, whose resources we use to identify prevent child sexual abuse imagery. We also sponsor events dedicated to increasing awareness of, action on, child safety issues such as annual Dallas Crimes Against Children Conference. At Discord, part of our holistic approach to safety also includes products features for parents teens. Our Family Center empowers parents guardians to stay informed about their teenas Discord activity, our Teen Safety Assist features, which are enabled by default for teens, include safety alerts sensitive content filters. We also publish our Guardians Guide to help teens stay safer on Discord. You can read our Child Safety policies, developed with benefit of latest research, best practices, expertise here. Discord took action on 346,482 distinct accounts for Child Safety during this period. This included disabling 178,165 accounts removing 7,462 servers. We reported 101,585 accounts to NCMEC as a result of CSAM that was identified by our hashing systems, reactive reporting, additional proactive investigations. Deceptive Practices Using Discord for purpose of financial scams, malicious conduct, fraud services is a violation of our Community Guidelines. You can read more about our Deceptive Practices policy here. Discord took action on 33,482 distinct accounts for Deceptive Practices during this period, including disabling 24,322 accounts removing 1,207 servers. Exploitative Unsolicited Content It is a violation of our Community Guidelines to share, distribute, create sexually explicit content depicting other people without their consent. You can read more about our Exploitative Unsolicited Content policies here here. Discord took action on 2,091,583 distinct accounts for Exploitative Unsolicited Content during this period, including disabling 48,571 accounts removing 1,835 servers. Harassment Bullying Harassment bullying have no place on Discord. Promoting, coordinating, engaging in harassment, threatening to harm another individual group of people, sharing threatening to share someoneas personally identifiable information (also known as doxxing) are violations of our Community Guidelines. You can read more about our Harassment Bullying policy here our Doxxing policy here. Discord took action on 92,295 distinct accounts for Harassment Bullying during this period, including disabling 19,283 accounts removing 1,210 servers. Hateful Conduct Hate threats of harm targeted at individuals communities is not tolerated on Discord. Using hate speech engaging in other hateful conduct are violations of our Community Guidelines. We define hate speech as any form of expression that either attacks other people promotes hatred violence against them based on their protected characteristics. You can read more about our Hateful Conduct policy here. Discord took action on 67,969 distinct accounts for Hateful Conduct during this period, including disabling 5,457 accounts removing 1,593 servers. Identity Authenticity Using Discord to misrepresent your identity on Discord in a deceptive harmful way evade permanent Discord-level enforcement action is a violation of our Community Guidelines. You can read more about our Identity Authenticity policy here. Discord took action on 10,891 distinct accounts for Identity Authenticity during this period, including disabling 10,004 accounts removing 1,298 servers. Misinformation It is a violation of our Community Guidelines to share false misleading information. You can read more about our Misinformation policy here. Discord took action on 26 distinct accounts for Misinformation during this period, including disabling 3 accounts, removed 3 servers. Platform Manipulation Spam, fake accounts, self-bots are examples of platform manipulation that damage experience of our users violate our Community Guidelines. You can read more about our Platform Manipulation policy here. We are focused on combating spam minimizing usersa exposure to spammers spam content on Discord. We have a dedicated cross-functional anti-spam team building sophisticated anti-spam measures. You can learn more about how Discord combats spam here read more here about Automod, a safety feature that enables server owners to automatically moderate certain abuse, including spam. Discord took action on 2,098 distinct accounts for non-spam-related Platform Manipulation issues during this period, including disabling 2,050 accounts, removed 732 servers. An additional 35,456,553 accounts were disabled for spam spam-related offenses.A Regulated Illegal Activities Using Discord to organize, promote, engage in any illegal behavior is a violation of our Community Guidelines. You can read more about our Regulated Illegal Activities policies here here. Discord took action on 795,569 distinct accounts for Regulated Illegal Activities during this period, including disabling 26,810 accounts removing 15,107 servers. Self-Harm Concerns For those experiencing mental health challenges, finding a community that is navigating similar challenges can be incredibly helpful for support. That said, platforms have a critical role to play in ensuring that these spaces do not normalize, promote, encourage others to engage in acts of self-harm. We take action on content that seeks to normalize self-harming behaviors, as well as content that encourages self-harm behaviors discourages individuals from seeking help for self-harm behaviors. These actions are only taken on accounts glorifying promoting acts of self-harm, not on users seeking help in need of medical attention. You can read more about this policy here. We are proud to partner with Crisis Text Line, a nonprofit that provides 24/7 text-based mental health support crisis intervention in English Spanish via trained volunteer crisis counselors in US. If a user reports a message for self-harm on Discord, they will be presented with information on how to connect with a volunteer Crisis Counselor. You can learn more about Crisis Text Line here about our partnership here. Since launch of our partnership, there have been over 3,000 CrisisTextLine conversations that were started by texting aDISCORDa. As part of our efforts to provide resources for all users, weare excited to partner with ThroughLine Care, a global network of vetted helplines. Non-US Discord users can find helplines in their country by going to discord.findahelpline.com. Learn more by checking out Family Center. Discord took action on 18,781 distinct accounts for Self-Harm Concerns during this period, including disabling 5,425 accounts removing 4,785 servers. Violent Graphic Content Real media depicting gore, excessive violence, animal cruelty is not allowed on Discord. You can read about our Violent Graphic Content policy here. Discord took action on 92,567 distinct accounts for Violent Graphic Content during this period. This included disabling 20,657 accounts removing 3,163 servers. Violent Extremism Discord has a zero-tolerance policy against violent extremism, it is against our Community Guidelines to organize, promote, support violent extremist activities beliefs. term violent extremist organization describes groups that promote a political, ideological, religious agenda tolerate, advocate for, use violence to achieve their goals.. We also take reported off-platform harmful activities into account when evaluating potential violations of this policy. We partner with industry-leading organizations, such as Global Internet Forum To Counter Terrorism (GIFCT), European Union Internet Forum, Christchurch Call, other organizations across world to combat extremism understand global trends. Discord also leads its own Safety Reporting Network for direct communication with expert third parties, including researchers, industry peers, journalists, for intelligence sharing about potential extremist hateful content activity on platform. We also take appropriate action based on wider platform trends intelligence we receive. Discord took action on 17,567 distinct accounts for Violent Extremism during this period, including disabling 16,309 account, removing 2,607 servers. When appropriate, Discord complies with information requests from law enforcement agencies while respecting privacy rights of our users. When law enforcement seeks to compel Discord to disclose user information, it must provide valid legal process for requested information, we review each information request to ensure legal compliance. Discord determines what data to disclose based on type of legal process received data requested.A Discord may also disclose user data to law enforcement in emergency situations when we possess a good-faith belief that there is an imminent risk of serious physical injury death. You can read more about how Discord works with law enforcement here. United States Government Information Request Discord received 3,782 legal requests from federal state authorities in United States during this period, finding 3,223 (85%) both legally valid specific enough for us to identify an account produce relevant information. International Government Information Requests Discord received 545 international legal requests during this period, finding 126 (23%) both legally valid specific enough for us to identify an account produce relevant information. Note: Discord currently complies with international requests via Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) letters rogatory process evaluates requests to disclose from foreign governments on a case-by-case basis. During this period, 22 U.S. court order requests were identified as having been issued as a result of MLAT requests that originated in: Brazil; Canada; Croatia; Czech Republic; France; Germany; Greece; Ireland; Latvia; Netherlands; Slovakia; Spain; Switzerland. Preservation Requests Discord received 3,235 preservation requests globally during this period, finding 2,081 (64%) valid specific enough for us to identify an account preserve relevant information. We preserve information for 90 days offer a one-time extension as needed. Emergency Requests Discord received 539 emergency disclosure requests from law enforcement during this period. These requests originated from law enforcement agencies around world. We disclose user data to law enforcement absent legal process only when we possess a good-faith belief that there is an imminent risk of serious physical injury death. Our specialized team reviews each emergency request to authenticate requester confirm request meets our threshold for voluntary disclosure. Based on information provided by law enforcement, Discord disclosed information in response to 314 (58%) of those requests. Our Community Guidelines Terms of Service prohibit sharing of content that infringes third-party intellectual property rights. In accordance with Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) other applicable laws, Discord will remove content and/or accounts in connection with claims of copyright infringement on platform. You can read about our unauthorized copyright access policy here. We review each DMCA notice to ensure reports are valid, complete, made in good faith. Discord received 2,927 facially valid DMCA takedown notifications during this period, of which 2,040 (70%) provided information sufficient for content removal. Upon review, 400 of these notifications flagged content that had already been removed by users.

Discord Community Guidelines a We created Discord to be best place to talk, hang out, have fun with friends online. Our Community Guidelines ensure everyone can express themselves find community a but not at expense of anyone else. These Guidelines explain what isnat allowed on Discord. Everyone on Discord must follow these rules, they apply to all parts of our platform, including your content, behaviors, servers, Apps. To learn more about requirements for developing a bot other App, please refer to our Discord Developer Terms of Service our Discord Developer Policy. If you plan to monetize your content, please review additional rules outlined in our Monetization Policy Monetization Terms. Our Trust & Safety team reviews reports by users, moderators, trusted third-party partners, where required by law. When we reactively proactively discover a violation of these Guidelines, we may take a number of enforcement steps against them, including issuing warnings, removing content, suspending removing violative accounts and/or servers, potentially reporting them to law enforcement. We may consider relevant off-platform behavior when making assessments for violations of specific Community Guidelines. If you come across an account, server, content that appears to break these Guidelines, please report it to us.a Respect Each Other 1. Do not promote, coordinate, engage in harassment. We do not allow any type of harassing behavior, including sustained bullying, sexual harassment, ban block evasion, coordinating server joins for purpose of harassing server members (aserver raidinga). (See our Bullying, Harassment, Threats Policy Explainer for more.) 2. Do not threaten to harm another individual group of people. This includes direct, indirect, suggestive threats. (See our Bullying, Harassment, Threats Policy Explainer for more.) 3. Do not share threaten to share personally identifiable information (PII) of an individual without consent. This includes providing services that facilitate doxxing, such as buying selling doxxes compiling doxxes for others. (See our Doxxing Policy Explainer for more.) 4. Do not use hate speech engage in other hateful conduct. This includes use of hate symbols, imagery, claims that deny history of mass human atrocities.A We consider hate speech to be any form of expression that either attacks other people promotes hatred violence against them based on their protected characteristics. (See our Hateful Conduct Policy Explainer for more.) 5. Do not organize, promote, support violent extremism. This also includes coordinating violent acts; glorifying promoting violence perpetrators of violent acts; promoting conspiracy theories that could encourage incite violence against others. (See our Violent Extremism Violence Graphic Content Policy Explainers for more.) 6. Do not solicit, share, make any attempt to distribute content that depicts, promotes, attempts to normalize child sexual abuse. Also, do not post content engage in conduct that in any way sexualizes children. This includes real as well as manipulated media, animation (such as lolicon), any type of digital creation (note that this includes AI-generated media). We report child sexual abuse material (CSAM) grooming to National Center for Missing & Exploited Children, which may subsequently work with local law enforcement. (See our Teen Child Safety Policy Explainer for more.) 7. If you are under age of 18, do not engage in sexual conduct any conduct that puts your online physical safety at risk. This includes consensual sexual interactions between teens, as well as any encouragement coordination of potentially risky behaviors, such as vigilantism.A We want teens to be able to express themselves freely on Discord as much as possible, but given risks associated with online dating, we will remove spaces that encourage facilitate dating between teens. (See our Teen Child Safety Policy Explainer for more.) 8. Do not solicit sexual content from engage in any sexual conduct with anyone under age of 18. We report child sexual abuse material (CSAM) grooming to National Center for Missing & Exploited Children, which may subsequently work with local law enforcement. (See our Teen Child Safety Policy Explainer for more.) 9. Do not make sexually explicit content available to anyone under age of 18. You must be age 18 older to engage with adult content on Discord.A Server owners must apply an age-restricted label to any channels that contain sexually explicit content. Users may not post sexually explicit content in any space that cannot be age-restricted, including in avatars, custom statuses bios, server banners, server icons, invite splashes, emoji, stickers. (See our Sexual Content Policy Explainer for more.) 10. Do not share, distribute, create sexually explicit sexually suggestive content of other people without subjectas consent. This includes non-consensual distribution of intimate media that was created either with without an individualas consent. (See our Non-Consensual Adult Intimate Media Policy Explainer for more.) 11. Do not share content that glorifies, promotes, normalizes suicide other acts of physical self-harm. This includes content that encourages others to cut, burn, starve themselves, as well as content that normalizes eating disorders, such as anorexia bulimia. Self-harm acts threats used as a form of emotional manipulation coercion are also prohibited. (See our Suicide Self-Harm Policy Explainer for more.) 12. Do not share real media depicting gore, excessive violence, animal harm, especially with intention to harass shock others. (See our Violence Graphic Content Policy Explainer for more.) Respect Discord 13. Do not send unsolicited bulk messages (or spam) to others. Also, do not facilitate this activity, such as by selling spambots, server araida tools, account-creation tools, token generators, CAPTCHA-solving services, other spam tools. (See our Platform Manipulation Policy Explainer for more.) 14. Do not use self-bots user-bots. Each account must be associated with a human, not a bot. (See our Platform Manipulation Policy Explainer for more.) 15. Do not engage with our service in an inauthentic way. This includes artificially inflating server membership, manipulating engagement metrics, selling artificial engagement services. (See our Platform Manipulation Policy Explainer for more.) 16. Do not sell purchase Discord assets, including accounts, usernames, servers, server permissions, custom server invite links. (See our Platform Manipulation Policy Explainer for more.) Abuse of Discord's paid features monetization opportunities are covered under our Paid Service Terms. 17. Do not share false misleading information (otherwise known as misinformation). Content that is false, misleading, can lead to significant risk of physical societal harm may not be shared on Discord. We may remove content if we reasonably believe its spread could result in damage to physical infrastructure, injury of others, obstruction of participation in civic processes, endangerment of public health. (See our Misinformation Policy Explainer for more.) 18. Do not misrepresent your identity on Discord in a deceptive harmful way. This includes creating fake profiles attempts to impersonate an individual, group, organization. (See our Identity Authenticity Policy Explainer for more.) 19. Do not evade permanent Discord-level enforcement actions. This includes creating new using existing accounts communities after being removed for violating our platform rules. (See our Identity Authenticity Policy Explainer for more.) 20. Do not engage in activities that could damage compromise security of an account, network, system. This includes using deceptive techniques to trick others into revealing sensitive information (phishing), using malicious software (malware), flooding a target with traffic in order to make a resource unavailable (denial-of-service attacks). (See our Deceptive Practices Policy Explainer for more.) 21. Do not use attempt to use Discord to promote, coordinate, execute financial scams. A financial scam is any intentionally deceptive act taken with intent to receive an illegal, unethical, otherwise dishonest gain. (See our Deceptive Practices Policy Explainer for more.) 22. Do not engage in activities that fraudulently generate a profit at expense of others. This includes facilitating, providing instructions for, participating in fraud. We do not allow coordinated efforts to defraud businesses, price gouging, forgery, money laundering, counterfeit goods, tools that facilitate illegal behavior. (See our Deceptive Practices Policy Explainer for more.) 23. Do not submit false, misleading, abusive reports requests to Discordas support teams. A report request will be considered false misleading if it contains demonstrably untrue information submitted with intent to manipulate staff into taking a desired action. (See our Discord Support Abuse Policy Explainer for more.) Follow Law 24. Do not share content that violates anyone's intellectual property other rights. This includes sharing selling game cheats hacks. (See our Unauthorized Copyright Access Policy for more.)A For more information on how Discord handles copyright complaints, please view our Copyright & Intellectual Property Policy. 25. Do not organize, promote, engage in selling facilitation of sales of regulated potentially dangerous goods. Regulated goods have laws in place that restrict purchase, sale, trade, ownership of goods. Dangerous goods have a reasonable potential to cause real-world, physical harm to individuals. (See our Dangerous Regulated Goods Policy Explainer for more.) 26. Do not coordinate participate in illegal gambling. Users are responsible for complying with applicable gambling laws regulation. (See our Gambling Policy Explainer for more.) 27. Do not organize, promote, engage in any other illegal activity, such as human trafficking sexual solicitation. (See our Human Trafficking Sexual Solicitation Policy Explainers for more.)a If you see any content activity that violates these Guidelines, our Terms of Service, our other policies, please report it to us. You can learn more on how to report to us here. However, please note that we strongly discourage may take action against vigilantism, as this behavior can put individuals in harmas way can also interfere with our investigations ability to report to law enforcement. These Guidelines will continue to evolve over time. This means we may take action against an account, server, content that violates spirit of these Guidelines when we encounter a new threat harm that is not explicitly covered in current version. We will always make our best effort to notify you when we update these Guidelines, but it is up to you to follow spirit of them: Keep Discord safe help us continue to make it best place to talk, hang out have fun with friends online. Thanks for doing your part.a a

When itas time for fun, find your party here Working at Discord is like hanging out on your favorite server; our employees hang out play games together, talk about their favorite hobbies, build inclusive spaces where employees can offer mentorship guidance. Questions about our hiring process? Check out our frequently asked questions. At least 18 years old. If you are under 18, unfortunately we cannot hire you! We often hire interns for various roles across company, aligned to summer intern recruiting season. Please feel free to check back in on ainternshipsa section of our jobs page. If you donat see anything there (or ainternshipsa category itself), that means we donat currently have any roles open. Our San Francisco HQ typically offers most variety of roles, is also where we all gather regularly to fully experience Discord culture. For roles that are remote, we are able to have people join our team from any of 50 states in USA. majority of our roles are US based. We are also able to hire folks in Canada, but only in Ontario, Quebec, British Columbia at moment. We also have a few specialized roles in Netherlands! Each job posting will state location requirement, so be sure to review all details in description. Discordas immigration policy includes: If you have any questions about these policies, be sure to connect with your recruiter should you be selected to interview! Thanks a ton for applying! We do our best to respond to each person who applies within two weeks. Given incredibly high number of applicants to some roles, we cannot guarantee each candidate will get a response directly from a recruiter. We appreciate your patience! Weare hyped youare interested! Recruiters hiring managers are unable to meet with everyone whoas interested due to time constraints, but also to ensure a fair equitable hiring process! best thing to do is apply for role team will be sure to take a look. You can! Although, we recommend that you apply only to roles you are most interested in qualified for. Please note that you may hear back at different times for each role you apply to, you can expect a separate update for each role. This could mean a variety of things - ranging from high applicant volume that needs to be reviewed, to role already being filled. Keep an eye on jobs page for any similar roles, role being posted again! We have offices in San Francisco Amsterdam! We are a hybrid company treat our internal staff Discord server as our HQ. If youare selected to interview, your recruiter will share all details you need to know about entire interview process - including how to prepare for each stage. Donat hesitate to ask questions! Double check job description to see if one is required! Itas never a bad idea to write a cover letter, since it gives us a chance to get to know you better. Applicants sometimes run into one of these errors: If you see one of these, we recommend these solutions: If you run into an error regarding uploading an html word doc, try uploading a PDF instead! When someone refers you, you give them your resume any other application materials - they then submit it on your behalf. No other action is needed on your end, weall be in touch if you are a good fit for role! You can find base salary ranges on every job posting (above aExperience Life at Discorda section)! You can find an outline of our benefits on this page at aExperience Life at Discord.a Hungry for more? Check out our company principles to learn even moreA about what makes Discord a special place to work!
