Moderators no longer need to act as amiddlemana between a user rest of team. moderator can speak on behalf of team use language such as awea instead of aIa which can communicate to user that it isnat just one person handling their case, but rather entire team while keeping their identity safe. a a Something that you will notice when moderating is that there are usually some questions concerns that come up frequently. Having a modmail bot can help you better understand what your community needs are better visualize what most frequent moderator tickets are about. With this knowledge, you can create custom quick-replies that you your team can use to more efficiently resolve tickets! Having same response to a scam DM that is used by all moderators on your server makes responding to those types of tickets quick, easy, consistent. Moderators can copy paste replies, use custom commands to reply with pre-made messages. Once you have set up quick replies, you can answer many tickets without needing to think of how to reply, making your replies consistent no matter who is responding to a ticket. Here are a few examples of situations you can make tailored custom-replies for ease, speed, consistency: It is important to know limitations drawbacks of modmail bots before deciding if your community needs one. Letas explore some of ways these bots can be abused, as well as other negatives you should know about. Please keep in mind that every modmail bot is different, so you can work to choose, even code, a modmail bot that may eliminate some of these drawbacks if you are concerned about them. Modmail bots are vulnerable to spam since anyone on server can DM bot to open up a ticket. Be it a targeted spam attack multiple users reporting same thing. Some modmail bots allow you to block a member from opening up future tickets. Depending on what kind of modmail bot you use, one drawback is that some modmail bots might not save conversations between you user who made ticket, only showing reason ticket was closed. Some modmail bots will save conversation, but not any comments made by other moderators regarding inquiry inside ticket channel which can erase a lot of discussion context from replies that are made. If you want to be able to track actions, you have to prioritize a bot that does save information logs. Another drawback is learning curve from using a new bot. Members that are new to Discord that arenat familiar with modmail bots can have trouble interacting using bot to report issues. Almost all modmail bots require a user to DM bot, which can go against initial instincts be challenging to new users. Some users have their DMs turned off which makes using a modmail bot more complicated if user canat receive DM replies from bot. One solution to this is to ping user in a public channel asking for them to change their DM settings so bot can communicate with them.Members figuring out a modmail bot for first time can lead to atesta messages which will spam your modmail tickets. While these arenat a big concern are mostly harmless, depending on size of your server, multiple users atestinga how bot works can lead to a lot of time cleaning up tickets. Similarly to how a modmail bot can be a learning curve for your members, a modmail bot can also be a learning curve for your moderation team. Learning how a modmail bot works can take some time to get used to if your team has never used one before. Depending on how familiar your team is with using bots, onboarding time may vary, so be sure to set aside time for learning teaching how to use a modmail bot. We have an article on Training Onboarding New Moderators that should help with this! Uses for Modmail Bots Modmail bots can be used in a variety of ways. They not only serve as a way to communicate with moderators, but also help with organization structure can be used for other purposes. Letas look at different uses of a modmail bot, how it can make life on server easier. aQuestions. Modmail bots help users who might have questions that they donat feel comfortable asking in public. This can be questions related to server, more private sensitive matters. By using a modmail bot, moderation team can efficiently answer question depending on who knows answer, user gets a sense of privacy by not having to ask in public. As mentioned previously, having a set of quick-replies to frequently asked questions makes responding to questions a breeze. Some modmail bots even have custom command replies where you can create commands to reply with a specific text, depending on command. For example, replying with command a=helloa can reply to ticket with a premade message meant to greet user open a conversation, such as: aHello. Thank you for contacting moderation team. How can we help you today?a aBug Reports. You can implement a modmail bot in a support server that deals with bug reports. Some larger communities have two serversaone for main community, one for support, depending on community product. Organizing bug reports using a modmail bot is an easy way to keep track of issues in one place. With ability to give a closing reason, you can later search modmail logs to look back at what sort of bugs were reported by different users. aBan Appeals. Anonymity is important when dealing with troublemakers online. One way to use a modmail bot is to have a ban appeal server for users who would like to re-enter your community after being banned. With this setup appeals go through modmail system so that banned users canat talk in any channels can only interact with staff team through bot. Moderators can then review appeal together reply to banned user anonymously through bot. Community Reports. Sometimes a member of your community needs to report something to moderators that isnat rule breaking has information regarding another user that is important for team to know. A modmail bot is great for relaying these types of reports to team so everyone is notified at same time without having to utilize an emergency ping. Server Feedback. Members of your server can provide feedback using a modmail bot. Using modmail for feedback removes need for a feedback channel guarantees that team will see feedback when it is sent. Staff Applications. There are different ways you can have staff applications for a server. Depending on who needs to see evaluate application, it can make sense to use a modmail bot to receive server staff applications in smaller arenas. When an application is made, a modmail ticket will open conveniently for moderators admins to look at. You can even comment within ticket to evaluate each application, case by case! Keep in mind that there are a limited number of channels (in this case, tickets) that can be made in a channel category so this will only work for smaller servers.The above list are just some of many common ways that modmail bots can be used to strengthen communication with your server. use cases for a modmail bot is limited only by your imagination type of bot youare using! Modmail Best Practices When using a modmail bot, it is important that your moderation team is on same page. Make sure there are clear protocols of how to handle tickets. An easy way to ensure that end-user doesnat get messages sent by multiple moderators is to have a moderator say that they will handle ticket inside ticket channel itself. This way, moderators arenat stepping on each otheras toes ticket can be handled efficiently. In image below, weare using a modmail bot that sends all messages sent in ticket to user, unless it has a specific command. Other modmail bots might only send a message to user if a reply command is used, so be sure to read bot documentation to know how your modmail bot handles communication between moderators user sending a ticket. a a Another good practice is to close any old resolved tickets as quickly as possible. If user has no further questions, it can be helpful to send a final message stating that if there are no further questions, ticket will be closed soon. This way, you reduce amount of open tickets maintain a clean organized modmail.As mentioned before, anonymity in responding to tickets can help reduce amount of harassment you your moderators may receive from rule-breakers. When using a modmail bot you can use discretion when deciding whether to respond anonymously with a more personalized response, depending on situation. Here are a few scenarios where itas okay to respond regularly: In most cases, however, it is better to respond anonymously especially when dealing with any modmail tickets related to actioning punishing another user. This applies to handling ban appeals if you have such a system set up. It isnat a big deal if you reply to a question without showing your name. same is not true if you show your name to someone who has been punished on your server.Each server has its own tone style when it comes to moderation. Some servers are more formal may have an official tone, while others might have a more relaxed easygoing tone. It is important to keep this in mind when responding to modmail tickets so that your tone in modmail responses is consistent with tone set by server. This article has explored ways modmail bots can strengthen how your team communicates with your community as well as direct advantages disadvantages that exist when introducing such a bot to your server. In some ways moderation becomes significantly easier, but in other ways, negatives like spam from these bots can be overwhelming introduce new problems to solve. Moderating a server can involve a lot of different moving parts it is important to analyze your communityas needs as it grows, taking into consideration whether a modmail bot is included in that growth. Use what youave learned in this article to make a decision thatas right for you your community.If you decide that a modmail bot isnat a good fit for your community, but you still want some bot help on your server, check out our Auto Moderation on Discord article! Managing Moderation Teams Getting to Know Your Team Above all else, foundation of a good moderation team is familiarity. By knowing your fellow moderators better, what they do, where they live, youall relate to them better. Youall get to know peopleas strengths weaknesses, learn to understand them better, get a feeling for when they need help, vice versa. Though you all may be in different time zones have diverse backgrounds youare all working towards same goal which is keeping community you all care for safe. Who knows- you might find that you share a lot of same interests along way, make great new friends, deepen existing friendships during your time together as moderators. Here are a few basic things you should do to familiarize with each other: Allocating Resources A moderation team needs a clear structure a unified understanding of server moderation, which has already been covered in Developing moderator guidelines. Now weare going to expand on how to utilize each every single moderator's abilities further. A moderation team can range from a few members in a small server to a huge team with 30 more staff depending on server size. bigger your community gets more team needs to be organized. While they are all moderators, it doesnat mean they all do same job. Some of your moderators, especially experienced moderators, are likely to be in more administrative positions. They usually stay further away from general day-to-day channel moderation while newer moderators are focused on watching conversations enforcing server rules. If you do have one of these larger mod teams, consider delegating certain moderators to tasks responsibilities that theyad be best suited for, rather than having a jack of all trades, master of none situation. This allows to divide team into smaller sub-teams that talk to each other more frequently in designated channels regarding their specific mod duties. Here are a few examples of sub-teams that are common within larger communities: Moderators that primarily contribute to community by enforcing rules, watching conversations, engaging members, solving member to member conflicts showing moderation presence. same type of moderators could also exist for Voice Channels, but that is mostly for very large communities. Moderators that are extremely familiar with permissions, bots, programming, etc. Ideally, they arenat just able to operate bots youare using, but also maintain them. A custom bot tailored to your community is always something to consider. Having a bot hosted ain-housea by a moderator within your team adds an additional layer of security. Bot Team is very valuable in making new creative ideas possible especially in automating day-to-day processes. Most servers host events, from community run events to events run by staff members. Event Supervisors watch over community members hosting events, watching out for new events, while being general point of communication in hosting announcing them. These are ways of how moderators can be utilized better by giving them a designated job depending on your team's size, also giving them ability to dive into certain topics of moderation more in-depth within your community, which overall makes managing coordinating a team as a whole easier. Decision Making As server size number of moderators increases, harder it becomes to hear every voice opinion. As a team, decisions need to be made together, they need to be consistent, equitable, take into account as many different opinions as possible. Itas important to establish a system, especially when making big decisions. Often, there are decisions that need to be done right at very moment. For example, when someone posts offensive content. In most cases, a moderator will act on their perception of rules punish offenders accordingly. At that very moment, offending content has to be removed, leaving little to no time to gather a few staff members make a decision together. This is where consistency comes into play. more your moderators share equal knowledge same mindset, more consistent moderation actions get. This is why itas important to have moderator guidelines a clear structure. Itas very important to give every moderator freedom so they donat have to ask every time before they can take action, but itas also important to hear out as many opinions on any major server changes as possible, if time allows it. Growth Over time, a moderation team grows. They grow in many ways, in their abilities, in number of moderators, but also grow together as a team. Every new moderation team will face challenges they need to overcome together every already established team will face new situations that they have to adapt to deal with. Itas important to give a moderator something to work towards. Mods should look forward to opportunities that will strengthen their capabilities as a moderator strengthen teamas performance as a whole. You should let moderators know that they have potential for growth in their future as a moderator. It can be something like specializing into specific topics of moderation, like introducing them into managing setting up bots. Perhaps over time they will progress to a senior moderator focus more on administrative side of things. Discord Mod Academy can be a valuable resource in encouraging moderator growth as well. While they may be familiar with some of concepts in Discord Moderation Academy, no moderator can know everything these articles have potential to further refine their moderation knowledge enhance their abilities. Professionalism Moderators are direct representatives of your community as such should be a reflection of what an ideal community member looks like. Many things tie into showing this professionalism, ranging from how moderators chat with members in public to consistency in moderator actions. presence of a moderator should never make people uncomfortable - there needs to be a fine line between aI can chat with this moderator like with any other membera aThis is a moderator I need to take what they're saying seriouslya. Here are a few attributes in what makes a moderation team look be professional: Your team should share positivity, engage conversation, show respect for others maintain a professional look. Make it clear to your moderation team that they are a highly visible perhaps incredibly scrutinized group within your community- to conduct themselves appropriately with those aspects in mind. Problem Solving As with all group efforts, there is a possibility for friction to occur within a moderation team. This is undoubtedly something that youare all going to have to address at some point in your mod teamas lifespan. Itas very important to deal with these situations as soon as they come up. Many people don't feel comfortable dealing with conflict directly as it can be uncomfortable. However, getting to any potential problems before they become serious can prevent more severe issues from cropping up in future. goal of a problem-solving process is to make a moderation team more conflict-friendly. As a general problem solving process, you should: With that in mind, there are also situations where youad want to exercise more discretion. Something that might prompt this is when a moderator makes a mistake. It can be both uncomfortable embarrassing to be acalled outa for something, so often enough best option is to speak to someone privately if you think theyave made a mistake. After moderator understands situation acknowledges mistake, problem can be talked about with rest of team, mainly to prevent situations like these in future. Still, sometimes there are situations where problems canat be solved things get more more heated, in end separating is unavoidable. Moderators leave on their own have to be removed. Your team members should always be given option to take a break from moderation- especially to avoid burnout. You can learn more about how to deal with moderator burnout here. Reviewing Taking a moment to look back at history progression of your community your mod team can be a useful way to evaluate where your team is at where it needs to be. time frame can be of your choosing, but some common intervals can be monthly, quarterly, half year. You donat always get to talk with your moderators every day - most of us volunteer, moderating as a hobby, having our own lives while living scattered all over world. With all of that going on it can be hard to find time space to discuss things that you might feel are lacking could be changed regarding server, thatas why reviewing is important. A Community Review can be done in many ways. For most, a channel asking a few basic questions, like how community has developed since last review, how activity growth has changed, is a good way to start. Most importantly, you want to hear how moderation team is doing. Talk about mistakes that have happened recently, how they can be prevented, review some of moderator actions that have been taken. A review allows everyone to share their thoughts, see what everyone is up to, deal with more long term issues. It also allows giving your moderators feedback on their performance. Summary essence of managing a moderation team is to be open-minded, communicate to listen to each other. Endeavor to manage decisions confront problems in an understanding, calm, professional way. Give moderators opportunity to grow, designated tasks, but also time to review, break rest. Remember, youare in this together! Protecting Against Scams on Discord Internet Safety Checklist Internet Safety doesnat have to be exhausting. Below are some simple but effective ways to make sure youare on guard against any potential neaer-do-wells in your DMs, even outside of Discord. Only Open Trusted Links from Those You Know This may feel like a given, but a surprising amount of security issues stem from people clicking on links before checking if theyare real deal. Always double-check a link youare clicking a link shortening services can easily mask unsafe websites programs. We recommend getting it checked against a resource like VirusTotal to see if someone has already flagged it as potentially dangerous. In addition, Discord has its own systems in place to remove malicious links weare constantly evolving those systems. Donat Download Programs Run Code You Donat Recognize Itas not advised to download run software that doesnat come from a reputable source. Downloading running programs that someone sends you unprompted is almost always a bad idea.If a person claiming to have aspecial access to featuresa new software says they need you to run on your own computer, theyare misleading you in order to get your personal info with their shady programs. If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. Never Give Your Password to Anyone Thereas no reason to give it up, ever. Sharing your password not only gives away access to your account but also exposes any personal information you have tied to that account a potentially any website where you use that password a making you vulnerable to more than just a single account takeover. Discord Safety Checklist above tips can be applied anywhere on internet! Next, we'll share some Discord-specific tips to ensure you can be vigilant against baddies targeting your account community: Decide Who Can Canat Send You DMs Disabling DMs for a particular server is one of best ways to prevent bad apples hiding inside larger communities from contacting you. To adjust who can canat DM you, head into User Settings > Privacy & Safety, then scroll down to aServer Privacy Defaults.a From there, youall find option to aAllow direct messages from server members.a Feel free to adjust it as you wish, but do note that this new state only applies to servers joined after changing toggle; it wonat retroactively affect your existing servers. If you turn this option off, members of newly-joined servers canat contact you via DM unless youare friends with them beforehand. Receiving mail might be nice, but receiving suspicious messages from people you donat know is less nice. If you're in a server you trust donat mind being messaged by those in it, you can toggle privacy setting on an individual basis. Head to that server on desktop mobile select its name to open server's settings, choose aPrivacy Settings.a Once there, youall find aAllow direct messages from server members" option. Turn that on, youare free to receive all sorts of DMs from everyone in that server, regardless of if youare friends not! If youave joined a lot of communities, consider auditing list see if youare comfortable with letting non-friends message you from that server, if opening up is inviting unnecessary risk into your inbox. Audit your Serveras Permissions Understanding which permissions your mods members have access to is key to keeping everyone within it safe. If you're a server owner, have you checked your permissions list lately? Who has what perms? Did you know they had that access for how long? If answer to any of these questions was a resounding :shrug_emoji:, itas time to do a review of your server setup to ensure that only those who really need powerful permissions have them. Specifically, make sure that only moderators you trust have access to permissions that can change powerful server tools, including any bots webhooks you might add to server. Be vigilant for bots that are impersonating larger well-known bots. In almost every case, any large reputable moderation bot will never need admin permissions to work properly. Only give a bot permissions required for tasks you need no more a look for a Verified checkmark on a well-known bot before adding it. If you need a refresher on how permissions on Discord work, you can check out Help Center article here. If you have a basic understanding of permissions system want a more comprehensive look at what they mean in a moderation sense, we also have this article from Discord Moderation Academy. Keep Invite Links Updated If you update your serveras links, make sure that your community potential newcomers are aware of changes update any social media pages where you shared them. If possible, delete references to old invite links make it known that those links have been updated. This is doubly-so for servers Partnered, Verified Level 3-boosted servers that utilize a vanity URL: if your server loses changes its custom invite link, nefarious communities may swoop in claim your old one. If this happens before you update your public-facing invites, people trying to join your community may instead join a server thatas looking to cause trouble. A In addition to updating existing links, consider implementing easy-to-follow community rules around invite sharing encouraging members to always verify where a server invite leads who it is coming from before clicking it. Pro Tip: Try pasting one of those invites to a Discord message to preview where it leads to before opening it! (But of course, donat make your invite testing look like a spam message by pasting a random invite in #general.) Why Would Someone Want Access to My Account? If someone gains control of your Discord account, they will have as much reign over your account as you do: Theyall have ability to change your username, password, email tied to account, any other information associated with your account. Theyall also be able to see any personal info associated with your account once theyare in it. While most consider apersonal infoa to be payment info email, it can also contain your private conversations messages in DMs servers alike. If you can see it, theyall be able to see it. As if they were new owner of any servers you own, theyall be able to make any changes they want: from server layout to server permissions, to bots webhooks to kicking everyone out of server, you name it. If your account is moderator of a server that a hacker is targeting, they might even use you as a stepping stone to cause further damage within community, even impersonate you to trick unsuspecting members. Some users may also target Discord accounts that have unique profile badges that are no longer available, such as Early Supporter Early Verified Bot Developer badges. If you have one of these unique badges, you should be extra-vigilant with your account. If your account is taken over hacker changes password, there isnat much you can immediately do to stop them. However, if you have 2-Factor Authentication enabled on your account, hacker will also be required to provide a 2FA code to change your password. We strongly recommend enabling 2FA, you can learn how in our 2FA blog post. Reporting what happened to Discord can help you regain ownership of your account, which can be done here a let us help you! Additional Reading: Common Scams Weave created an additional blog post describing types of scams floating around on Discord, which you can check out to familiarize yourself with signs that you may be dealing with a hacker who needs to be blocked: Common Scams What to Look Out For We recommend sharing it with larger communities that may benefit from this knowledge. With these recommendations in your pocket, youall be better able to foil any potential digital threats. Just like with keeping your IRL-self healthy whole, taking preventative measures can keep your virtual self safe secure. Stay safe out there! Scams What to Look out for Fake Games, Programs, Videos Downloads In this situation, a user pretending to be your friend, using a friendas compromised account, reaches out asking you to check out their video, test a game they made, practice running code they wrote. No matter backstory, theyall always ask you to download a program click a link they provide, resulting in a malicious program entering your computer and/or compromising your account. Another variation of this scheme involves a user asking you to atesta something for them, directing you to open developer tools on your internet browser while logged into web app. Theyall then ask you to show them your token a do not do this. With your token, malicious users can sign in take over your account. Discord will never ask you for your token, you should never have any reason to open Discordas Developer Console in first place. Note that this is only applicable to Discord on your internet browser, not desktop mobile application. a Fake Giveaways/NFT Drops This is similar to previous scheme in that usually it is, again, a trusted individual that DMs you. Sometimes it's in form of a well-known bot under facade that they are an administrator for a server that you're active in. It may involve very genuine-looking links to websites as well. Like we said, if it's too good to be true, it likely is. Discord Impersonation for Partner/Verified/HypeSquad Discord impersonation involves a hacker pretends to be messaging you from an aofficial Discord accounta offer entry to one of our community initiatives, such as HypeSquad Partner programs. This is nearly always fake. Below are two screenshots, both of which present themselves as official Discord-sent messages. However, of these two conversations, only right screenshot is actually from Discord. On right, you can note blurple aSystema tag next to senderas name, as well as Reply space being replaced with a unique banner that only official system messages come with. DM on left does its best to be convincing though. It even sends an invite link to a real Discord-run server called Discord Testers a somewhat-real-looking link to supposed Discord Hypesquad form. Scammers will use a technique of mixing real Discord invite links (to public Discord servers usually) with their malicious links in order to portray legitimacy lull you into a false sense of security. If you suss out that a DM is a fake, report it as Spam using red aReport Spama button at top of DM. This feature is one of many improvements that weare working on to help identify remove bad actors as soon as weare aware of them. a Free Nitro Scams One of oldest scams is temptation of afree Nitro.a While we canat discount people who may be truly full of generosity believe in gifting Nitro, getting a random DM from a stranger claiming to have chosen *you* for a Nitro giveaway is incredibly sus, most likely a scam. Discord will never ask you to scan a QR code in order to redeem a Nitro code. Do NOT scan any QR codes from people you donat know those you canat verify as legitimate. If you ever use QR Code Login to sign in to Discord, make sure youare using desktop app, if youare on web app, that your URL bar says ahttps://discord.com/logina exactly as it's written. above tactics are some of ways that scammers may attempt to socially-engineer you into giving up your information. Even if you donat click any of their links, it's best to simply block report them to us, rather than engage further. We encourage you to share this article with friends who may not be as informed as you a when everyoneas aware, our communities are safer than ever. Hereas a quick link back to Protecting Against Scams on Discord too. Stay safe out there! How Trust-Safety Addresses Violent Extremism on Discord Our History with Violent Extremism Weave been paying close attention to violent extremist groups movements ever since we learned how organizers of 2017 Unite Right Rally in Charlottesville, Virginia utilized Discord to plan their hateful activities. Back then, Discord Trust & Safety was a team of one, just beginning to make difficult decisions about how to properly moderate platform. Almost four years later, our Trust & Safety Team makes up 15% of Discordas near-400 employees splits its time between responding to user reports now proactively finding removing servers users engaging in high-harm activity like violent extremist organizing. Trust & Safety has spent a lot of time since 2017 trying to ensure that another event like Charlottesville isnat planned on our platform. Our team developed frameworks based on academic research on violent extremist radicalization behavior to better identify extremist users who try to use Discord to recruit organize. We keep up-to-date on research that can lend insight into how to evaluate understand extremist behavior online, our recent partnerships with organizations like Global Internet Forum for Countering Terrorism (GIFCT) Tech Against Terrorism (TAT) are intended to support this effort. How We Identify Violent Extremism Categorizing violent extremism itself is difficult because not all extremists have same motives believe in same ideas. Some individuals who adopt violent ideologies act on their beliefs by joining organized hate, terrorist, violent extremist groups. Others donat want to officially identify themselves as belonging to a particular movement, may instead form looser connections with others who have adopted same worldview. Different cultural contexts also influence belief systems behaviors, so violent extremist ideologies in one country will naturally be different from those on other side of world. Violent extremism is nuanced ideologies tactics behind them evolve fast. We donat try to apply our own labels identify a certain atypea of extremism. Instead, we evaluate user accounts, servers, content that is flagged to us based on common characteristics patterns of behavior, such as: Itas important to note that presence of one two of these signals doesnat automatically mean that we would classify a server as aviolent extremist.a While we might use these signs to help us determine a user spaceas intent purpose, we always want to understand context in which user content is posted before taking any action. How Did We Do on January 6? On day of Insurrection, our Trust & Safety agents were reviewing reports of hate speech, glorification of violence, misinformation about what was transpiring. We feel very fortunate that our team was able to locate remove many of most harmful servers dedicated to coordinating violence on January 6. Our ability to move proactively on servers advocating for violence was thanks to two main factors: first, we were able to surface reports from users on these spaces quickly; second, our Trust & Safety agents dedicated to countering violent extremism had been tracking these spaces ever since allegations of election fraud regarding 2020 U.S. presidential election had begun to spread. We believe itas important to talk about line we walk with Discord users who discuss politics to organize political activities like protests. Many people are frustrated with how society works how some governmental societal systems are structured. Naturally, people have strong opinions on how things should shouldnat change. Now more than ever, itas important for meaningful conversations, debates, exchanges of ideas to take place. Weare glad that users across world have turned to Discord to discuss their opinions beliefs, to organize, to advocate for change they want to see. Discord Trust & Safetyas objective is to ensure that no harm comes to our users, to society at large, because of actions taken on Discord, which is why we donat tolerate activities that promote advocate for violence. When weare reviewing reports for violent extremism, while itas sometimes clear when users servers have crossed that line, in many cases thereas a lot more context to consider. One of most difficult responsibilities of our work is balancing mitigation of potential harm without appearing as if we are overstepping any boundaries censoring meaningful conversation. Looking to Future Because of these values, we plan to continue standing firm against ideologies of hate that violent extremist communities espouse, we are excited to work with other platforms organizations that seek to do same. Stay tuned for more updates. We know that we canat solve violent extremism alone, but weall continue to do our best to make sure that communities on Discord reflect our company values. We want Discord a internet as a whole a to be a space for positive interactions creating belonging. If you would like to report dangerous harmful activity to Trust & Safety team, please do so using our report form. If youare unsure how to report a user server, take a look at dis.gd/HowToReport. How we investigate When we receive a report from a Discord user, Trust & Safety team looks through available evidence gathers as much information as possible. This investigation is centered around reported messages, but can expand if evidence shows that thereas a bigger violation. For example, we may investigate whether entire server is dedicated to bad behavior, if behavior appears to be part of a wider pattern. We spend a lot of time on this process because we believe context in which something is posted is important can change meaning entirely. We might ask reporting user for more information to help our investigation. Responding to user reports is an important part of our Trust & Safety teamas work, but we know there is also violating content on Discord that might go unreported. This is where we get proactive. Our goal is to stop bad actors their activity before anyone else encounters it. We prioritize getting rid of worst-of-the-worst content because it has absolutely no place on Discord, because risk of harm is high. We focus our efforts on exploitative content, in particular non-consensual pornography sexual content related to minors, as well as violent extremism. Please note: We do not monitor every server every conversation. Privacy is incredibly important to us we try to balance it thoughtfully with our duty to prevent harm. However, we scan images uploaded to our platform to detect child sexual abuse material. When we have data suggesting that a user is engaging in illegal activity violating our policies, we investigate their networks, activity on Discord, their messages to proactively detect accomplices determine whether violations have occurred. a a Four steps to a super safe server 1. Set up roles permissions Roles are one of building blocks of managing a Discord server. They give your members a fancy color, but more importantly, each role comes with a set of permissions that control what your members can cannot do in server. With roles, you can give members bots administrative permissions like kicking banning members, adding removing channels, pinging @everyone. You can find these options in Roles section of your Server Settings. Assign permissions with care! Certain permissions allow members to make changes to your server channels. These permissions are a great moderation tool, but be wary of who you grant this power to. Changes made to your server canat be undone. You can learn more about implementing roles permissions in Role Management 101 our Setting Up Permissions FAQ article. 2. Set a verification level Server verification levels allow you to control who can send messages in your server. Setting a high verification level is a great way to protect your server from spammers raids. You can find this option in Safety Setup section of your Server Settings. 3. Enable server-wide 2FA When enabled, server-wide two-factor authentication (2FA) requires all of your moderators administrators to have 2FA enabled on their accounts in order to take administrative actions, like deleting messages. You can read more about 2FA here. By requiring all admin accounts to have 2FA turned on, you protect your server from malicious users who might try to compromise one of your moderators' administrators' accounts then make unwanted changes to your server. If you are server owner, you can enable 2FA requirement for moderation in Safety Setup section of your Server Settings. You must have 2FA enabled on your own account before you can enable this option! 4. Explicit image filter explicit image filter automatically blocks messages in a server that may contain explicit images in channels not marked as Age-restricted. You can control this feature so that it applies to all server members, just to members without roles a you can turn this feature off altogether. Age-restricted channels are exempt from explicit image filter. Turning this filter on allows your server members to share content while reducing risk of explicit images being posted in channels that are not age-restricted. You can access this setting by navigating to Server Settings, under Moderation, select SafetySetup, then find Explicit image filter heading. What is Discord? Discord Glossary Discord has its own vocabulary. You might hear your teen students using these words when talking about Discord. Server: Servers are spaces on Discord. They are made by specific communities friend groups. vast majority of servers are small invitation-only. Some larger servers are public. Any user can start a new server for free invite their friends to it. Channel: Discord servers are organized into text voice channels, which are usually dedicated to specific topics can have different rules. DMs GDMs: Users can send private messages to other users as a direct message (DM), as well as start a voice video call. Most DMs are one-on-one conversations, but users have option to invite up to nine others to conversation to create a private group DM (GDM), with a maximum size of ten people. Group DMs are not public require an invite from someone in group to join. Go Live: users can share their screen with other people who are in a server a DM with them. Nitro: Nitro is Discordas premium subscription service. Nitro offers special perks for subscribers, such as option to customize your Discord Tag, ability to use custom emotes in every server, a higher file upload cap, discounted Server Boosts. Server Boosts: If your teen is a big fan of a community, they might want to boost communityas server (or their own). Like Nitro, Server Boosts give servers special perks like more custom emotes, better video voice quality, ability to set a custom invite link. Server Boosts can be bought with Nitro purchased separately. Student Hubs: Discord Hubs for Students allow students to verify their Discord account with their official student email, unlock access to an exclusive hub for students at their school. Within hub, they can connect with other verified students, discover servers for study groups classes, share their own servers for fellow students to join. Hubs are not affiliated with managed by a school school staff. Servers in a Hub are student-run but may include non-students. For more information on Student Hubs, please check out our Student Hubs FAQs. Why people love Discord Below, you can see just a few of our favorite stories about what people are doing on Discord why they love it. You can find even more stories about how people use Discord right here. Cyndie, a parent of two from North Carolina, reflects on how her family uses Discord: aThere are four of us we all have Discord installed on both our computers phones. My oldest son is in an apartment, younger one is on campus, so we use Discord to make family plans. Everything gets dropped into that server. From dinneras ready to internships job offers. Usually itas silly, stupid stuff we just drop in that makes us all laugh, like when thereas a Weird Al question on Jeopardy. I canat imagine life without it.a Genavieve, a high-school student from California, talks about how her classes use Discord: "I've been using Discord for last two years as my main communication with my friends. We had too many people in our group chat wanted a platform where we could all communicate with each other. Discord is a great way for a friend group of thirty people to stay in touch! Also, with distance learning in place, Iave started using it with my AP Physics class too. It's been so important to feel connected to our teachers each other when we are so isolated in such a difficult class. Using Discord brought us closer together as a class a we are already a small class of 22 students, so being able to joke around send memes helps us not feel so alone during distance learning. different channels @mentions make it much easier to keep information straight. Screenshare makes it even easier, so we can show each other documents problems we are working on to get feedback troubleshooting advice.a David, a physics math tutor from New Jersey, talks about how he teaches students connects with other teachers over Discord: "I use Discord to tutor one of my students to stay up to date with conversations announcements in a group of physics teachers interested in physics education research. It's nice to see a side-by-side camera view of my desk with student's work. I also really like that audio through OPUS codec which sounds very clean." a a Reporting Abusive Behavior to Discord Reporting a Message If violation happened in a server, you can also reach out to serveras moderators, who may be able to respond immediately help resolve your concerns. In addition, please remember that you always have ability to block any users that you donat want to interact with anymore. Do not mislead Discordas support teams. Do not make false malicious reports to our Trust & Safety other customer support teams, send multiple reports about same issue, ask a group of users to report same content issue. Repeated violations of this guideline may result in loss of access to our reporting functions. What to do if you receive a violent threat, someone is at risk of Self-harm If a credible threat of violence has been made you someone else are in immediate danger, if someone is considering self-harm is in immediate danger, please contact your local law enforcement agency. Additionally, if you are in United States, you can contact Crisis Text Line to speak with a volunteer crisis counselor to help you a friend through any mental health crisis by texting DISCORD to 741741. Select type of abuse you're seeinga Reports Under EU Digital Services Act EU users can report illegal content under EU Digital Services Act by clicking here. EU government entities reporting illegal content should follow process outlined here. EU users will be required to go through a verification process follow prompts to provide details descriptions for their report. When reporting a message under EU Digital Services Act, a message URL is required. Hereas how to find message URL for desktop mobile apps. Desktop App Mobile App What Happens After I Submit a Report? When you submit a report, weall send a system DM email to let you know that we have received it. Reports are processed based on priority as described below, we use a combination of automated human-powered review methods to process reports. We may also let you know if there are safety features available that could help you address potential harm more quickly. time it takes for us to review a report depends on type of content severity of violation: Report review times may fluctuate due to process changes, volume surges, technical issues, backlogs. While not every report identifies a violation of Discordas policies, your reports help us improve enhance Discord's safety practices. We will let you know if we identified a violation of our policies based on your report. When you submit a report, your identity is not shared with account you reported. This is true even if report is appealed. We never intentionally disclose identity of a reporter unless we are legally required to do so. Examples of when this may be case are if Discord receives valid legal process requiring us to provide identity of reporter requests to remove content under Digital Millennium Copyright Act (aDMCAa). DMCA allows reported user to request further details about complaint, including name email address of claimant, a description of allegedly infringed work, reported content. In such cases, Discord provides this information in accordance with copyright law requirements. You can read more about reports we receive actions we take on violations of our Community Guidelines Terms of Service in our Transparency Report. Mental health on Discord Contact your server admins If someone has posted comments about harming themselves in a server, you may consider reaching out to your server administrators owner to let them know about situation, so they can moderate their server as needed provide support to server member. Provide some support resources If you are still in touch with user, you may wish to provide them with one of help hotlines listed below. Talk to a parent trusted adult You may not feel qualified to help a friend who expresses their desire to hurt themselves, it may be helpful to ask a parent another trusted adult for help in handling situation. Report to Trust & Safety All Discord users can report policy violations right in app by following instructions here. When we receive reports of self-harm threats, we investigate situation may contact authorities, but in event of an emergency, we encourage you to contact law enforcement in addition to contacting us. Please note that for privacy security reasons we are unable to provide personal information such as contact information location to someone who is not account holder. If you are concerned that someone is in immediate danger, please contact law enforcement. Contact law enforcement If you another user you know is in urgent trouble, please contact authorities right away, regardless of limited information you might be able to provide. Law enforcement has investigative resources can contact Discord Trust & Safety for information that we aren't allowed to disclose otherwise can identify those users to get them help. Support networks online communities can play a key role in helping people who are experiencing mental health issues. We support mental health communities on Discord where people can come together, we want these spaces to remain positive healthy. When we receive reports of users communities discussing encouraging self-harm, we review such content carefully, we take into account context in which comments are posted. We will take action on communities users that promote, encourage, glorify suicide self-harm. This includes content that encourages others to cut injure themselves content that encourages glorifies eating disorders. Suicide Prevention Substance Abuse Support Eating Disorder Support Child Abuse Domestic Violence LGBTQ+ Support How Discord Works with Law Enforcement What is Discord? Discord is a voice, video, text chat app that's used by tens of millions of people ages 13+ to talk hang out with their communities friends. vast majority of servers are private, invite-only spaces for groups of friends communities to stay in touch spend time together. There are also larger, more open communities, generally centered around specific topics. Users have control over whom they interact with what their experience on Discord is. More information about Discord our community goals can be found here. Contact Information Service of Process Please submit your inquiry in our Government Request Portal at: https://app.kodex.us/discord/signin. Our online portal will guide you through how to submit a request. You will need to: 1. Verify your email address via link sent to your email address (only valid law enforcement government domains will be accepted);2. Fill in required fields in webform;3. Upload a copy of any relevant documents in PDF format (for example, a copy of subpoena search warrant, as well as any non-disclosure order you may have). Our online portal also allows you to add information, ask us questions, download information when it is available. Emergency Requests Preservation Request International Legal Requests Child Safety Policy Data Retention Policy User Notification It is our policy to notify Discord users provide them with a copy of legal process seeking their account information. We do not provide notice if we are prohibited by law under exceptional circumstances such as child sexual exploitation investigations threat to life emergencies. We ask that your non-disclosure order (18 U.S.C. A 2705(b)) similar legal authority include a time limitation, as we provide delayed notice upon expiration of this limitation when we believe exceptional circumstance no longer exists. If no non-disclosure provision exception is included with your legal request, Discord will confirm with law enforcement before providing user notice. In order to expedite your legal request for account information, we ask that you include inform us initially of one of following: Note: Discord reserves right to not notify users if doing so would pose a risk to Discord its users general welfare. If your data request places Discord on notice of an ongoing prior violation of our Terms of Service, Community Guidelines other policies, we may take action to prevent further abuse, including account termination other actions that may notify user that we are aware of their misconduct. Cost Reimbursement a aEU Contact Points Still have questions? If needed for mail service, our physical address is as follows: For requests relating to all users other than those in EEA UK: Discord, Inc. 444 De Haro St, Suite 200 San Francisco, CA, 94107United States of AmericaFor requests relating to users in EEA UK: Discord Netherlands BVSchiphol Boulevard 195, 1118 BG Schiphol, Netherlands If serving process by mail, please direct mail to attention of Legal Department. a Our Policies Weare all about helping millions of communities, small big, find a home online to talk, hang out, have meaningful conversations. That means we need to find right balance between giving people a place to express themselves promoting a welcoming safe environment for everyone. Our Approach to Content ModerationA We currently employ three levers to moderate user content on Discord, while being mindful of user privacy:A Our Community Guidelines define what is isn't okay to do on Discord. Every person on Discord should feel like their voice can be heard, but not at expense of someone else. If you come across a message that appears to break these rules, please report it to your server moderator to us. If content behavior violates our Guidelines we may take a number of enforcement actions including but not limited to issuing warnings; removing content; disabling removing accounts and/or servers responsible; reporting them to law enforcement. Learn more about our Community Guidelines here Terms of Service here. a a What actions we take When our Trust & Safety team confirms that there has been a violation of our Community Guidelines, team takes immediate steps to mitigate harm and, wherever possible, help users avoid breaking rules in future. following are actions that we might take on either users and/or servers: Discord also works with law enforcement agencies in cases of immediate danger and/or self-harm. We swiftly report child abuse material content users responsible to National Center for Missing Exploited Children. a a How You Can Appeal Our Actions Every user can appeal actions taken against their account.A While we do our best to ensure that weare only taking action when itas warranted, weare not perfect mistakes might happen. We recognize appeals are an important part of process. Just as you deserve a chance to be heard when some action is taken against you offline, you should have such a chance to be heard when action is taken against your Discord account by us. process reflects Discord's commitment to internationally recognized human rights set out in United Nations Guiding Principles on Business Human Rights (UNGPs), privacy, free expression. If you think we took unwarranted action against your account, you can reach out to us so we can review your case.A You may appeal decision directly in Discord app by going to User Settings > Privacy & Safety > selecting violation you want to appeal > pressing on Let us know to begin submitting a review of your violation account. For users in EU, you may also choose an alternative resolution option when applicable. What happens when we grant an appeal? If our reviewers find that violation was issued in error, we will remove it from your account restore your account standing. Any actions that were result of that violation will be removed. If there are other active violations on your account, you may still not regain full access to Discord. You can read more about violations in Discord Warning System. What if my appeal was denied? If our reviewers find that action taken was correct, we will send a message to let you know. violation will remain on your account until it expires, if applicable. You can view any active expired violations in Privacy & Safety Settings > Account Standing. What if my appeal was deemed ineligible for review? In some cases, we are unable to review certain appeals due to nature of violation incomplete information provided. Even if we canat review appeal, your feedback helps us improve these systems over time. If your teen encounters an issue Even though majority of Discord usage is in small, private, invite-only groups, we understand that there may be times when people in these groups behave in ways that make others uncomfortable post content that isnat allowed. Our Community Guidelines outline how all users should act on Discord what we allow do not allow. We recommend reviewing these with your teen so that you both know what behavior is isnat okay on platform. Among other things, we do not allow: If your teen encounters a violation of our Community Guidelines, such as harassment inappropriate content, please file a report with details that you can gather. Our Trust & Safety team strives to ensure bad users don't disrupt your teenas experience on Discord. We also provide a number of tools to ensure that teens (and everyone else) have control over their Discord experience. a a Answering parents' educators' top questions 1. Is Discord safe for my teens to use? There are a few things that make Discord a great safe place for teens: To help your teen use Discord safely, itas important to understand how Discord works how you can best control your teenas experience on it. We have listed a number of tips to do so here. Just like with every other online service, best way to ensure your teen stays safe online is to have clear guidelines on what they should shouldnat be looking at posting online, make sure that you keep clear lines of communication with them. 2. What is minimum age to be on Discord? How do you ensure teens under 13 canat create an account? Discord's Terms of Service require people to be over a minimum age to access our app website. minimum age to access Discord is 13, unless local legislation mandates an older age. To ensure that users satisfy that minimum age requirement, users are asked to confirm their date of birth upon creating an account. Learn more about how we use this age information here. If a user is reported as being under 13, we delete their account unless they can verify that they are at least 13 years old using an official ID document. 3. What personal information does Discord collect about my teen? Do you sell it? Discord does not ask for a real name when a user signs up, we do not sell user data. To learn more about what information we collect how we use this information, please see our Privacy Policy. 4. Can my teen be exposed to inappropriate content on Discord? Like on every internet platform, there is age-restricted content on Discord. Each user chooses which servers they want to join who they want to interact with. In servers, age-restricted content must be posted in a channel marked as age-restricted, which cannot be accessed by users under 18. For Direct Messages, we recommend that every user under 18 activates explicit media content filter by selecting "Keep Me Safe" under "Safe Direct Messaging" heading in Privacy & Safety section of their User Settings. When a user chooses "Keep Me Safe" setting, images videos in all direct messages are scanned by Discord explicit media content is blocked. We believe that best way to make sure that your teenagers are only accessing content that they should is to set clear guidelines on what they should shouldnat be looking at posting online, make sure that you keep clear lines of communication with them. 5. Can my teen interact with people they donat know on Discord? Unlike other platforms where someone might be able to message you as soon as you sign up for an account (before you have added any friends joined any servers), this isnat case on Discord. In order for another user to send a direct message (DM)A to your teen, your teen must either (1)A accept other user as a friend (2) decide to join a server that other user is a member of. Each user has control over following: Users should only accept friend requests from users that they know trust. If your teen isnat sure, thereas no harm in rejecting friend request. They can always add that user later if itas a mistake. If your teen is ever uncomfortable interacting with someone on Discord, they can always block that specific user. Blocking a user removes them from your teen's Friends List, prevents them from messaging your teen directly, hides their messages in any shared servers. 6. Are there parental controls on Discord I can use to control my teen's account? We have detailed all controls you have to help make your teenas account safer here. We recommend going through these settings together with your teen having an open conversation about why you are choosing certain settings. iOS Android operating systems offer parental controls that can help you manage your teen's phone usage, including Discord, if needed. Apple Microsoft offer similar controls for computers. 7. How can I monitor what my teen is doing on Discord? Privacy is incredibly important to us, including your teenas privacy. We canat share their login information with you, but we encourage you to discuss how to use Discord safely directly with your teen. 8. What are Student Hubs? Discord Hubs for Students allow students to verify their Discord account with their official student email, unlock access to an exclusive hub for students at their school. Within hub, they can connect with other verified students, discover servers for study groups classes, share their own servers for fellow students to join. Hubs are not affiliated with managed by a school school staff. Servers in a Hub are student-run but may include non-students. For more information on Student Hubs, please check out our Student Hubs FAQs. 9. What safety measures are in place for students participating in Student Hubs? Only those with a school-assigned email address can access a schoolas specific hub. Click here to dive into our Student Hubs guidelines. All servers users in hub must also comply with our Community Guidelines, Terms of Service, Privacy Policy. We also have all of our existing moderator controls for servers, such as setting specific roles access to #channels in a server, blocking, banning, mod bots, more. Students can also submit a report from within their hub to bring attention to any inappropriate behavior. Role of administrators moderators on Discord Administrators are people who create Discord servers around specific interests. They establish rules for participating, can invite people to join, oversee health well-being of their community. They have broad administrative control, can bring in moderators to manage community members. They can also ban remove members and, if necessary, remove replace moderators. Administrators also choose moderators to play a vital role in Discord communities. responsibilities of a moderator might vary, but their overall role is to ensure that their Discord server is a safe, healthy environment for everyone. They can do things like moderate delete messages, as well as invite, ban, suspend people who violate serveras rules. best moderators typically are seasoned enthusiastic participants in one more communities. Admins moderators are your first go-to when you encounter an issue in a server. They may be able to respond immediately help resolve your concerns. Each Discord server should have written rules for behavior to alleviate confusion misunderstanding about guidelines for that particular community. These rules, which supplement our Community Guidelines, are your tools to moderate efficiently transparently. As communities grow, moderators can add more mods to keep their server a fun welcoming place to be. a a

Discord @ GDC 2025 Discord is back ready for yet another incredible Game Developers Conference 2025. Find us at Discord booth on Expo Floor in South Hall (#S1627). GDC 2025 Programming Schedule Whether itas your first time at Moscone Center your 10th, weave got lots of events to help inspire kickstart your game-building experience on Discord. A Game Developer's Guide: Building Running Your Discord Community Presented by: Colin Loretz, Senior Developer Advocate, Discord a Learn how to leverage Discord as a powerful tool for early-stage game development community building. This talk provides practical insights into creating managing private playtest servers that foster meaningful relationships with your earliest supporters while gathering crucial gameplay feedback. Discord x Wicked Saints: Power of Gaming for Well-Being Presented by: Savannah Badalich, Senior Director of Policy, Discord; Patricia Noel, Mental Health Policy Manager, Discord; Jessica Murrey, CEO + Co-Founder, Wicked Saints a Gaming has always been about more than just playaitas a space for connection, learning, personal expression. According to eMarketer, Gen Z is increasingly turning to gaming as a social space for authentic interactions. As they do so, platforms like Discord games like World Reborn are working to support their well-being. Join leaders from Discord Wicked Saints as they explore how gaming fosters meaningful relationships, supports mental health, can empower players to take real-world action. Farm Merge Valley: How CoolGames Maximized Game-Platform Fit on Discord Presented by: Ann-Marie Harbour, Director of Game Development, Discord; Laurens Rutten, CEO, CoolGames a Discover how CoolGames successfully launched Farm Merge Valley on Discord Activities, blending merge-3 puzzle genre with farming simulation to captivate millions of players. This talk explores how team optimized game for Discord's inherently social environment, driving daily player engagement fostering a vibrant community. Learn key strategies behind their adaptation process how they built a Discord community server that grew to over 250,000 members in record time. Deep Dive with Supervive: Theorycraft's Integration with Discord Social SDK Presented by: Andrew Johnston, Staff Software Engineer, Theorycraft Games a Social play is core to SUPERVIVE, integrating Discordas Social SDK helped us improve way players connect, communicate, play together. In this talk, weall walk through how we integrated Social SDK, extended existing social graph with Discord friends, enabled seamless activity invites into our party system with Discord rich presence, ensured all players, regardless of Discord linking status, could access features. Insights for Devs: Engage Grow Your Audience on Discord Presented by: Tim Liu, Staff Data Scientist, Discord; Robinson Eaton, Staff User Experience Researcher, Discord a Join Discord's data UXR teams as we dive into platform insights developer success stories that reveal what Discord's gaming audience truly cares about. Through real examples, we'll show how games of all types have built thriving communities by understanding their players leveraging Discord's unique social features. Learn practical strategies from developers who've successfully built fostered engaged communities, discover how you can apply these lessons to your own game community. Join us for a look at latest greatest on all ways we are investing in enabling game developers to tap into power of platform to fuel growth of their game. Learn about their integration journey, technical challenges, impressive milestones they achieved, making their social game accessible enjoyable for everyone. About Discord Discord is a voice, video, text communication app used by over two hundred million people to hang out play games with their friends. Discord Story Discord was made to solve one problem: how to easily talk with friends while playing online games together. But much like protagonists of our favorite game stories, all journeys have their humble beginningsa April 2012 Jason Citron establishes a new studio, Phoenix Guild, to help bring people together around games. Jason soon starts work on studioas first project, Fates Forever, a MOBA built specifically for mobile.A A APRIL 2013 Stanislav Vishnevskiy joins Jason as they continue working together on their upcoming mobile game. Summer 2014 Phoenix Guild, now named Hammer & Chisel, launches Fates Forever to critical acclaim. Some of gameas features, such as built-in voice chat, text chat forums, help lay groundwork for whatas nexta May 2015 Jason & Stan loved playing games but couldnat find a reliable way to talk while playing online. Utilizing what they learned from building Fates Forever, two release first version of a new project: a gaming-focused chat app for desktop mobile called "Discord." Spring 2016 Discord launches an in-game overlay for PC, letting players interact with their friends without leaving their game, adds a friends list to let people talk outside of servers. Discordas official API launches for first time, eventually powering hundreds of thousands of apps. Summer 2016 Discord brings power to voice call friends directly in DMs Group DMs, unleashes to world one of its most popular features of all time: ability to upload use custom emoji in servers. Early 2017 Discord introduces Discord Nitro, letting people support Discord get some slick perks in return, including power to use a serveras custom emoji anywhere set an animated avatar. Fall 2017 Discord, after long-awaited excitement hype, releases video chat screen share features to all users in DMs Group DMs. Discordas Rich Presence API releases, letting players display what theyare doing in-game, directly on Discord. Summer 2019 Discord releases Go Live, letting players stream their favorite games to their server friends in just a few clicks. Plus, Server Boosting lets members come together to help unlock extra perks for their community. Spring 2021 Discord teams up with PlayStation for account linking support, allowing people on Discord to show off what theyare playing on their PlayStation 5 console. Spring 2023 Discord introduces voice chat support for PS5 consoles reveals Activities, a way to play games directly in Discord. Plus, two audio-centric features are released: Soundboard, letting users play sound clips during voice calls, power to send Voice Messages from mobile devices. Spring 2024 Discord doubles-down on its mission to be best place to hang out before, during, after playing games. Soon after, App Launcher releases, letting people enjoy their favorite Activities anywhere on Discord. Winter 2024 Discord starts powering in-game text voice chat of games directly, with two games being first to support Discord chat: Pax Dei Omega Strikers. 2025 on... Weare continuing to make Discord best, most reliable platform to talk play for players on PC, mobile, console. Perhaps some intergalactic domination on side, who knows? Co-founder Jason Citron thinks internet is headed more in that direction.
